loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is married with three children.She has been in business for the past ten years. She runs a stationery and school supplies shop in Dar es Salaam. Her shop stocks general stationery (files, ball-point pens, marker pens, counter books, flip charts, office pins, paper clips, paper punches, etc.)

Mariam thanks all the lenders of her first loan with Kiva, which she has finished repaying. With the loan she was able to start selling primary and secondary schools textbooks. Mariam is pleased because the turnover of textbooks is high, especially in the months of January/December and June which are new semester months.

Mariam is requesting a second loan with Kiva of USD 1200 to replenish her stock of general stationery and textbooks. She has recently shifted to a new business location after the former premises she was renting was sold to a new owner. She had a hard time reorganizing herself in a new location.

loans.use: To add to her stock of stationery supplies

loans.name: Tutoatasi M.

texts.en:
Tutoatasi is 47 years of age and came from a family of 12 brothers and 1 sister. She is married with 3 children herself. Having a lot experience in elei printing, she decided to join SPBD because she thought by having a business of her own, she would be able to earn money for herself and her family.

With her first loan, Tutoatasi managed to buy the materials and elei paints needed for start-up. She's hoping that in future she will manage to own a flea market stall where she could display all her creations, especially her own designs.

loans.use: To start with her elei business

loans.name: Kamran

texts.ru:
Kamran M. was born in 1982. He was born and lives in the city of Agsu and is recently married. He owns an Internet Café. Kamran turned to the Agsu division of Normicro in order to get a loan. He plans to use the loan to purchase equipment for the Internet Café and additional computers to meet the demand of his clients.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Маджидов Камран. 1982-го года рождения. Родился и проживает в городе Ахсу. Женился недовно. Его бизнес- Интернет клуб. Обратился в Нормиакро Ахсуинского филиала для получения кредита. Получив кредит на сумму тристо манатов купил оборудоваание для клуба. Активное посишение клиетов вынуждает покупку дополнительных компьютеров. Поэтому Камран намерен взять еще кредит.

loans.use: To purchase equipment

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Pablo is a mason in the city of El Alto. His wife sells mid-quality children's and adult clothing in the market of the Ceja area in the city of El Alto. The earnings from the clothing sales are the source of income used to support their three children that are of school-age and who depend on their parents. He lives in the Chamaco Chico area of the city of La Paz.

The loan is being requested to increase the amount of and accumulate more merchandise to sell for the markets of the Christmas season. In this way, they can increase their sales and generate more income for their family.

This is the 6th loan with IMPRO. The prior loans qualify him to be approved for his loan request.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

Pablo trabaja como albañil en la Ciudad de El Alto; la esposa es comerciante de ropa para niños y adultos de mediana calidad en la feria de la Ceja de El Alto. Esta actividad es su fuente de ingresos con la que cubren la manutención de sus tres hijos que están en edad escolar y que dependen de la pareja; vive en la Zona Chamaco Chico de la Ciudad de La Paz. El crédito requiere para incrementar mercadería y acumular para las ferias navideñas de esa forma incrementar sus ventas y generar mayor ingresos para su familia. Es el sexto crédito con Impro, los antecedentes anteriores le faculta para aprobarle la solicitud realizada por el prestatario.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose O. is 55 years old, married to Mr. O.. The two have seven children and live in Benin City. There, she sells provisions and fruit drinks.

At the moment, Ms. O. is soliciting the loan amount of $450 to buy more provision and fruit drinks. She had learned this trade of business for a total of one year before starting her own business in 1996. She has been with LAPO for three years now.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and fruit drinks to sell

loans.name: Rustam

texts.en: Rustam J. was born in 1954 in Asht, Tajikistan. He is married and has 5 children. Mr J. is an active client of  MicroInvest who has recommended himself as a reliable  borrower. He has a home business in  livestock raising and  milk production. Mr J. is a foreman in his profession. The main business he is engaged in is livestock. He has a large flock. Now Mr J. requests a loan of $725 for a mixed fodder purchase.

loans.use: for a mixed fodder purchase

loans.name: Subira

texts.en:
Subira is 49 years old and is a widow with 4 children, aged 32, 30, 27, and 21. She also takes care of 2 other people, aged 40 and 70. Subira is a fish seller, and she started her business in 2007. Every day she works from 7:00 AM to 8:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

Subira now hopes for a loan to buy more fish for her business.

loans.use: To buy more fish for her business

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is 25 years old and is a married woman with 1 child, age 1 years old. Rehema owns a small shop, which she started in 2007. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $190 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Devotha's Ari Mpya Group

texts.en:
Devotha is 27 years old and is a married woman with 2 children, ages 8 and 2 years old. She and her husband also take care of 2 other people, ages 54 and 13 years old. Devotha sells clothes, shoes and handbags, and she started in 2006. Every day, she works from 9 am to 6 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to open a storefront for selling clothes, shoes and handbags. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Tumaini and Mariam, who have businesses dealing in stationery sales and a salon.

loans.use: To open a storefront for selling clothes, shoes, and handbags.

loans.name: Isomiddin

texts.en:
Mr. Isomiddin U. is married and has 5 children. He has a good reputation as a very hard working family man. MicroInvest has been working with Mr.U. since 2008 and he is a serious entrepreneur. Mr. U. raises livestock like many of his fellow villagers. He has 2 cows, a bull, and some rams.

Now Mr. U. is asking KIVA for a business development loan of $775.00 US to purchase one more pedigreed animal.

loans.use: To buy one more pedigreed animal

loans.name: Teopista Namuli's Group

texts.en:
Teopista N. is the leader of a group of four women. She is 45 years old and is divorced with five children. Her oldest child is 23 years old and her youngest is 10 years old. All of her children are in school. Teopista lives in a semi-urban slum on the outskirts of Kampala that is prone to flooding during the rainy season.

Teopista has a stall in Makawa Market and has sold her goods to people that visit the market for the past 20 years. She faces the difficulties of high transportation costs, high produce costs, and intense competition.

Teopista plans on using this loan to increase her stock of produce and to pay for her children's school fees. With the profits, Teopista will be able to maintain her current customers and increase her income. Teopista hopes to one day afford a refrigerator so she can start another business, increasing profits while continuing to support her family.

Teopista has successfully paid back seven loans to MCDT. It is through these loans that she has been able to keep her children in school and tend to the needs of her family.

loans.use: To increase stock of produce

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda is 39 years old and lives with her husband and four school age children in a small house that they own, a house that took them a lot of effort to build.

Together with her husband, she makes a living in farming and as of late in the raising of chickens, the latter is going very well due the orders that she gets from her community. The tasks on the fields she performs in the afternoons and the tending of the animals in the mornings. She has a lot of affection for her animals. It is a complicated process to get the proper and balanced food for her chickens.

The main drivers behind her work are her children, especially her 17 year old daughter who wants to become a professional. Hilda and her spouse put all their effort to be able to make their daughter’s wishes come true.

The money that she is requesting she will invest in the purchase of chickens, to fatten them up and then sell the in the local markets. She ultimately would like to have a large quantity of animals in order to improve the quality of life of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Hilda tiene 39 años, vive junto a su esposo y sus cuatro hijos estudiantes, en una pequeña casa propia, que logró construir con mucho esfuerzo.

Junto a su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y hace poco tiempo, a la crianza de gallinas, donde le está yendo muy bien debido a los pedidos que tiene en su comunidad.Las tareas del campo las realiza por las tardes y la crianza de animales por las mañanas, ella le tiene mucho cariño a sus animales, sin embargo es complicado obtener el alimento adecuado y balanceado para sus gallinas.

El principal motor de su trabajo son sus hijos, sobre todo su hija de 17 años quien desea estudiar una profesión, para ello Hilda y su pareja se esfuerzan de poder realizar los deseos de su hija.

El dinero que solicita se invertirá en la compra de gallinas, para engordarlas y luego venderlas en los mercados de su localidad, y con el tiempo, tener una gran cantidad de animales para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

loans.use: Increae the quantity of chickens that she raises for sale.

loans.name: Mai Thi

texts.vi: Là một gia đình thuần nông nên thu nhập của gia đình chị Mai chủ yếu dựa vào chăn nuôi và trồng trọt. Để kinh tế gia đình bớt khó khăn hơn anh chị đã phải làm rất nhiều nghề  để kiếm sống, từ buôn bán nhỏ đến mở cửa hàng bán đồ ăn sáng như cháo, xôi, bánh mỳ.Năm 2005 chị tham gia vào quỹ để được vay vốn phát triển kinh tế . Vòng đầu tiên chị xin vay 3.000.000 đồng chị đã mua ếch giống về chăn nuôi tại ao của gia đình, đồng thời chị còn nuôi thêm cá. Ngoài việc đầu tư chăn nuôi ếch và cá gia đình chị vẫn tiếp tục làm đồ ăn sáng phục vụ bà con. Hiện nay gia đình chị đang nuôi 5 lồng ếch thịt cứ 3 tháng cho thu hoạch một lần. Nhờ biết cách sử dụng vốn vay hiệu quả kinh tế gia đình chị Mai đã có sự thay đổi rõ rệt  thu nhập  của gia đình luôn ổn định  với mức bình quân 3.500.000 đồng /tháng. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 15.000.000đ để mua ếch giống và thức ăn phục vụ cho chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
As Mrs. Mai’s family is a traditional agrarian one, their income comes solely from live-stock and planting using traditional farming methods. In order to improve their living conditions, the couple has been trying a variety of jobs, ranging from small retail to breakfast food service. In 2005, she joined the TYM fund and was able to borrow 3,000,000 Vietnamese Dong. She bought frogs and fish to breed and raise in the pond in her yard. In addition, she continues to serve breakfast to local customers. At the moment, her family is taking care of 5 frog stalls, which can be harvested every 3 months. She managed to improve the family’s living conditions through clever use of its money. The family’s income is now stable at 3,500,000 Vietnamese Dong per month. She plans to make the next loan of 15,000,000 Vietnamese Dong to buy more frogs and food for them.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: livestock

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es: Marcelina se dedica a la venta de madera trabajada (cortada en diferentes medidas) desde ya hace varios años atrás, ingresó en este negocio gracias a su esposo Manuel, que es maderero. En la actualidad la madera la lleva a muchas mueblerías, quienes son sus principales clientes, ella se siente a gusto con su trabajo, ya que por medio del mismo apoya a su pareja para con los gastos del hogar.Marcelina quiere alquilar un local para el almacenamiento de sus maderas y de esa manera proveer a sus clientes de una forma más rápida, es para ello que solicita este préstamo, para lograr  su objetivo.
texts.en:
Marcelina sells finished lumber (cut to different measurements). She got into this business thanks to her husband Manuel who is a logger. Currently the lumber goes to many furniture shops which are their principal clients. Marcelina likes her work as it is a way to help her husband with household expenses. Marcelina wants to rent a space for lumber storage in order to provide faster service to customers. She is requesting a loan so that she can reach this objective.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rent space to store and sell lumber

loans.name: Sorie

texts.en:
Sorie is thirty-four years old. He was born in Kabala and is married with two children. His children are still not of school age. His wife is a businesswoman who sells food in a market.

Sorie is a member of a group called Try Me. He is requesting a loan of Le 800,000 to strengthen his business. He has received previous loans from Kiva through SMT. With the previous loans he was able to expand his business to include items like hardboards, sinks, tackboards, wheelbarrows and balusters. Before the loans, he was selling only  cement. He travels to Freetown (about 570 miles round-trip) to buy the materials he sells. With income generated by the loans he received from SMT, he is proud to say that today he has a shop full of building materials.

loans.use: Business Expansion

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
Sabina se dedica a la cría D. ganado vacuno cuya producción D. leche comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota D. Leche).
 
Vive en la comunidad Chuñochununi, sector Laja  D. la Provincia los Andes del departamento D. La Paz, ubicado  a tres horas  D. la ciudad D. La Paz.

Es casada, su marido se dedica a la agricultura.También tiene dos hijos (un varón D. 18 años, una mujer D. 15 años). 

El credito será invertido para comprar una vaca lechera, es el segundo credito via KIVA, con el primero adquiirio  una ternera y va mejorando su producción, por lo tanto, su calidad D. vida. 
 
La evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.
texts.en:
Sabina works raising cows whose milk she sells to PIL Andina (an industrial milk plant). She lives in the community of Chuñochununi in the Laja sector, los Andes Province, La Paz department, located three hours from the city of La Paz. She is married and her husband works in agriculture. She also has two children, an 18 year old son and a 15 year old daughter. The loan will be invested to purchase a milk cow. This is her second loan through Kiva; with the first loan she purchased a baby cow, which helped improve her production and therefore her quality of life. An evaluation performed qualifies her to receive the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Yda

texts.es: Yda tiene 27 años, está divorciada de su pareja con la cual tuvo dos hijos, Renzo de 6 años y Raúl de 1. Se dedica a la venta de artesanía, confecciona tapetes bordados, los cuales vende en las ferias de artesanos de la ciudad de Puno y también por pedidos a las islas flotantes de los Uros de lago Titicaca. La demanda por los tapetes de Yda es grande, ya que los diseños y formas que realiza en ellos son muy novedosos. Lo más difícil de su trabajo es la dificultad de realizar los bordados, ya que requieren de mucho tiempo y esfuerzo, teniendo que realizar grandes cantidades para satisfacer las necesidades del público. Yda se encuentra en su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de lana y tela para elaborar sus bordados.
texts.en:
Yda is 27 years old. She is divorced and has two children, 6 year old Renzo and 1 year old Raúl. She sells handicrafts and makes embroidery mats to sell on artisan fairs in the city of Puno. She also sells products on demand to Los Uros Island or the Titicaca Lake. Yda’s business is very successful due to the unique designs and shapes she makes on her pieces of embroidery. The hardest part of her job is to finish the embroideries, as they require hard work and time which makes it difficult to satisfy her customer’s needs. This is her first loan request to Microfinanzas Prisma. She will use the money to purchase more wool and fabric to make more pieces of embroidery.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase material for her embroideries

loans.name: Alakara Group

texts.en:
Jane A. (in the front on the left) is 38 years old, married with 7 children. She has 6 years' experience in selling foodstuffs such as fish, sweet potatoes, green vegetables, and pounded groundnuts. She purchases cereals from the wholesalers whereas she gets the sweet potatoes and vegetables from village farmers.

Her profit margin lies at approximately 25% of sales. Jane is using the loan to purchase fish, sweet potatoes, and groundnuts. Her ambition is to become a cereals wholesaler.She is a hard-working lady and thereby helps her husband in caring for the family.

loans.use: Purchase fish, sweet potatoes, and groundnuts for re-sale

loans.name: Rami

texts.en: Rami N. is 36 years old. He is married with two children. He is a small entrepreneur who sells home products, cookies and bananas since 1998. This is the one and only financial source for his family. His store is very famous in his community thus allowing him to have a good clientele. Today Rami is requesting a loan of 1200 USD for the term of 15 months to increase his stock. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. Rami’s main goal is to educate his beloved children so that someday they’ll become successful entrepreneurs. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: increase his stock by purchasing more food stuff

loans.name: Alina Isabel

texts.es: Alina desde muy joven se ha incorporado a las actividades organizativas y productivas a traves de sus padres, en la actualidad es socia de la cooperativa COPACSELES mediante la cual pretende incorporarse a la sociedad para la construccion de un trillo arrocero de propiedad colectiva, donde se procesara la industrializacion del cultivo de arroz y dentro de sus sueños esta pertenecer a esta sociedad y accesar a los servicios, ya que junto a sus padres son pequeños productores de arroz y necesitan trillar su produccion a menor costo, por lo que solicita este financiamiento.
texts.en:
From a very early age Alina has been involved in production and organizational activities through her parents. She is currently a member of the COPASELES cooperative, where she intends to become involved in the group building a collectively-owned rice threshing machine which can be used to industrialize the cultivation of rice.

One of her dreams is to belong to this group and have access to its services as her parents are small rice farmers and need to thresh their produce at a lower cost. This is the reason she is requesting this loan.


Translated from Spanish by Ines Teles, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Contibution towards the construction of a rice threshing machine

loans.name: Urunbay

texts.en:
M. Urunbay is 59 years old. He and his wife have raised three children together. Urunbay is an experienced bread baker. He has been doing this business for more than 20 years. He bakes the national bread, “lepeshka,” at home. His children and wife help him with his business. 

Having many customers, Urunbay sells the majority of his products just from his home. However, he also runs a trading place in the central local market to sell the lepeshka. 

Urunbay is requesting a loan of $1300 USD for 12 months. He is planning to buy the flour that he requires for his business on a wholesale basis. Urunbay is grateful to all who support him and promises to manage the loan with accuracy.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy flour wholesale to bake “lepeshka," the Tajik national bread.

loans.name: Banin

texts.en:
Mr. Banin H., sixty-eight, and his wife, Mrs. Sokea Chhom, fifty-two, were married in 1995 and have two sons, both of whom attend school. The family lives in a small village along National Road Number Five about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Mrs. Sokea Chhom has been selling dessert in her village for six years: it’s a skill she learned from her parents. Banin has been growing rice for thirty years. He is asking for his first loan of $350 to use for growing rice and to purchase a water pump.

loans.use: For growing rice and to buy a water pump.

loans.name: Wastara Group

texts.en:
Namboto has owned a small charcoal and firewood store in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for three years. She belongs to the Wastara loan group (group code 2006). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $70. Every day she works at her business for eight hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can  buy more charcoal and firewood to add her current stock. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use.

Namboto is 33 years old and married with three children who are ages 15 years, 12 years, and 9 months.  She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member Halima. Halima her own small business selling clothes in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and firewod to add her current stock.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es: Delfina tiene 34 años de edad, vive solo con su pareja con la que también trabaja, y con el esfuerzo de su trabajo pudieron obtener su casa propia. Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la compra de madera para luego convertirla en carbón, para lo cual cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien elabora el carbón para que Delfina lo lleve a vender al mercado. Le gusta mucho su trabajo porque aprende cada día más al respecto y conoce a más personas para ampliar su gama de clientes. La rentabilidad de su negocio es debido a que el carbón es un producto de gran demanda, en especial para las personas que no cuentan con cocinas a gas, quienes son sus principales clientes. Posteriormente, Delfina quiere poder vender sus productos a otros lugares fuera de su región. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque ha notado que sus integrantes son personas responsables y tienen mucha comunicación para el trabajo en equipo. Con el dinero que solicita comprara más madera para incrementar su producción de carbón.
texts.en:
Delfina is a 34-year-old woman who lives with her husband, with whom she also works. Because of their hard work, they have been able to obtain their own house. For 4 years, she has been purchasing wood to make it into charcoal. Delfina gets help from her husband, who makes the charcoal so that she can then sell it at the market. She really likes her job because she is learning about respect mre and more each day, and because she gets to know a lot of people, thus expanding her client-base. Her business is profitable due to the fact that charcoal is in high demand, especially for their main customers—people who do not have gas stoves. Delfina would like to later sell her products outside the region. This is her first loan with MFP. She likes to work with her microfinance institute because she has noticed that the other members are responsible people who communicate with each other and are team players. With the money that she is requesting, she will purchase more wood in order to increase charcoal production.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wood to make charcoal

loans.name: Jose Lenin

texts.es: José Lenin Vale R. tiene 55 años, es un hombre soltero. Tiene a su cargo 3 hijos y todos estudian. La actividad económica de José es la venta y elaboración de ataúdes. Hace más de 30 años que se dedica a este negocio. José inicio este negocio por cuenta propia ya que el asistía a una escuela taller y así fue que aprendió este oficio y decide establecer un lugar en su vivienda para ofrecer sus ataúdes. Sin embargo los problemas que José enfrentaba no lograron que siguiera luchando. El dinero que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de pega, madera, clavos, pintura, tela entre otros productos de materia prima. El sueño de José es ampliar su negocio y generar mayor utilidad.
texts.en:
Jose Lenin Vale R., 55, is a single man. He supports 3 children, all in school. He operates a business making and selling coffins. He's worked at coffin-making for more than 30 years. He started the business on his own after attending a school-workshop where he learned the trade. He decided to set up a place in his house where he could sell his coffins. The problems that Jose faced never kept him from continuing to struggle [to get ahead?]. The money that he wants to borrow is for working capital to buy wood, nails, paint and other basic materials. Jose's greatest hopes are to expand his business and generate more income.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Raúl

texts.es:
Raúl Terán M. esta agradecido con el crédito que se le otorgo en esta institución a el le ayudo tanto que ahora quiere otro. El proyecto que el tiene es remodelar el interior de su casa, como pintar y resanar las paredes de las recamaras por que están tan deterioradas que no se ven bien. Esto lo quiere hacer para que sus hijos vivan en un lugar bonito y acogedor donde la familia pueda convivir. Comenta el mismo que esta tan contento de formar parte de esto por que lo esta beneficiando para la mejora de su vivienda.
El señor es chofer de una compañía que presta servicio a maquiladoras para transportar a sus empleados.
texts.en:
Raúl Terán M. is grateful for the prior loan this institution offered him. The loan was so helpful to him that he is now requesting another. He wishes to remodel the interior of his house, repairing and painting the bedroom walls because they are deteriorated and don't look good. He wants to do this so that his children will be able to live in a beautiful, comfortable place with their family. He says that he is happy to be part of this because it is helping him improve his home. Raúl is a driver for a company that is contracted by the maquiladoras to transport their employees.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Abel

texts.es:
Abel es jubilado de Comibol (Corporación Minera de Bolivia) y tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio donde vende refrescos, abarrotes, dulces conservas y otros.
Vive en la zona de Alto seguencoma de la ciudad de La Paz, en casa propia.
El crédito será destinado para compra de mercadería ( abarrotes y conservas).
Es la sexta vez que solicita un crédito en Impro. Su historial lo califica como cliente bueno en el pago se sus cuotas
texts.en:
Abel is a pensioner, retired from Comibol (Corporacion Minera de Bolivia), and operates a general store in his house where he sells cold drinks, groceries, canned goods and other products. He lives in his own house in the Alto Seguencoma section of the city of La Paz. The loan will be used to buy merchandise (groceries and canned goods). This is Abel's sixth Impro loan application. He is considered to be a good customer of the bank because of his past payment history.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise to stock general store.

loans.name: Baltazari

texts.en: Bartazari N. runs a retail shop where he sells clothing.  He sells both everyday and dress clothes of different designs for men, women and children. He purchases his clothing lines from wholesale shops in the Kariakoo city business center and sells to customers at his shop in Yombo Buzza ward in Dar es Salaam. He has been in this business for six years and his family depends on the income from the business for their daily needs. He is requesting a loan of 1,200,000 TZS to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell

loans.name: Mercedes Martha

texts.es: Mercedes tiene actualmente 43 años de edad, es casada con el Sr.Honorato, tiene 3 hijos de los cuales solo dependen de ella 2, cuenta con vivienda propia, la cual esta de garantía bajo. Su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la zona comercial de la ciudad a 1/2 cuadra de la plaza, tiene su tienda donde vende artículos de regalo, zapatos, ropa y otros; cuenta con una experiencia desde su inicio con alrededor de unos 18 años. La competencia es relativa, podríamos decir que es media, además el tiempo en la zona ha hecho que ella tenga clientela segura y un negocio estable y no solo vende un producto esta constantemente rotando su inventario de acuerdo a la época. Mercedes invertirá o invirtió en mercadería, un lote de mercadería (ropa, zapato de vestir y deportivo). Mercedes viene trabajando con Agrocapital desde el año 2005 según historial y con un buen comportamiento en el pago de sus cuotas y de acuerdo a informe confidenciales también registra un ideal comportamiento histórico.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 43 years old and she is married with Honorato. They have 3 children but only 2 are still in her care. She lives in her own home and she runs a business located in the commercial sector of the city,a bout half a block from center square. There she has a store selling gift items, shoes, clothing etc. She has been running this business for about 18 years now. There is a fair amount of competition but given the amount of time she's been selling and the well travelled area she can count on her clientele and a steady business. She never sells only one product but she always changes and rotates the the products in her inventory to match the season. Mercedes invested in the purchase of merchandise, a lot consisting of clothing, dress and sports shoes. Mercedes has been with Agrocapital (Kiva Field Partner) since 2005. She has always been on time with her payments.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Arwa

texts.en:
Arwa is married and has 7 children. Arwa started raising sheep and goats five years ago. She started with only 2 sheep near her house in a small shed where she made cheese and yogurt from their milk for sale. She also sold milk to neighbours. She started this project to help her husband, who is employed in a sewing workshop, support their family.

Now, after five years, she has 70 sheep and goats. She has built a small barn for them and is still selling dairy products and also selling goats and sheep after raising them.

She needs this loan to buy a small carriage to use when they want to sell an animal. Arwa also has some land that she farms.

Arwa appears in the picture at the barn.

loans.use: To purchase a small carriage

loans.name: Adrian

texts.es: Adrian R. vive en la comarca  Paraiso de Aguas Sarcas de Nueva Guinea, esta solicitando su 2do crédito a la institución de AFODENIC para construir una  habitación y asi mejorar las condiciones del hogar,  este joven se ha caracterizado por ser un docente  muy responsable, honesto, con  buena conducta y moral crediticia,  su esposa trabaja como docente  en la misma comarca donde ellos viven,  son una familia humildes que han luchado para seguir  adelante y para seguir estudiando , actualmente  estan en el ultimo año de magisterio,  Adrian con el crédito anterior logro comprar unos terneros, aspira tener una vivienda con mejores condiciones, tener estabilidad laboral , seguir estudiando y salud para el y su familia.
texts.en:
Adrian lives in the region of "Paraiso de Aguas Sarcas de Nueva Guinea". He is asking for his second loan with the institution called AFODENIC. This loan will be used to build a house and in doing so, improve his living conditions. This young person has the personality to be a teacher. He is very responsible, honest, has good conduct and is financially responsible. His wife works as a teacher in the same district where they live. They are a humble family that is trying to move ahead and continue studying. Actually, they are in the last year of teacher's college. Adrian, with his last loan, bought calves. He hopes to have a better house, a steady job and good health for himself and his family

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: use to buy more meat for her barbecue business

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia G. is 50 years old and married to Vicente G. who is presently managing the boarding house that they own. The couple is blessed with 2 children who have already graduated from college. The older, 28 years old, is a teacher while the younger is 26 years old and works with the Coastguard. The family lives in the village of Sitio Serena, Brgy Enclaro, Binalbagan Negros Occidental.

It was always Amalia's dream to be able to send her children to school so they would have their own jobs, and to help her husband pay for their household expenses -- and she has done all this with the help of NWTF-Project Dungganon.

Amalia joined NWTF-PD in January 1995 and used the first cycle loan to start a general or "sari-sari" store. Since it was in a good location, she was able to earn a good income, and she used her subsequent loans to continue improving the operations of her general store. Later, they started taking in boarders, and her husband took care of managing the boarding house. She was able to earn a net monthly income of PHP 6,000 from her businesses.

With the help of her loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, plus her own efforts and the support of her family, she was able to send her 2 children to school until they finished their college education, a fulfillment of one of her most cherished dreams. She has also acquired a few productive assets such as a refrigerator for her general store, and she had electricity and water pumps installed in her boarding house.

Now Amalia is helping some members of her extended family by supporting the education of her nephew, paying tuition and providing him with an allowance so that he will have some spending money while in school.

In her previous loan, Amalia borrowed Php 19,500 which she used as additional working capital, using part of the income to support her nephew's education. Now she is borrowing for her 14th loan the amount of PHP 23,000, again as additional capital for her general store. She intends to use the income to continue supporting not only her immediate family but she hopes to also improve the lives of other relatives so that they too will achieve their potential just like her own children. This is her way of practicing being "Dungganon" (honorable)

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few but of thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additional Capital for her General Store

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en: Dorothy loves cooking. That is why she owns a restaurant. She has been in this business for a long time. She puts in long hours trying to keep her business sustainable. She is 34 years old and married with four children. All her children are in school. She hopes for a loan of 100,000 NGN to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Felymar

texts.en:
Felymar M. is a 53 year old businesswoman in their village. She is married to Dante, 59, who is presently working in the Department of Agriculture in their village. The couple has three diligent children: Harden, 38, a high school graduate; Harold, 22, a college graduate working in Manila as a machine operator; and Harlyn, 17, a first-year college student taking up Information Technology. They live at Barangay Estefania Amulung, Cagayan. Felymar wants a good future for her children. By engaging in business, she hopes to support the growing needs of her children. 

Felymar started managing her general store when she got married. She wanted to earn income for her family, most especially for her children. Felymar is requesting a loan from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP10,000. She will use the loan as additional capital to continuously improve and expand her retailing business. With the help of the loan, she will be able to purchase more items to sell.

loans.use: Additional capital for her general store

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther E. is currently in the business of selling rice, soap, sugar, etc., in a shop. She is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of rice and sugar to sell. Esther is 40 years old and married to a businessman. She has eight children. Her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees up to university for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Purchase more bags of rice and sugar to sell

loans.name: Bovalagai Group

texts.en:
Princess D. K. is a leader of a group of 5 borrowers called Bovalagai. She is single and has 2 children. Her children are aged 5-11 years old, their educational levels ar kindergarten to 3rd grade.

Princess is a high school graduate, but could not continue to university due to poverty. She and her children live in the Telbomai Quarter, but work in the Central market of Voinjama city, the capital of Lofa county, northern Liberia .
Her business is general goods. She buys general goods, wholesale, and sells retail in the Voinjama central market, Voinjama city Lofa County, Liberia. Princess has been running this business for 3 years, and is hoping to improve her business.

She serves her customers in a good manner in order to encourage customers to continue patronizing her business. Princess needs this loan to purchase more general goods to improve business. She dreams of having a house of her own.

loans.use: To purchase more general goods to improve business.

loans.name: Pin's Group

texts.en:
These three women have jointly requested a group loan. One of these women, Mrs. Pin T., age 50, has been selected by the other members to be the leader of this group loan. Pin T. owns a piece of farmland that she uses to either farm rice or to build a stall for raising a few pigs, from which she earns a living. The farming work is assisted by her husband, who helps to plant the crop. Pin T. has been married many years and is blessed with seven children. Two grown children are working as garment employees. Pin T. needs a loan to purchase more pigs to raise. The other two borrowers:
S., a rice farmer, asks for a loan to purchase a cow for her farming business. 
S. is a rice grower and requests a loan to order rice in bulk from farmers to resell.

loans.use: To buy more pigs to raise.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Mrs. Nena P. is from Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 55 years old, married, and has six children. To make a living, Nena and her husband operate a business making furniture and fixtures. They have been engaged in this business for over four years and earn approximately 28,000 PHP per month from these activities.
Nena joined Kiva partner PMPC to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 35,000 PHP from PMPC. This loan was used to purchase materials for their business. Now, Nena is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used as additional capital for their business. They need additional capital because they have a lot of customers who are willing to make purchases but their capital is not sufficient.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: As additional capital for their furniture business

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es:
La  Señora Ana Isabel Seque ira, Labora como Supervisora de Colectores en el Mercado Mayoreo de Managua.
 Ella tiene dos hijos a su cargo, y uno de ellos se  encuentran en  edad escolar, esta casado, ha trabajado  créditos con CEPRODEL durante diez años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido veinte crédito en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: verjas para las ventanas de su casa y para el corredor. 
Con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
Ana dijo que gracias al financiamiento de ceprodel le han ayudado mucho a mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
Ana works as a supervisor of collectors in the main marketplace of Managua.

She has two children, one of whom is of school age, and she is married. She has received loans from CEPRODEL during the past ten years, and in this period of time has invested twenty loans in home improvements thanks to the financing offered by CEPRODEL. She is an excellent client.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy construction materials such as: security bars for the windows of her house and for the entry passage.

Her goal is to offer more security and a better standard of living to her children.

Ana said that the loans from CEPRODEL have helped her greatly in improving her home.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improvement and enlargement of her home

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros C. is from the village of Roxas, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 49 years old. Milagros is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Milagros owns & operates a general store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Milagros has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Milagros joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Milagros is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Milagros from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve & expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Wycliffe

texts.en: Wycliffe is a 26 year old single man.  He has been operating a barber shop for two years.  He started this business immediately after clearing school.  He has been trained how to plan his business by Faulu Kenya.  He wants to take a loan of Kes.15,000 to purchase a shaving machine and chairs for his barber shop.  He hopes to have a stable business in the future and operate well established companies.  He describes himself as a hardworking man.

loans.use: To purchase a shaving machine and chairs

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes J. is currently in the business of selling bags of groundnuts (peanuts) and sim-sim (sesame) and is requesting a loan to buy stock of beans and maize flour to sell. She is 35 years old and is married with a husband who is a peasant. She has three children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy stock of beans and maize flour to sell

loans.name: Dora Eloisa

texts.es: Dora Eloisa tiene 53 años, ella se dedica a la actividad económica de es la venta de mercadería en general. La ubicación de su negocio es de forma ambulante. Hace más de 16 años que se dedica a este negocio. El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo y así poder realizar las compras de ropa, calzado, toallas, perfumes, cremas y protector solar por la temporada de verano. El sueño de ella es ofertar muy buenos productos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Dora Eloisa is 53 years old, and she has dedicated her professional life to the sale of general goods. Her business is mobile, and she has been in business for over 16 years. The financing she is requesting is for working capital so that she will be able to purchase clothes, shoes, towels, perfumes, cremes and sunscreen for the summer months. Her dream to to offer very good products to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Mrs. Sokha Phatt Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan has nine people who live in Tuol Sala village in Kandal province. Mrs. Sokha P. is the village bank president. She has been selected by all the members. They will use the loan for different purposes. She sells honey door to door. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand. Thus, Mrs. Sokha P. decided to ask for a loan to buy more honey to resell and to buy electric supply to support her house. Her husband, Mr. Oret Nub, is a farmer who owns 0.5-hectare of land to cultivate rice to support his family. She has four children. Two of her children are seamstresses in the garment factory and two attend the local public school.

loans.use: To buy electric supply

loans.name: Mrs. Lon Touch Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan consists of 13 people who live in Ampil Kaeut village in Takeo province. All the members will use the loan for different purposes that can improve their businesses in the future. Mrs. Lon T. is the village bank president who has been selected by all the members. She is a weaver at her home. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand. So to improve her business, Mrs. Lon T. is seeking a loan to buy more silk. Her husband, Mr. Bea Bel, is a farmer who owns a one-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support his family. She has five children. Two of the children are weavers and the others help their mother. Mrs. Kuy Ouch is the group guarantor so she is presented in the photo too.

loans.use: To buy more silk

loans.name: Rusalinda

texts.en:
Rusalinda G. lives in the village of Quiboro in Camiguin Province. She is 27 years old, widowed and has two school-aged children. To earn a living, she has just gone into business making and selling food, primarily snacks and local delicacies.

Earlier this year, Rusalinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She is requesting a  loan of 5,000 PHP to buy ingredients needed to make more items to sell to her customers. She will use the additional income generated by this loan to improve her family's living conditions.  

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy ingredients needed to make products to sell to her customers

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok T., 30, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. T. sells groceries for an income of USD 3.5 per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of about USD 3.1 per day. T. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase more groceries to stock the store. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to stock the store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy ready made items

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Kong S., 40, is married and lives with her husband and three children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for its quality palm products.

S. raises cows and pigs for an income of USD 1 per day. Her husband is in the military in the province, earning an income of USD 3 per day.

S. is requesting a loan of USD 300 to purchase more pigs to raise. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy more pigs to raise

loans.name: Kov

texts.en:
Mrs. Kov M. is 58 years old and married. She lives in an old wooden home with family members in a village in Phnom Penh Capital and also owns a piece of farmland that she inherited many years ago from her grandparents. She uses this land to grow different kinds of crops, which she and her husband work on.
The couple is blessed with four children who are married. Kov M. has an older house that is surrounded by pollution affecting her health and her daily living conditions. In order to resolve the problem, Kov M. has applied for a loan to repair and decorate her house. Mrs. Kov M. was not available at that time so her husband is pictured instead.

loans.use: To repair and decorate her home

loans.name: Betzabe Marleny

texts.es:
Betzabe pertenece al Banco Comunal Sol Radiante hace 1 año y aprendió a ser responsable.
Betzabe es casada y tiene 3 hijos, Betzabe vende ropa a pedido, sus productos los ofrece a amigos y familiares, la mayoría de sus ventas son al crédito. Además Betzabe junto a su esposo tienen un grifo en la selva ayacuchana.
Betzabe necesita un préstamo de 600 soles para la compra de chompas.
Betzabe vive en casa alquilada y desea tener casa propia y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Betzabe has belonged to the Sol Radiante (Radiant Sun) Community Bank for a year, and she has learned to be responsible. Betzabe is married and has three children. She sells clothing to order, which she sells to her friends and family. Most of her sales are made on credit. Additionally, Betzabe and her husband have a gas station in the Ayacucho jungle. Betzabe need a loan for 600 nuevos soles to buy sweaters. She lives in a rented house, and wants to own her own home and to have her children be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sweaters

loans.name: Nop

texts.en:
Mrs. Nop L. was born in 1944 and lives in Daeum Pou village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 3.2-hectare (8-acre) plot of land where she grows rice to sell to support her family. She is also a farm laborer.

Mrs. Nop L.’s problem is that it is time to grow rice but she does not have enough rice seed. So, to improve matters, she is asking for a loan to buy rice seed; with the rest of the loan she will buy fertilizer and hire a plowing machine to plow her field.

Mrs. Nop L. is a widow with three children, one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory, another is a laborer, and the third is attending school.

loans.use: To buy rice seed for her farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase new inventory

loans.name: United Family Group

texts.en:
Saah M., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called United Family.  He is 26 years old and married with four children who are between the ages of 20 months and 9 years. He was only able to attend school through 5th grade due to lack of financial support. 

For five years, he has been selling door locks, hinges, nails, zinc, hammers, etc., in Clara Town in Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 12,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 44,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more door locks, hinges, nails, zinc, hammers, etc. He describes himself as a quiet man whose dream is to improve his business.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Alex is inset in the photo in the lower right corner because he was absent during disbursal.

loans.use: To buy more door locks, hinges, nails, zinc, hammers, etc.

loans.name: Renato

texts.en:
Renato O. is from the village of Divisoria Santiago. He is 36 years old. Renato is single. To make a living, Renato owns & operates a specialized business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from  buying and selling of scrap metal & other used products in the local community. Renato has been engaged in his business for over 4 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Renato joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Renato has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to resell. Renato is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to resell. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Renato from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Gulmira's Group

texts.en:
Gulmira D. is the leader of the group. She is 42 and married. Her husband is an employee of the Department of Inner Affairs. The couple bring up 3 children. All of them are in school except the youngest one, who is of preschool age. Gulmira works as a head of the cardiology department in the hospital. Three years ago the family started with a cow with a calf. Now, almost all the family members are engaged in cattle breeding. During these years they have managed to increase the total number of animals. The purpose of the loan is to purchase 4 sheep. In the future the family is planning to obtain an apartment in the capital.

Gulmira’s partners:

Kulanda S. is the treasurer of the group. She is 56, a widow and has 2 children, both of them are already grown-up. Kulanda, with the help of her son, breeds cattle. She earns additionally by working as a hospital nurse. Her purpose of her loan is to purchase 2 sheep for increase her livestock. 

Sharyikul B., 55, married. Her family has 4 children. Sharyikul is currently working as a hospital nurse. She is also engaged in cattle breeding. Her loan aim is to purchase 3 sheep to increase the total number of animals. 

Gulnara M., 27 is not married. She is a nurse in the cardiologic department. She is also engaged in selling frozen foodstuff. The loan purpose is to purchase more stuff to increase her inventory. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en: Peninah is a 36 year-old business lady. She is married to M. a farmer and they have two children. Peninah has been operating a green grocery business for the past two years. Her monthly income is Kes 8,000, which she uses to support four members of her family. Peninah has previously never borrowed from any MFI (Microfinance Institution) and she was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our Credit Officers. She is applying for her first loan with which to add to her stock of tomatoes and green vegetables. She wants the profit from her business to pay school fees for her children and improve her family diet. Her future hopes are to expand her business, improve her family's living standard, and educate her children.

loans.use: To add to her vegetable stock

loans.name: Tahira Zaki Shah's Group

texts.en:
Tahira is a resident of Multan, a historic city located in Punjab province, Pakistan. She lives there with her family in a two-roomed brick house in the area called Dewan bagh. Tahira is a very supportive lady.
A few years ago she started an embroidery business to support her family financially because her husband’s income was not enough to fulfill the family's basic needs. Now her business has expanded and she has started a boutique at her home where she can display her prepared embroidered dresses to more people and therefore increase her household income.
Tahira's husband’s name is Z. S. and he works in the government sector as a clerk. Tahira has three sons and a daughter. Three of them are enrolled in school and getting an education. Tahira has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for the further expansion of her boutique business. With the loan, she will buy unstitched clothes and embroidery materials such as beads, colored thread and patterns to make more embroidered dresses to display in her boutique. Tahira is a new loan applicant to Asasah and this is her first loan application. She hopes that it will help to improve her family’s financial condition.
Note: In the photo, the lady who is seated second left is Tahira.

loans.use: To buy unstitched clothes and embroidery materials for her boutique business

loans.name: Edita Elirita

texts.es:
En la parroquia Crucita del cantón Portoviejo, encontramos un lugar conocido como los arenales aquí cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Generación, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.

Ya son 12 años que la señora Edita es socia del Banco Comunal, nos cuenta que siempre le ha gustado por las reuniones y los créditos que son muy importantes para  su negocio. Ella tiene 58 años de edad, esta casada y fruto de esta linda relación tiene 8 hijos todos son mayores de edad, con ellos viven dos  nietos que los crio desde pequeñitos y que tienen 15 y 9 años el mayor estudia en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su marido es comerciante.
 
Tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa, vende desde arroz, azúcar, carne, pescado camarón, queso y también vende ciertos remedios y artículos de bazar, trabaja todos los días desde las 6am hasta las 18h00. Dice que tiene en su tienda ya hace treinta años y  que en ella además de ganarse la vida ella también se distrae conversando con sus amigas. Los productos los compra en la ciudad de Portoviejo y otros los recibe en su local.

Este crédito es para surtir su tienda, para comprar arroz, azúcar, atún, detergentes, y otros productos.  Sus sueños son tener una casa más grande, mejor construida y un negocio más grande.
texts.en:
A place called Los Arenales is in Portoviejo’s Crucita parish.  The members of the Nueva Generación (New Generation) communal bank meet here every two weeks.  The place is known for its beautiful beaches, its gastronomy and the warmth of its people.

Edita has been a member of the communal bank for 12 years now.  She tells us that she’s always enjoyed the meetings and the loans which are very important for her business. 

She is 58 years of age, married and this beautiful relationship produced 8 children, all adults now.  Two grandchildren, who she has raised since they were babies, live with her.  They are now 15 and 9 years of age.  The older one is in secondary school and the younger is in elementary school.  Her husband is a merchant.

She has a grocery store installed in her house.  She sells rice, sugar, meat, fish, shrimp, cheese and also sells certain remedies and kitchen supplies.  She works every day from 6am until 6pm.

She says that her store has been around for 30 years and that besides earning a living in it she enjoys the distraction chatting with her friends is.  She buys her merchandise in Portoviejo; some others are delivered to her store.

This loan is to stock the store: to buy rice, sugar, tuna, detergents and other products.  

Her dreams are to have a larger, better built house and a larger business.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, tuna, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “BUENA ESPERANZA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Eugenia; ella tiene 50 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes,ella vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azúcar,leche entre otros,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el engocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para la tienda de abarrotes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The member belongs to the "Buena Esperanza" Community Bank. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco. The member is Mrs. Eugenia; she is 50 years old, married and has 3 children. She alternates her daily activities with her grocery store business. She sells basic staples such as rice, sugar, and milk among others. She wants to expand and improve her grocery store business. She is requesting this loan to purchase products for her grocery store. She is happy to have this loan and promises to honour the payments of her quotas.

loans.use: She is requesting this loan to purchase products for her grocery store.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is 46-years old married and supports her family by operating two business ventures: food vending and fish vending businesses. She lives in Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1998 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fish vending and food vending businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 9000. Melinda is borrowing PHP 22500 so that she could purchase more stocks to sell. This will be her 19th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 22500, which she paid off well within its term was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Melinda aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Nelida

texts.en:
Nelida is a widow who lives in E.B. Magalona, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three businesses: vegetable farming, food vending and frozen foods. She has no children. 

Nelida joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 17 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Nelida has been lifting herself out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 17,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 3,000.  

This time, for her 18th loan, she is borrowing PHP 19,500 which she intends to use to fund her business operations. Nelida is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the community's respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Funds in business operations

loans.name: Grigoryi

texts.en:
Grigoryi is married and has grown children. He is a farmer from Vodyanoye. Grigoryi grows early spring vegetables, specifically tomatoes. He owns 8 big greenhouses and plants 17,000 tall- and low-growing tomatoes. Grigoryi constructed his first greenhouse 17 years ago. He has invested about 180,000 Grivnyas in this enterprise.   

Grigoryi is seeking a loan of 15,000 Grivnyas to purchase 10 rolls of plastic film to cover the greenhouses to grow timely harvests. Grigoryi is hoping to use the film to keep his tomato plants warm, protect them from diseases and fungi, and leave them plenty of breathing room. He is planning to invest the profits generated into further development of his business, as well as help his two sons through school.

loans.use: To purchase polyethylene film for greenhouses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more drums of fuel for resale

loans.name: Rosa Del Carmen

texts.es:
Rosa de 25 años, es una joven emprendedora que comenzó desde muy joven a ser comerciante informal.  Con la motivación de la hermana que tenía el mismo negocio ella decidió ser comerciante informal. 

En la actualidad vende artículos y productos de uso personal en su negocio ambulante. Trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 21h00pm todos los días. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere continuar con el comprando con el préstamo mercadería como accesorios de teléfono. En el futuro quiere incrementar su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa, age 25, is a young entrepreneur who started working as an informal merchant at an early age. Her sister has a similar business and provided her with encouragement, so Rosa decided to become an informal merchant as well.

She currently sells personal use goods and products from a street stall. Rosa works every day from 8am to 9pm. She has many aspirations for her business. For this reason, Rosa wants to continue by using this loan to buy merchandise such as phone accessories. In the future, she wants to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase phone accessories.

loans.name: Hafez

texts.en:
Hafez is a 28-year-old married man and the father of two children. He lives and works in Baalback. Hafez used to transport people to and from their homes or work. Since 2000 he had also taken tourists all over Lebanon.

Hafez wanted to settle down, so he thought of starting a new business which could help provide his family with a good income that would lead to a secure and healthy life. Hafez chose to open a car wash and maintenance garage specializing in oil changes.

Hafez has requested a loan from Al Majmoua to assist in establishing his new business. This will be Hafez's third cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower, as he has proven to be a man with a good repayment history. All of his previous loans have positively affected his social and economic life.

loans.use: To start a new business

loans.name: Nguyễn

texts.en: T. Nguyễn

loans.use: To purchase additional materials to expand his product offerings

loans.name: Nelly Marina

texts.es:
Nelly es socia del  Banco Comunal “Flor de Canela”, ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 37 años de edad, es soltera y tiene un hijo.  Nelly tiene grado de instrucción educación superior completo.
Viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos de hace un año, su préstamo inicial fue de  S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, préstamo que invirtió en su negocio venta de comidas rápidas.
Con este nuevo préstamo de S/ 500.00 nuevo soles, comprará un saco de papa, 20 kilos de pan molido, carnes y pollos.
Su sueño es tener un local en el centro de la ciudad y dedicarse al cuidado de niños (wawa-wasi).
Lo que le gusta  del Banco Comunal son las reuniones porque es una distracción e intercambia ideas con las demás socias.
texts.en:
Nelly is a member of the “Flor de Canela” (Cinnamon Flower) communal bank located in Puno District, Puno Province and Department.  She’s 37 years old, single and has a son.  Nelly finished higher education.

She’s been collaborating with the Manuela Ramos Movement for a year.  Her initial, 300 new sol, loan was invested in her fast food business.  She will use this new, 500 new sol, loan to buy a sack of potatoes, 20 kilos of bread crumbs, meats and chickens.  Her dream is to have a locale in city center and to care for children (wawa-wasi: government child care program).

What she likes about the communal bank is the meetings because they are a distraction and she can exchange ideas with the other members.

loans.use: to buy a sack of potatoes, 20 kilos of bread crumbs, meat and chickens.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a 44-year-old married man with four children living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. The responsibility to look after the family solely rests on him and his desire is to pay school fees for his children to attain a degree as a minimum qualification. He fabricates metals for a living and the business is steadily growing despite challenges in finances. His desire is to have an established workshop. David intends to use the credit facility to pay school fees.

loans.use: To pay school fees.

loans.name: Mikafumawu

texts.fr: Agée de 56ans, cette est veuve de 04 enfants. Elle opère dans la restauration depuis 2002. Elle vend de façon ambulante après achat des ingrédients au marché d’Akodesséwa. Ce premier cycle lui servira à acheter les produits de restauration (riz, huile, mais, tomate…) pour tout d’abord louer un local pour satisfaire plus sa demande croissante et prendre en charge ses 04 enfants.
texts.en: Mme Mikafumawu is a 56 year-old widow and a mother of four children. She has run a catering operation since 2002. She sources food ingredients from the Akodesséwa market and then sells her wares via door-to-door sales. This first loan will enable her to purchase food items (rice, oil, corn, tomatoes etc) and to rent a small outlet from which she will be able to better meet her customers' demands. The money that she aims to generate will enable her to look after her the needs of her four children.

loans.use: to purchase food items

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es: La Sra. Patricia nacida en Rio de Palometas, radica en Santa Cruz desde su niñez, vive hace mas de dos años en el barrio Palmira, Tiene tres hijos y convive con su marido hace dos años, ella se dedica a la panadería ella prepara para la venta pan, queques  de plátano, naranja y pies de manzana o limón, comercializando por la zona hace mas de dos años, es muy conocida en el barrio.   Su marido trabaja de Guardia de Seguridad en una empresa privada hace casi dos años, la Sra. Patricia es una persona muy trabajadora agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Patricia was born in Rio de Palometas. She has been living in Santa Cruz since childhood and for over two years she has been living in the Palmira neighborhood. She has three children and has been living with her husband for two years. She has a bakery and makes bread, banana and orange cakes and lemon and apple pies. She has been selling her products in her area for over two years and is well-known in her neighborhood. Her husband has been working as a security guard in a private company for almost two years. Patricia is very hard-working and is grateful for the support she has received from the institution.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale flour, butter and sugar.

loans.name: Benjamen

texts.en:
Benjamen is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines.   He is married and has 9 children. 

Benjamen has a retail shop that sells snacks, beverages & canned goods. He  had this business for 4 years. He has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy snacks, beverages & canned goods.

Benjamen is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Benjamen hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, beverages & canned goods.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “EL DIAMANTE DE URUBAMBA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ofelia; ella tiene 37 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 5 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de restaurant, el prepara desayunos, almuerzos y cenas, la socia trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, por medio de este trabajo la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de restaurant. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz, carne y pollos.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Ofelia is a member of the Diamante de Urubamba community bank located in the district and province of Urubamba, in the department of Cusco.
