Ofelia is 37 years old and lives with her partner and their five children. As well as her household responsibilities, she runs a restaurant where she makes breakfasts, lunches and dinners. She works from 7am to 6pm. The money she earns helps her family get ahead. She wishes to expand the business and buy ingredients for the food she makes such as rice, meat, and chicken.

Ofelia is happy to receive a loan and promises to repay the money.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients such as rice, meat, and chicken

loans.name: Hosnia

texts.en:
Hosnia is a 55-year-old woman who is married with two sons. One of her sons is a Palestinian National Authority employee. The other son works in a trade and both earns a decent income.

Hosnia wants to buy new home furniture and appliances such as a television, computer and new living room. Because of the decent salaries their sons earn, she wants to take a loan of $2,000 to pay in cash.

As Hosnia gets FATEN's loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, she can purchase and pay in cash in an easy and fast way and improve her home and family life.

loans.use: To pay for new home furniture and appliances.

loans.name: Phorn

texts.en: Phorn is a garment factory worker. She is single and stays with her parents and a few siblings. Her family makes $6 per day for income. Every month, she has to spend $35 on food, $3 on electricity, $20 on rent, $15 on transportation, and $35 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $900 to study at beauty school and buy the materials needed for her studies. This loan will help her to get a skill that can help her in the future. She plans to get a small shop for a beauty salon because she wants to quit working in the factory.

loans.use: To study at beauty school

loans.name: Moussiliyatou

texts.fr:
Moussiliyatou est une femme âgée de 31 ans. Elle est mariée å un commerçant et a 01 enfant en charge.
Moussiliyatou travaille comme revendeuse de plastiques depuis 2008. Elle vend à ses clients dans un quartier de la place et achète les ustensiles à Lomé et à ACCRA. 
Moussiliyatou a requis premier  son cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des sceaux, des gobelets des glacières et des plats.
texts.en:
Moussiliyatou, 31, is married to a small-scale retailer and is raising one child. She has been working at selling plastics since 2008. She sells to her customers in a local neighborhood and buys the utensils in Lomé and ACCRA. 

Moussiliyatou has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy buckets, glasses, ice chests, and platters.

loans.use: to buy pails, ice chests, and platters.

loans.name: Ramon

texts.en:
Ramon is 41 years old and is married with three children. He lives in the Philippines. For the past eight years, Ramon has run a shop where he sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. He has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.

Ramon is requesting a 7,000 PHP loan to buy more merchandise for his store. In the future, he hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell

loans.name: Shadrack

texts.en:
Shadrack is 48, married, and has three children between 24 and 14, with the youngest still schooling. He has been in farming for 31 years in Nkubu, Central Kenya producing and selling potatoes, beans, maize and wheat for the local market. 

Shadrack has made a loan request of 52,500 Kenyan Shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says he will use the additional income to boost his cereals retail business as well as build a modern dairy unit for his cows. He adds that his family's living standards will also be improved. 

He cites pests as the greatest threat to farming.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Amparo

texts.en:
Amparo is a married woman with three adult children. She lives in the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato where she has a farm and a sari-sari (retail) store. Amparo grows rice on her land and sells her harvest at her town’s market. She also sells items such as shampoo, soap, and canned goods at her sari-sari store.

Amparo is requesting a loan to purchase farm inputs such as seed and fertilizer. Amparo hopes to progress in her life.

loans.use: to purchase seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia is engaged in a general store business. She is widowed and has been blessed with four children. For her, the best way to reach her personal goals is through dedication to her work without forgetting about being happy all the time. 

Florencia wants to see her business grow though her age is 61. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 that will make it possible for her to buy products such as coffee, sugar, soft drinks, assorted biscuits and vegetables to stock her store. She hopes that her work will provide her with the opportunity to provide her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as coffee, sugar, soft drinks, biscuits and vegetables to stock her store.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a 53-year-old mother who wants to support her son Ahmad in his mini-market. He has been in business for more than a year now. 

At first she used to help him by making goods orders to guide her son in the business field. Now that he is capable of doing that, she has applied for a loan to expand the mini-market space and add more variety in the goods they sell. 

Because Hanan is a conservative person, her son Ahmad has agreed to appear in the photo instead of her.

loans.use: To expand the mini-market space and add more variety in the goods they sell.

loans.name: Felecitas

texts.en:
Felecitas is married, 47 years old, with 9 kids and she lives in Tukuran,  Zamboanga Del Sur.
Felecitas owns and operates farmland, planting crops to earn a living and has had this business for more than 9 years. Each month, she earns PHP 19,500 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan in the amount of PHP 16,000 to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Felecitas has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. Felecitas saves the profit for her 9 kids and to provide for the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Ruth Marisol

texts.es:
Ruth, se decide por un nuevo préstamo, porque necesita surtir la tienda, comprara aceite, carne de cerdo, de res, leche, cereal de maíz, huevos, sopas, esta compra le ayudara para disponer de más productos para los clientes.
Ella ha cancelado el préstamo anterior, manteniendo una buena condición en el negocio y mejorando su condición económica.
texts.en:
Ruth has decided to request a new loan because she needs to restock her store.  She plans to buy oil, pork, beef, milk, corn cereal, eggs, and soups.  This will help her have on hand a wider variety of products for customers.

She paid back her previous loan and has kept her business in good shape and improved its economic situation.

loans.use: To buy corn, eggs, soup, oil, pork, beef and milk.

loans.name: Oliva

texts.es:
A sus 51 años de edad, Oliva es una mujer emprendedora que desde hace algún tiempo inició en su propia casa con la venta de productos de la canasta familiar así como con la elaboración de chorizos para vender a sus vecinos y personas que transitan por la vereda del corregimiento de San Félix de Medellín, lugar donde vive con su esposo y su esposo y sus dos hijos. 

En el futuro, Oliva sueña con poder generar empleo e incrementar sus ventas. Por ahora necesita de un préstamo para comprar algunos productos de la canasta familiar para ofrecerle a sus clientes mayor variedad y también necesita comprar insumos para la elaboración de chorizos y así incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
At 51 years of age, Oliva is an entrepreneurial woman who started selling essential household groceries in her home some time ago.  She also makes chorizos to sell to her neighbors and people who pass by San Félix de Medellín township where she lives with her husband and her two children.

In the future, Oliva dreams of being able to create jobs and increase her sales.  For now, she needs a loan to buy some essential household groceries so that she can offer her customers a larger variety.  She also needs to buy supplies for making chorizos.  In this way, she will increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy essential household groceries and supplies for making chorizos

loans.name: Ronald Antonio

texts.es:
Ronald tiene 24 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijos. Reside con su familia en el Caserío Pedregal Bajo - San Martin del distrito de Tambogrande perteneciente a la Región Piura, ubicado a 4 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del Departamento de Lambayeque. Ronald vive en la parte rural de este distrito. Solo cuenta con servicio básico de luz.

Ronald se dedica a la crianza de ganado ovino, teniendo 12 cabezas de ganado, los cuales cría y engorda para luego comercializarlos en el mercado local a los negociantes que visitan el lugar con frecuencia. Además trabaja en un fundo agrícola de uva, ganando semanalmente.  Con estos ingresos se encarga de sacar adelante la economía de su hogar.

Ronald desea comprar alimentos balanceados para el engorde de ovinos, esta inversión le permitirá seguir creciendo  y así mejorar su calidad de vida.  Es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 1,000 nuevos soles para lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Ronald is 24 years old, single and without children. He lives with his family in the Caserío Pedregal Bajo - San Martin, in the distrcit of Tambogrande which belongs to the Piura Region, located 4 hours from the town of Chiclayo, capital of the department of Lambayeque. Ronald lives in the rural part of the district. He has only the basic service of electricty.

Ronald breeds sheep and has 12 heads of livestock for breeding and fattening for later sale at the local market to traders who frequent the area. He also works on a grape farm estate where he earns a weekly wage. WIth this income, he is responsible for taking care of the household expenses.

Ronald wants to buy nutritionally balanced feed to fatten his sheep. This investment will allow him to continue to grow and thus improve his quality of life. This is why he has seen fit to obtain a loan of 1,000 nuevos sole (PEN) to reach his goal.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally balanced feed for his livestock.

loans.name: Mutabar

texts.ru: Мутабар 45 лет, она мать четверых детей. Мутабар занимается торговлей детской одеждой. За товаром ездит сама в Истаравшан и Бишкек, Кыргызстан. Каждый кредит использует на увеличение товарооборота, чтоб получить больше прибыли, а свои доходы она тратит на улучшение социального положения семьи, на ремонт дома, на покупку техники для сына. Мутабар честная и пунктуальная женщина и благодарна кредиторам и организации за понимание и поддержку.
texts.en: Mutabar is 45 years and a mother of four children.  She is involved in selling children's clothing.  She travels for merchandise herself to Istaravshan and Bishkek, Kyrgyzstan.  Mutabar uses every loan for increasing goods turnover in order to earn a bigger profit, and she spends her earnings to improve her family's welfare, repair the house and buy electronics for her son.  Mutabar is an honest and punctual woman, and she is grateful to creditors and the organization for the understanding and support.

loans.use: to increase goods turnover

loans.name: Ma. Villa

texts.en:
Ma. Villa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has operated a restaurant business in the Philippines for 3 years. Ma. Villa earns additional income from fruit sales and a sari-sari (variety) store. She is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her restaurant business.

Ma. Villa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of repairing and renovating her family home in the future.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Rihab

texts.en: Rihab is a 53-year-old Lebanese single woman living with her parents and one working sibling. She collaborates with her father to be able to satisfy their family's needs and demands. She opened her own grocery store in her town in 2009 and has gained a fair number of customers so far. Today she’s requesting to borrow $1,100 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase more groceries and food provisions for her shop in order to increase her sales and thus her revenues. In the future, she plans to open her own mini-market.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries and food provisions for her shop

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a married man with eleven children, four of whom attend school while others graduated from school. He owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past one year, he has operated a "boda boda" (motorcycle) transport business, operating from home to the market whereby neighbours are his potential customers. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. He dreams of expanding his business in the future. 

With the Kshs 15,000 he wants to purchase spare parts to repair his motorcycle which broke down. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts to repair his motorcycle which broke down.

loans.name: Isra

texts.en: Isra is a 24 year old married woman from Al Russeifeh, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to help pay for a new water tank and a motor which draws the water from the tank. She also plans on painting the family room. Since Isra is under 30 years old her loan is considered a youth loan. She prefers that her photo is not on the internet, the photo is of her husband.

loans.use: to pay for home improvements

loans.name: Kewandwi B Group

texts.en:
This is a Nuru International group of three farmers, called Kewandwi, and is based within Kuria West district. The members of the group came together in order to grow socially and economically through agriculture.

The person raising his hand up is Juma. He is 22 years old and married with one child. Juma has been a member of the group for two years, and is the group’s chairperson.

Juma has been learning better farming methods within his group, and desires to use hybrid seeds and fertilizers in his farm to grow maize, sorghum and millet during the 2014 long rain seasons. He is, however, constrained financially and is hoping to receive a loan from Kiva, which will enable him to purchase these farm inputs. 

He believes that the use of the hybrid seeds and fertilizer will increase his yields, and he will not only get enough food for his family, but will also sell the surplus and obtain money to invest in a dairy cow.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum, and millet.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en: Sophia has studied as a trainee apprentice with Joyce Kudehah of Joy Tye and Dye Works. She has also completed her pre-disbursement training with Kraban Support Foundation. She needs a KIVA loan to strengthen the shop that she has established named Sophie\'s Beauty Creations. She plans to use the loan to roof the shop where she operates and also recruit an apprentice to assist her in her operations.

loans.use: Startup Working Capital

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is married with two grown children. After finishing her schooling she worked in a factory as a metal turner then later worked at an enterprise producing glass fiber. However, she was unable to earn a stable salary which forced her to look for another source of income. That is why she started her own business selling clothing and footwear for women. She has been in this business since 2001. Valentina is very polite and competent. She is highly respected among other entrepreneurs in the local market. Convenient locations for her two vending facilities and the trendy clothing and high quality, durable footwear she sells have helped her business be successful. Presently, she has about $2,400 of working capital. Her monthly net profit amounts to around $400. Valentina is requesting a loan for $1,000 to increase her inventory. She is planning to purchase seasonal footwear, sweaters, jumpers, skirts and pants. We believe her responsible attitude, entrepreneurial experience and top-rate service will help her succeed in business, promote stable growth of her sales and generate enough funds to provide for her family’s needs.

Валентина – одружена, в неї двоє дорослих дітей. Після технікуму вона працювала на заводі токарем, потім змінила місце роботи, деякий час працювала склярем. Однак, вона дуже нестабільно отримувала зарплатню, а отже, була змушена шукати інше джерело прибутку. Саму тому Валентина вирішила почати власний бізнес з продажу жіночого одягу та взуття. Вона займається цим бізнесом вже з 2001 року. Валентина – дуже ввічлива та компетентна. Вона користується повагою серед інших підприємців на місцевому ринку. Зручне розташування її торгівельних приміщень, вишуканий одяг та якісне взуття сприяли успішному зростанню її бізнесу. Зараз в неї є приблизно 2400 доларів робочого капіталу. Її щомісячний прибуток складає 400 доларів. Валентина просить про позику в 1000 доларів для того, щоб збільшити асортимент товарів. Вона планує придбати сезонне взуття, светри, джемпери, спідниці та штани. Ми переконані, що її відповідальність, підприємницький досвід та привітне обслуговування допоможуть їй досягти успіху в бізнесі, сприятимуть стабільному зростанню обсягів продажу та допоможуть їй отримати необхідні кошти для того, щоб забезпечити потреби власної родини.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana has operated her small men’s clothing business at the busy Ubileniy market in Marganets, for ten years. Marganets is located near the city of Nikopol in south central Ukraine. She has learned a lot over the years she’s been in business. Previously, Svetlana had worked in a clothing manufacturing plant. She has enjoyed the opportunity to work for herself and her income has been a big help to her and her husband, Alexander, as they’ve raised their son and daughter.

Svetlana has requested a loan that will enable her to buy product in bulk to sell in her kiosk. The ability to purchase in large quantities can save a lot of time, effort and money for her as she can obtain better pricing from her suppliers and make fewer trips to buy inventory. Svetlana is grateful for the financial support she has received through Nadiya Ukraine. We look forward to seeing her business continue to be successful and provide for Svetlana and her family.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock up his store

loans.name: Pinelo

texts.en: Pinelo is 43, and married with 3 children. Just about a month ago, they started with their plantation. Her husband and two family relatives are working very hard to cultivate the area with 100 banana tops. She used her first loan to buy cramoxone chemical and banana fertilizers. In the future, Pinelo is planning to export her bananas overseas and hopefully to get more demand locally.

loans.use: To assist with Banana Plantation

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio is 34 years old, single, and lives in a house with his parents. He has had his own glass business for more than 6 years. He began to work in Asuncion in a glass company, where he gained the knowledge and techniques to cut and shape glass. Later, he decided to open his own small company, which is going very well. Today, he counts on two other people who work with him, whom he taught and now employs, providing work in his community. He will use the loan to buy materials such as smooth glass of different sizes. He has a high demand from his customers, and he hopes to grow his business, create work and increase his income.

El señor Antonio tiene 34 años, es soltero, vive en casa de sus padres quienes estan a su cuidado. Antonio tiene su propio negocio, una vidrieria hace ya mas de 6 años. Empezó a tabajar en Asunción en una empresa de vidrios donde adquirió los conocimientos y técnicas del manejo de vidrios como cortes, encurvados, moldes y otros, posteriormente se decidió y emprendió su propia microempresa, donde le va muy bién, actualmente cuenta con dos personas quienes trabajan con él, les enseña el oficio y tembién les remunera, dando trabajo en su comunidad.. Planea con el crédito comprar de materia prima como vidrios templados, lisos de diferentes medidas, tiene una alta demanda, desea seguir agrandando su negocio, generar mano de obra y aumentar sus ingresos.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE GLASS FOR HIS BUSINESS

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of merchandise to increase sales.

loans.name: Lusia

texts.en:
This is 32 year-old Lusia M. from Mbeya, Tanzania. She is married with three children, aged 18 months, 8, and 12. In 2000 Lusia established a charcoal business, and now requires a loan of $200 in order to purchase additional stock in bulk. These small, black and dirty pieces of dry earth are important not just to charcoal sellers but to their customers, who rely on charcoal to cook their meals. Many Tanzanians still use small coal pots, in which they arrange mkaa (charcoal) and add either paper, dry grass, old plastic bags or kerosene in order to light them. The fire requires constant fanning to ignite and maintain the flame, and makes cooking quite a hot and laborious task. It may not be the easiest or most environmentally friendly form of cooking, but it is the only option many people can afford.

About SELFINA


SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania, where customs and traditions normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets. Because they lack tangible collateral assets, women are considered not creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low income.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA buys equipment and leases it to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from her, extending her a loan, and then leases the same equipment back to her – a process called "sale and leaseback".

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of charcoal in bulk.

loans.name: Murodjon

texts.en:
Muridjon N. is 32 years old. He is married with two children of school age.

Murodjon is a cattleman. He purchases the cattle in the local market, raises it and then sells it.  Currently he has  one cow and one calf in his household. Murodjon is not so experienced as he has only been in this business  for 2 years. However, already now the business brings the main significant income to the family allowing him to support the family.

Murodjon managed to make certain savings and he needs additional funds to purchase another 2 cows for  breeding. For this purpose he requests 300.00 US Dollars for the term of 10 months. This is the first loan of Murodjon, however, he is sure he shall be able to pay it in time and thanks all for their trust in him

loans.use: Purchasing of 2 more cows for breeding

loans.name: Ben

texts.en:
Ben, age 40, is a businessman with both wholesale and retail shops in Busaana trading center. He has been our client for 3 years out of the 6 years he has been in busines. Ever since he started getting loans, things are better every day. From his savings, he has managed to build a maize factory in Busaana, which is also doing very well.

The plaster on his face is a result of an accident that happened on his way home from his duties, but to him, this is no hindrance, since he gets the treatment desired and above all, his wife is a good help. He needs a loan to recapitalize his shops by buying more soda, beer, sugar, salt and other essentials.

loans.use: To buy more soda, beer, sugar, salt and other essentials for his retail shop.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Mrs. Ly P. is a 53-year-old woman living in Ampil, where most villagers live in extremely poor conditions. She dedicates herself as a subsistence farmer to support her family. She is the mother of one child, who has a job and can earn approximately $2 per day. Her husband, Tork Pach, is also a farmer, and they cultivate vegetables on a field next to the village. Simply put, Mrs. Ly P. and her husband grow different kinds of vegetables and they sell the vegetables to a middle-man to generate income for their family. Insufficient vegetable seeds and a lack of money presented the two with a problem, so Mrs. Ly P. is hereby requesting a loan to buy more vegetable seeds to cultivate on the field.

loans.use: To purchase additional vegetable seeds.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 28 year old man. He lives in Borj Barajneh, in the Beirut suburbs.

Mohamad is an artisan. This is the fourth time he has applied for a loan at Al Majmoua. With the loan, he wants to buy material for his business. He plans to use the increased income generated from the loan for his house.

loans.use: To buy materials

loans.name: Nanda Kumari

texts.en:
Nanda Kumari M. lives with her husband and two children in Thecho. Thecho is located in the Lalitpur district, and is a developing village in the region. In general, the majority of people who live in this region are engaged in farming operations.

Both Mrs. M. and her husband are engaged in handicraft work. In particular, they make different types of traditional idols which are in high demand by their customers. In Nepal, the demand for such traditional idols is constantly increasing, yet Mrs. M. and her husband do not have sufficient funds to invest in their works to meet their customers' demands. Accordingly, they are seeking a loan in the amount of $375 (Rs 25,000) to buy raw materials such as silver, gold, wax, etc., to be used in making traditional idols.

loans.use: To meet the high/increasing demand for their products by purchasing additional raw materials

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es:
El señor Reynaldo vive en casa de sus suegros en la calle Burgaleta de la zona de Achachicala de la ciudad de La Paz; la actividad que realiza es la de chofer de radio taxi, de la cual provienen sus ingresos mensuales. El credito que solicita es para la compra de una radio de comunicación ya que por el momento alquila una radio de la empresa donde trabaja, pero el costo es muy elevado y prefiere comprar una aunque a medio uso pero que sea de su propiedad. De esta manera, sus ingresos no se verán mermados por el alquiler mensual de la radio. No tiene crédito con IMPRO, es cliente nuevo pero califica para obtener un crédito, después del análisis de su flujo de caja.

Translated from Spanish by Eliza Wethey, Kiva Volunteer.

Mr. Reynaldo lives with his in laws on Burgaleta St. in the Achachicala neighborhood of LaPaz. He works as a chauffeur of a radio taxi which provides him with a monthly income. The loan he is asking for would be to purchase a radio for his taxi since he currently rents one from the company where he works. The rental cost is extremely elevated and he prefers to buy one, even a used one, so that it is his own. Thus his income will not be altered by the purchase of a radio since he is currently renting one. He does not have any previous credit with IMPRO but after a cash flow analysis he qualifies for a loan.

loans.use: Purchase of a radio for his radio taxi to eliminate the cost of a monthly rental.

loans.name: Houn

texts.en:
Mrs. Hour E., 32, is married with four children and works with her husband on their plot of farmland growing rice crops and various kinds of vegetables such as lettuce, tomatoes, and cucumbers. They collectively earn approximately five dollars per day from selling their crops at the market.

The prices they can get for their rice and vegetables are increasing from day to day. The couple would like to take advantage of the price increases by improving their crop yields. A loan would allow them to purchase more vegetable seeds, fertilizer, and gasoline to operate a water-pump for irrigating their crops. They would then have a higher inventory of produce and would increase their sales.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetable seeds, fertilizer and gasoline

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Trước khi tham gia vào quỹ tình thương kinh tế gia đình chị Bảy gặp rất nhiều khó khăn do đông con và thiếu vôn làm ăn. Năm 1994 khi Quỹ tình thương về xã Tiên Dược hoạt động chị đã bàn với chồng tham gia vàp Quỹ để vay vốn phát triển kinh tế gia đình. Với số vốnvay 300000đ ban đầu chị đã sử dụng để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi bước đầu thu nhập của gia đình chị đã được cải thiện hơn. Qua nhiều năm vay vốn của Quỹ đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn, gà kinh tế gia đình chị ngày càng phát triển, chị đã xây được một ngôi nhà khang trang và mua sắm được một số tiện nghi trong gia đình. Ngoài ra anh chị còn xây dựng được một khu trang trại để phục vụ cho chăn nuôi lợn giống và gà thịt. Hiện tại chị đang nuôi 40 con lợn thịt và 500 con gà. Chồng chị hiện cũng có một của hàng bán đồ điện tại chợ huyện. Các con chị đều đã có công ăn việc làm ổn định. Vòng vốn tới chị xin vay 19000000đ để tiếp tục đầu tư vao chăn nuôi và cửa hàng đồ điện. Thu nhập 10000000đ/ tháng
texts.en:
Before joining TYM Fund, Mrs. B.’s family encountered lots of difficulties because of large number of family members and lack of starting fund. In 1994, TYM Fund came to Tien Duoc area and therefore, Mrs. B. talked to her husband and decided to join the Fund. With a starting fund of 20 USD, she used the borrowed money in raising animals, improving her family income. After several years, her family economy has improvements. She is able to build a house and furnish her home. Besides, she and her husband are able to expand their farm to raise pigs and chickens. Currently, she is having 40 pigs and 500 chickens. Her husband also has a electronic shop in the market. Her children are all working. This time, she wants to borrow 1150 USD to invest more in her farm and in her husband’s electronic shop. Her average income is 625 USD/ month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising, business

loans.name: Dora

texts.es: Dora, D. 61 años D. edad es madre D. 5 hijos, todos profesionales gracias a la buena orientación que les impartieron ella y su esposo Ulderico.Ella se dedica a la venta D. bebidas heladas, venD. gaseosas, cervezas, y postres como queques y galletas en su domicilio, en la actualidad, no cuenta con un ambiente apropiado para este negocio por lo que quiere mandar a construir un local para ello.Dora tiene el deseo D. implementar y ver crecer su negocio, por ello necesita D. la cantidad que solicita, para poder lograr lo que desea.
texts.en:
Dora, 61 years old, is the mother of 5 children, who are all professionals thanks to the good upbringing that she and her husband, Ulderico, gave them. She sells cold drinks, soft drinks, beer and desserts such as cakes and cookes from her home. She does not currently have a proper place for this business and would like to build a space for this purpose. Dora wants to set up and see her business grow. For this she needs the loan she has applied for, so that she can achieve what she wants.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a space for her business and increase her stock of merchandise.

loans.name: Triunfadoras De Los Andes Group

texts.es:
La asociación denominada “Triunfadoras De Los Andes” pertenece a la familia de  pro-mujer hace ya mas de nueve años aproximadamente,  cumpliendo con 18 ciclos de crédito, esta  se encuentra en la zona de Los Andes, de la ciudad de El Alto, a la fecha  cuenta con 10 socias activas y han demostrado ser un grupo organizado en cuanto a sus cuotas de crédito.
Existen diferentes negocios  dentro la asociación como ser; la elaboración y venta de comida, confección y venta de chamarras, pero una de las actividades mas singulares es a  la que se dedican Sandra, Tania y Eufrasia, ellas realizan hermosos peluches de distintas formas y tamaños que luego de elaborarlos los distribuyen en tiendas de regalos, en distintos puntos de la ciudad y también de forma ambulante. 
La asociación Triunfadoras De Los Andes afirma que necesitan mayor capital para la compra de materia prima  de mejor calidad de esta manera sus productos también tendrían mejor calidad y así obtendrían  mayores clientes y por consiguiente mayores ganancias con el único objetivo de mejorar su situación económica.
texts.en:
The “Triunfadoras De Los Andes” [Victors of the Andes] Association has belonged to the Pro-Mujer family for more than nine years, fulfilling 18 credit cycles. The association is located in the city of El Alto in the Andes, and right now has 10 active members. They have demonstrated themselves to be organized in meeting their loan payments.

There are various businesses within the association such as food production and sales, and sewing and sales of jackets, but one of the most unique activities that the women carry out are the making of beautiful stuffed bears of different shapes and sizes, that are then distributed to gift shops in many areas of the city or sold through street vendors.

The Triunfadoras de Los Andes Association indicate that they need more capital so that they can purchase higher quality raw materials. By doing this, their products will also be of better quality. In this way they will acquire better clients and thus obtain greater earnings, so they can achieve their sole objective of improving their economic situation.

Translated from Spanish by Diane Lister, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: They need increased capital to buy better quality raw materials

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Santa Rita Village Bank. Maria is 42 years old and married with six children. She sells a variety of fruits from a mobile cart every day on Libertad Street in the city of Ayacucho. Her husband owns a locksmith shop, which he runs from their home.  Maria needs a loan of 600 soles to buy apples and bananas.  Maria dreams of improving and expanding her business, of selling fruit in bulk, and of improving her home.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow
 
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Santa Rita.  
Maria es casada, tiene 42 años y 6 hijos, Maria vende frutas variadas, actividad que realiza todos los días de manera ambulatoria en la calle libertad, Además su esposo tiene un taller de cerrajería en su casa. 
Maria necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de manzanas, plátanos. 
Maria sueña con mejorar su negocio, ampliar su negocio y ser mayorista, mejorar su casa.

loans.use: Buy apples and bananas to sell from a mobile cart

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es: Lourdes tiene 34 años y vive con su madre. Desde hace 8 años vende cosméticos, se inicia en este negocio por medio de la invitación de una de sus amigas, y desde entonces no ha parado de animarse cada día a continuar. En un inicio vendía de casa en casa, pero ahora ya tiene un pequeño espacio en un local comercial, es por ello que Lourdes sigue con grandes expectativas para su desarrollo  a fin de tener lo necesario y ayudar  en la economía de su casa. Para el futuro se está proyectando para arrendar un stand más grande donde pueda tener más productos de belleza. Es la primera vez que Lourdes solicita un préstamo con MFP, y está comprometida  a ser responsable en el pago de sus cuotas. Con esta cantidad de dinero podrá adquirir más cosméticos que tendrán buena demanda en esta fecha navideña.
texts.en:
Lourdes is 34 years old and lives with her mother. She began selling cosmetics 8 years ago, when she got started in the business with a friend. She has continued to pursue it every day since. She began by selling door-to-door but now she has a small space in a commercial location. She has great expectations to develop it in order to support her family economically. In the future, she plans to rent a bigger stand where she can feature more beauty products. This is the first time Lourdes has applied for a loan with MFP, and she promises to be responsible in the repayment of this loan. With this amount of money she will be able to get more cosmetics, which are in great demand this holiday season.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more costmetics

loans.name: Ilqar

texts.en:
Ilqar A. rents a little store where he sells foodstuffs. He buys his goods in a city which is one hour away from his home village. He goes for goods every week. His family members help him at the store. His wife doesn’t have another job but helps her husband in his business. His products are popular in his town for being cheap and fresh. That’s why he has many regular customers.

Ilqar has a wish to build his own store but needs a lot of money for that. So he wants to borrow money and use it in his business to make more profit. He will start saving money from his profits for a store and hopes that soon he will be able to start building a store of his own.

loans.use: purchase more foodstuffs for his little store

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel A. is married and has 4 dependents. He has received schooling through senior high. Emmanuel makes and sells palm oil at Ayaase Road near Cape Coast, which he has done since about 2 years ago. His wife is a petty trader.

Emmanuel uses his income to pay for the children's school fees, rent, utility bills and other financial expenses. Emmanuel will use the loan as additional capital to enable him to increase the purchase palm fruit for the production of the palm oil to meet the increase in demand by his customers. With the new profits from his expanded business, Emmanuel plans to reinvest for the expansion of his trade in palm oil.

loans.use: additional capital  for the production of the palm oil

loans.name: Cristal De Amistad Group

texts.es:
La asociación “Cristal de amistad “ pertenece al centro focal Senkata  ubicada en la ciudad de El Alto, hace seis años que trabajan junto a la familia de Pro – Mujer.
La mayoría casadas y con familias numerosas, necesitan recursos económicos, para cubrir  necesidades básicas  de sus hijos, que aumentan día tras día. Por este motivo  necesitan de mayores créditos para ampliar sus ventas con la seguridad de obtener mayores ingresos.
La asociación Cristal de amistad  se dedica al comercio en general, 
Jacinta por ejemplo se dedica a la venta de chuño, papa y tunta; María vende frutas de la temporada, Gabriel es chofer de transporte público. Otras de ellas venderán artículos para las fiestas de carnaval.
texts.en:
The association 'Cristal de amistad' ('Crystal Friendship') belongs to the focal center Senkata, located in the city of El Alto and for 6 years it has been working together with the Pro-Mujer (Pro-Woman) family.

The majority are married women and have large families; they need economic resources to cover their kids' basic needs which grow each and every day. It is for this reason that they need bigger credits; to increase their sales with the assurance of obtaining higher earnings.

The 'Cristal de amistad' association dedicates itself to business in general, for example Jacinta sells potato flour, and different types of potato; Maria sells seasonal fruit; Gabriel is a driver of public transport. Others among them will sell articles for the carnival parties.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The need to buy larger amounts of products/Necesitan comprar mayor cantidad de productos

loans.name: Emile

texts.fr: Né en 1964 à Anfoin dans la préfecture des lacs au sud du Togo, Mr Emile K. est marié avec deux (02) enfants à charge et réside actuellement à Kladjèmé où il mène comme activité la culture des produits vivriers (piments, tomates fraîches, gombo, etc.…). C’est une activité qui lui rapporte énormément en terme de revenu. C’est pourquoi il veut étendre sa surface cultivable et acheter des engrais pour la fertilisation des sols. Il sollicite donc pour cela un financement. Cela va accroître ses rendements et forcement ses revenus.
texts.en:
Mr. Emile K. was born in 1964 in Anfoin in Southern Togo. He's married, has two children to support, and currently lives in Kladjèmé where his business consists in growing food products (chili pepper, fresh tomatoes, okra, ...). This business earns him a solid income. This is why he wants to expand his arable area and buy fertilizers. He's therefore seeking a loan, in order to increase his yields and his income.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand his arable area and buy fertilizers

loans.name: Savy

texts.en:
Mrs. Savy H., 44, and her husband, Mr. Sam-ath Un, 48, have seven children: two sons and five daughters. One of their children is married and lives outside the family home; one son is a car driver for a Tourist Service in Phnom Penh; one daughter is a garment factory worker and another one is in school. The family lives along a national road about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Savy has been selling Cambodian cakes for two years; she buys them from the Koki market for resale in her village. Her husband is a car driver for a Tourist Service in Phnom Penh. Savy is asking for a loan of $1,000 to build a fence around of her house.

loans.use: To build a fence around of her house.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Since 2001, Rose C. has worked as a trader selling various foodstuffs at Dwomo Primary School near Shama Junction. She sells food such as cooked rice, palm nut soup and beans. She is married with three children and received an education through junior high school. While Rose works as a trader, her husband is employed as a painter. She is responsible for assisting her husband in the upkeep of the family and also for paying various family expenses.

Rose’s loan will be used to increase her capital base to buy more foodstuffs for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a home for her aged mother and for her children.

loans.use: To increase her capital base and buy more foodstuffs for resale

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.en:
G. Phạm Thị lives in the town of Quảng Xương. She is 59 years old and married, and she has three adult-aged children. G. owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising pigs for sale. G. is new to this business and earns approximately 1,000,000 VND a month from this activity.

In 2006, G. joined TYM Fund in order to gain access to financial services so she can help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. G. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock.

G. is now requesting a new loan of 5,000,000 VND, which will be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell in the future. The loan will be the fourth loan taken out by this borrower from TYM Fund. G. plans to use the additional revenue that the loan is expected to generate to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy E. has a pineapple and plantain farm. She is 53 years old and married with five children. She hopes for the loan of N70,000 to clear her farm and purchase more pineapple and plantain suckers to plant. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To clear her farm and purchase more pineapple and plantain suckers to plant

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en: Lilia is married to Samuel P. and they are blessed with two children: Samenly and Snyki. Samenly is a pharmacist in a mercury drug business in Roxas, Isabela while Snyki operates a gown rental business. The gowns are personally designed. Lilia on the other hand manages a general store and sells school supplies. Lilia is requesting a loan from KIVA lenders of PHP5,000 as additional working capital for her business. Her dream is to become a successful business operator someday and have a sustainable business to support her family's needs, including their health.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Wilson

texts.es:
el señor Wilson Daniel M. tiene 33 años de edad, vive en la colonia 17 de septiembre y tiene 16 años de vivir en esa zona, el esta casado con la señora Reina Isabel Rivas con la que ha procreado 03 hijos dos de ellos estan en el colegio.
su esposa le ayuda en el negocio de la venta de confites y galletas las venden en las escuelas y pulperias de la zona.  el producto lo transporta en su carro y ademas el señor wilson tiene un taxi que le genera Lps. 250.00 diarios.
 
este negocio lo realiza desde hace dos años logrando asi una buena estabilidad economica para el y su familia, el necesita el credito para comprar 8 cajas de bombones, 2 cajas de conserva, 5 cajas de galletas, 4 cajas de gelatina, 5 cajas de chicles. 
 
su deseo es convertir su negocio en una distribuidora fuerte de confites y galletas de la zona.
texts.en:
Sr. Wilson Daniel M., 33, has lived in the 17 de Septiembre neighborhood for 16 years. He is married to Sra. Reina Isabela Rivas and they have 3 children, including two in high school. Wilson's wife helps him operate his business selling sweets and snacks at schools and corner stores in the neighborhood. He carries his products in his car and also operates a taxi business that generates Lps. 250.00 per day.

He set up his business two years ago and, with the business, managed to get greater economic stability for himself and his family. He needs the loan to buy 8 cases of bonbons, 2 cases of jam, 5 cases of cookies, 4 cases of gelatin, and 5 cases of chewing gum

His hope is to grow his business into a strong distributor of sweets and snacks in the neighborhood.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for sweets and snacks business.

loans.name: Zarmena Group

texts.en:
Zarmena is the group leader of Zarmena group. There are three members in this group. They live in district 11 and they are requesting a group loan of 15,000 Afghani to increase their income and progress their businesses.

Zarmena wants to take a loan for her hairdressing business. She wants to buy cosmetic things for her business. Fazelah wants to take a loan for her embroidery business. Fowzya wants to take a loan for her tailoring business. She wants to buy new machine for her business. They are very happy with this small loan in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To make their businesses larger

loans.name: La Esperanza Dos Group

texts.es: El banco comunal “Los Esperanza Dos” están representados por la señora Neli y conformados por 15 integrantes los cuales se dedican a la venta de verduras, ropa, comida, cosméticos, trasporte público y construcción de viviendas. La competencia a nivel comercial es alta pero la socias tienen mucha experiencia y saben como sacar adelante sus negocios ofreciendo productos variados y de buena calidad. El crédito que han obtenido, es para aumentar su capital de trabajo y emprender pequeños negocios para incrementar más sus ganancias, que se traduce en mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias que día a día van mejorando mas, por ello están muy agradecidos por la confianza depositada para seguir trabajando con mas ganas. La socias van cursando su primer ciclo pero ya cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios por lo se comprometen a dar todo de si para salir adelante con responsabilidad y unidad.
texts.en:
The Community Bank "Los Esperanza Dos" is represented by Neli, and it is made up of 15 other members who sell vegetables, clothing, prepared foods, and provide public transportation as well as construction services. There is a great deal of competition in the market but the members are highly experienced and they know how to prosper their businesses, offering variety and quality in their products. The loan they have requested will be used as working capital to invest in their small busiensses, to improve their earnings. This all translates into a better quality of life for their families, seeing improvements day after day. They are very grateful for the trust that has been given them and will work even harder than before. The members are currently on their first loan cycle but they have participated in groups before. They promise to give all that they have to prosper their businesses responsibly.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Dengola Group

texts.en:
Dengola is a group of 5 borrowers, led by Mafata K., living in Zorzor, Lofa County, Liberia. Mafata is married with 9 children, age 8 to 30. Mafata is 45 years old, and lives in nearby Borkeza Town.

Mafata has been running a fried fish restaurant for the last 10 years, purchasing the fish locally and preparing them in her Borkeza market stall. With the loan she will purchase materials (palm oil, fish, flour) to serve more customers. Mafata is successful because she prepares and markets her fish well. With the profits she dreams of building a permanent restaurant in town and saving for her children's education.

loans.use: To increase inventory.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn B. owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food and daily use products in her community. She is 52 years old, married and has five adult children. She is from the village of Naawan, Misamis Oriental. Evelyn has been in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Evelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Evelyn is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase products to sell. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Phea

texts.en: Mrs. Phea P. is villager in Deum Por village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn for living. In this farming, she faces a small problem because she does not have ability to buy rice seed to cultivate rice thus she decided to ask for a loan to buy them for her purpose. Aside from this, she would use the rest of the loan to buy fertilizers to support the field to make her crop more productive. Her husband, Mr. Raing Sophat, also helps her to improve the living conditions. Mrs. Phea P. has five children one of whom is employed in a garment factory while other two are attending the local school and the others are staying at home because they are too young to work and study. Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to support the field to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: a variety of goods for resale

loans.name: Florence's Group

texts.en:
N. Florence is such a hardworking and friendly lady. She is a businesswoman with a business of selling agricultural produce including cassava, sweet potatoes, matooke (plantain) and fresh beans from the Total market.

Florence is a married lady with six children, the eldest being a candidate in senior four while the last born is still a baby.

Florence is grateful for her loans because they have always helped her in having enough stock for her stall as well as being able to save for the well-being of her children. This is Florence’s second loan with the group and she hopes to buy more agricultural produce to sell.

loans.use: To buy more matooke, sweet potatoes, cassava and fresh beans to sell

loans.name: Felista

texts.en: Felista L. is a Tanzanian entrepreneur and businesswoman. She is married with three school-age children. She runs a café at Tandika District in Dar es Salaam. The business has enabled her to buy a plot of land for house construction, to pay the children school fees and to have capital for the business. She is comfortable with her business but her future plans are to expand the business by modifying the existing business and opening another business. She has been in the business for four years. She needs a loan of Tshs 800,000 to buy more business goods

loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Senya

texts.en:
Senya M. is currently in the business of selling tea and bread in the market. She is requesting a loan to stock more bags of sugar and powdered milk to sell.  Senya is 35 years old and is widowed. She has five children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more sugar and powdered milk to sell

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is married. He has 3 daughters and a son. He lives in Novomoskovsk. Alexander sells bread and baked goods in his hometown. He uses high tech equipment, cheap power resources, a special dough formula and quality grain, which helps him have a favorable standing in this market. Alexander has another big advantage: one of his biggest competitors has just withdrawn from the market, leaving him more freedom to grow his venture. 

Alexander has been running this business for 2 years. His exclusive product and hard work have helped him make his business a success with about 150,000 Grivnyas in turnover capital. Alexander is seeking a loan of 14,500 Grivnyas to further develop his business and to make it run more efficiently.

loans.use: To develop his business.

loans.name: Ilere

texts.en: Illere I. sells groceries at retail prices to her customers. She hopes to own a super market in the future. She is a LAPO (Lift above poverty organization) client.  LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. Imada is 43 years old and married with 6 children. Her husband is a welder and he also supports the household. She is requesting a loan amount of NGN 120,000 to purchase more groceries to sell. She says "thanks" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Louise

texts.fr: Louise D. est une femme de 62 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 10 enfants dont 5 en charge. Son objectif est de développer un petit commerce de draps de lit afin de générer de profits qui lui permettront de participer à la prise en charge familiale et de subvenir à ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
Louise D., 62, is married and the mother of 10 children, of whom 5 are still in her care. Her goal is to grow a little business selling bedsheets so that she can generate income that will allow her to help support her family and cover her own personal needs.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: bolster her little business selling bedsheets

loans.name: Darling De Jesús

texts.es: La señora Darling trabaja en la Universidad popular de Nicaragua ella es egresada de la carrera de Administración de empresas en donde ella no ha podido gestionar el titulo por falta de dinero ya que se lo están exigiendo en su trabajo, el crédito lo solicito para pagar un curso te titulación y así poder obtenerlo y poder tener su trabajo ya que es madre de dos niñas una de cinco años y la otra de siete añitos y ella es el sustento de sus hijas, con esto podrá tener una mejor base en su trabajo y así tener una estabilidad para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Darling works at La Universidad Popular de Nicaragua. She went through the university's Business Administration program but has not been able to get her degree due to a lack of money. Since her job is requiring her it of her, she is requesting a loan to pay for a final course to obtain her degree and then be able to keep her job. Since she is a mother of two daughters, ages 5 and 7, and she supports them on her own, with this she will be able to have a better foundation at work and stability for her family's welfare.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Shimmin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To take a class to get her degree

loans.name: Abiola

texts.en:
Abiola has a fish pond where she raises fingerlings into fish to sell. She loves this business because of the profits. She works hard to ensure that her fish-pond business expands. She hopes for a loan of 30,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more fingerlings to raise into fish to sell. She is a hardworking woman and she is so determined to excel in business and family life. 

She is married with two children. Her husband is a civil servant and he also supports their home. Her children attend school and this gives her joy. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more fingerlings

loans.name: Milliana

texts.en: Millliana is a single mother of one.  She runs a salon named Jasmine Salon located in Eastleigh market.   Faulu Kenya has really changed her business since she has learned business management.   She has therefore, requested for Kes.20,000 to buy a hair blow drier and hair drier.  She hopes to open other business outlets such as a boutique in the future.

loans.use: To purchase hair blow drier and hair drier

loans.name: Chi

texts.en:
Chi N., age 42, is married and lives with her four children in Takeo province, Cambodia.

N. is engaged in a business weaving Cambodian traditional silk products, earning an income of 2 USD per day to help cover the family expenses. Her husband is a farmer growing rice on his own plot of farmland, earning an income of 1.50 USD per day.

Their standard of living has been improved since N. has had this business. She is requesting a loan of 1,100 USD to purchase more raw silk to produce silk products. This is her second loan from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner.

loans.use: To buy more silk for her silk-weaving business

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.es: Eulalia tiene 31 años, es una madre de familia muy amorosa y responsable, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo Aquiles de 32 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, quienes son el motivo principal de todos sus esfuerzos para salir adelante. Desde muy pequeña ha trabajado junto a sus padres en el cultivo de la tierra, con los años ha logrado comprarse sus propias chacras y ahora es una de las principales productoras de papa y arveja de su ciudad, en donde sus compradores van hacia allá para comprar sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos y lo hace con mucho cariño, es por ello que lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta el mercado, ya que es muy difícil encontrar camiones que quieran llevar los pesados sacos que llevan su producción. Con el paso del tiempo, desea comprarse un carro, en donde su esposo pueda realizar el trabajo de transportar sus productos con mayor tranquilidad. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP, está muy segura de poder pagar puntualmente todas sus cuotas, ya que siempre ha sido muy responsable. En tanto en su grupo comunal, es una socia muy alegre y solidaria. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará abono y fertilizantes para mejorar la rendimiento de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Eulalia, 31, is a loving and responsible mother; she lives in her own home with her husband, Aquiles, 32, and their three beloved children, who are the motivating force behind all her efforts to succeed. Since she was a little girl she worked the fields alongside her parents; as time has gone by, she has managed to buy her own farmlands and now she is one of the main potato and pea producers in her city. Buyers come to her to purchase her products. What she likes best about her work is tending her crops, a task she does lovingly. She has been in this line of work for 15 years and considers the most difficult part of it transporting the goods to market because it’s very difficult to find trucks willing to carry the heavy sacks. In time, she’d like to buy a car so that her husband can transport the products more easily. This is her 6th loan with MFP and she’s sure to be able to repay on time because she’s always been very responsible. She is a cheerful and cooperative group member. She will use the requested 2000 new soles to buy manure and fertilizers in order to improve crop yields.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy manure and fertilizer.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora M. is from the village of Pag-asa, Valencia City. She is 55 years old. Teodora is married and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Teodora owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Teodora has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Teodora joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Teodora has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Teodora is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 10th loan taken out by Teodora from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Gul Arghawan Group

texts.en:
Burhanudin is the group leader of the Gul Arghawan group. He lives in the 1st district, Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and lives in a household with five other members, his wife and his four children. His children are school students. He is a butcher and has a butcher shop. He works hard there and all his family members benefit through the income he generates. 

Burhanudin needs the loan to purchase goats, cows and other animals for slaughtering and also to expand his business. He hopes to progress and open another shop in future next to his current one.

loans.use: To purchase goats and cows and to expand his business

loans.name: Gogaya Women's B, Ibanda Group

texts.en:
In business, first impressions mean everything. That is one adage that never slips N. Teo’s mind. In her six years running a bar business in Mubende town, her commitment, friendly nature and hard work have brought her dividends. This is the fascinating story of a young, single, go-getter business lady.

Teo’s business, since its inception, has been steadily bringing her profits to the tune of 400,000 shillings on a monthly basis. With this loan she is gleefully upbeat that her business will gain further ground as she intends to buy more stock of drinks like beers, sodas and wines plus more produce for resale.

loans.use: To purchase more beers, sodas and wines as well as more maize to sell

loans.name: Noeurn's Group

texts.en:
This group loan is made up of two people in the Chrey Young village in Kandal province. Mrs. Noeurn K. is the group leader, selected by the other member, who will use her own portion of their loan for her own business-related purpose. At age 52, Mrs. Noeurn K. is a widow. She has one child, who is a musician. 

Mrs. Noeurn K. is a farming laborer and farmer who owns a small piece of land on which she cultivates rice. She sells the rice to support her family. Her problem is that her field contains infertile soil. Therefore, to improve production, she is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer. With the rest of the loan, she hopes to hire one or two farming laborers to help her grow her rice.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her rice field

loans.name: Deisi Marivel

texts.es:
Deisi Marivel Y. O. tiene 25 años. Tiene 2 niños, Darlen (4) y Britney (8), y vive en unión libre en el cantón de Chillanes en la provincia de Bolívar.

Deisi es una socia de la ventanilla rural Santa Rosa, que está ubicada a una hora y media del cantón Chillanes.  Son 18 socios en total, que en la mayoridad tienen sus propios negocios. Esto es el primer  préstamo que ellos sacan con la Cooperativa San José.

Deisi se dedica a la peluquería. Realiza cortas de cabello, manicura, pedicura, tintes y rayitos. Realiza sus compras en la casa de peluquero de mujeres en Guayaquil. 

Solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales y productos para su peluquería. Su sueño es  convertirse en una persona útil y que a su peluquería le siga yendo bien para servir a los clientes. Quisiera salir adelante y poder ayudar en lo posible a sus amigos e hijos. 

Le gusta escuchar música y en las noches se dedica a jugar indoor fútbol con un grupo de amigos. Le gusta atender a su familia.
texts.en:
Deisi Marivel Y. O. is 25 years old and has two children, Darlen (age 4) and Britney (age 8). She is in a common law marriage and lives in the canton of Chillanes in Bolivar Province.

Deisi is a member of the Santa Rosa Communal Bank, which is located an hour and a half away from the canton of Chillanes. There are 18 members in total, most of whom have their own businesses. This is the first loan they have obtained through Cooperativa San José.

Deisi works as a hairdresser. She provides haircuts, manicures, pedicures, coloring, and highlights. Deisi provides her services at a women’s hair salon in Guayaquil.

She is requesting a loan to buy materials and products for her business. Her dream is to become a more useful person and that her salon will continue to do well in providing good service to her customers. She wants to succeed so that she can help her friends and her children as much as she can.

Deisi enjoys listening to music and playing indoor soccer in the evenings with a group of her friends. She also likes attending to her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials & products for her salon

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson C. is from the village of Brgy. Bonfal East, Bayombong,Nueva Vizcaya. He is 45 years old. Nelson is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Nelson owns & operates a business venture in the services sector providing transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating motorcycle transport business. Nelson has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 2500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Nelson joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nelson has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase tires and other accessories. Nelson is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to repair existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Nelson from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of the family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair an existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Misirat's Group

texts.en: Misirat K. is the leader of this group. She is 55 and married with two sons. Her older son went to Russia to work to make some money and the second is engaged in cattle breeding. Having saved some money, Misirat and her husband bought a bull and resold it at a higher price after fattening. With that profit Misirat purchased a cow and a calf. She also sells milk every day and in this way she makes 2,000 soms per month. With the loan, Misirat wants to purchase a cow for breeding. Gulaiym N., 27, is married and has two daughters and a son. Her older daughter is in school while the others are not yet schooling. In order to make money Gulaiym breeds cattle and her husband works as a truck driver. Ten years ago, with the initial investment of 8,000 soms, she bought a calf and, since that time, she started to breed cattle. She applied for the loan because she wants to purchase a cow in order to increase the number of her cattle. In the future she plans to repair her house. Janyshbek A., 26, is married and has a two-year-old daughter. In order to make money, Janyshbek breeds cattle and also transports various fruits and vegetables to Bishkek to sell. He applied for the loan because he needs money to purchase potatoes which he plans to transport to Bishkek to sell. Mahbubahan A. is the treasurer of the group. She is 51 and married with three daughters and a son. Two older daughters are married and live separately with their families, the son went to Russia to work and the youngest daughter helps with housework. Mahbubahan breeds cattle and also sells dairy products, making 2,200 soms per month. With the loan, she wants to purchase a calf for breeding. In the future she plans to increase the number of her cattle and save money to be able to pay for her children’s university education. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for breeding

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda B. is from the village of Gata Diot Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 51 years old, married, and has 3 adult-aged children. Melinda owns and operates a transportation business which provides tricycle transport like "habal-habal" (sa motorcycle with an extended seat that carries 2-6 passengers) services. Melinda has been engaged in her business for over 2 years.

In 2010, Melinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melinda is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to repair her existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Melinda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert T. is from the village of Ubong, Solana, Cagayan. He is 23 years old. Robert is married and has one infant child. To make a living, Robert owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Robert has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

Robert joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Robert has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from ASKI. Robert is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Robert from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a housewife and mother of two daughters and four sons, one of her sons works in a company in Ramallah while the others are still students. Hanan's husband is a school teacher.
Hanan's oldest son got married recently, and Hanan wanted to help her son pay off a part of the wedding expenses as he couldn't cover it all. So, she came to FATEN and received a $3,000 loan, which helped her son have his wedding on time.

Hanan who appears in the picture at FATEN's office is a very decent mother from Jineen

loans.use: Pay off wedding expenses

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 28 years old and married.  He owns a cafeteria which he has been running for six years.  He is a member of Upendo women's group in Faulu Kenya.  He says that he has learnt how to keep track of his business profits through Faulu Kenya.  

Currently, he runs the business with two employees and he hopes to develop his business further.  He sees himself owning several cafeterias in the future.  He has requested 70,000 Kes to buy rice, maize flour, beans, Irish potatoes, cooking fat, tea leaves and milk.

loans.use: To buy rice, maize flour, beans, Irish potatoes, cooking fat, tea leaves and milk

loans.name: Asterie

texts.en: Asterie is 33 years old. She is single. She sells mineral water and yellow bananas, and has spent 9 months in this business. With this loan she will buy more mineral water and yellow bananas to sell. With the profit from this business she will purchase more cartons of mineral water. She says that her business is successful because it is commonly known by her customers. In the future, she would like to become a wholesale supplier to other sellers.

loans.use: To buy more mineral water and yellow bananas to sell.

loans.name: Leyla

texts.ru:
Leyla A. 27 let. Ona zamujem i imeyet 3 detey sin 7 let uchitsya v shkole doch 5 let i sin 3 let. Leyla yavlyayetsya IDP personom ona pereselenec iz Xodjali i seychas projivayet v Absheron regionevmeste so semyoy. 

Ona uje 3 qoda kak imeyet maqazin. Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chto bi kupit vitrinniye xolodilniki  dlya razvitiya svoyeqo biznessa.
texts.en: Leyla A. is 27 years old.  She is married and has 3 children: 7-year-old son, who goes to school, 5-year-old daughter and 3-year-old son.  Leyla is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  She is a refugee from Xodjali and now lives in the Absheron region with her family.  Leyla has owned a store for 3 years.  Currently, she needs 2000 AZN in order to buy display refrigerators for the development of her business.

loans.use: Purchase of display refrigerators for the store

loans.name: San Antonio Iii Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre San Antonio  se conformó en fecha 25 octubre del 2.010, se encuentran en el 1°ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
Este comité está comenzando con mucha esperanza de trabajar un buen tiempo entre todas y trabajar para conseguir los beneficios para las mismas y para sus familias.
Cada una se encuentra trabajando en sus actividades y otras están comenzando con algún trabajo que les pueda generar ingreso y así pagar sus cuotas y al mismo tiempo obtener un ingreso para su familia. 

Una de las integrantes es la  Sr. Angélica G. quien se dedica a la compra y venta de ropas, y comenta que es muy difícil vender este producto en su comunidad por la competencia que hay, por ello solicita el préstamo para la compra de nuevas mercaderías que puedan atraer a clientes. 
Quiere contar con todas la prendas de vestir de temporada como vestidos, remeras, shorts y además calzados. 
Espera mejorar sus ventas y asegura que aprovechará al máximo el crédito que recibió y agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por la confianza en su comité.
texts.en:
The San Antonio III women's committee was founded on the 25th of October 2010.  They are in their first loan cycle as a united and supportive group within the program.

This committee is starting out with great hopes of working together for a long time and working to benefit themselves and their families.
