Each one of the committee's members has her own business activity and some are starting out in a business activity which can generate income and thereby enable them to make their repayments and, at the same time, make profits for their families.

One of the committee's members is Angélica G. who buys and sells clothes.  She comments that it is very difficult to sell these products in her community because there is a lot of competition.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy new merchandise which can attract customers.  She would like to have all clothes which are in season such as dresses, t-shirts, shorts and also footwear.

She hopes to improve her sales and assures us that she will take maximum advantage of the loan which she received.  She thanks Fundación Paraguaya for the trust which they have placed in her committee.

loans.use: To buy footwear, t-shirts, blouses, dresses, etc.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen D. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 40 years old, married and has two children aged four and eight. To make a living, Helen owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting and harvesting rice for sale. Helen is a hardworking and loving mother. She only wants the best for her family. She is starting to save little by little for her children's future.
Helen joined Kiva partner, CEVI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Helen is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase farm inputs and gasoline for the tractor.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs and gasoline for tractor

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Muhammad is a 21-year-old man from Tulkarem city, Muhammad had to leave school when he was young and started working to help his family. He is now employed as a guard by the Engineers Association in Tulkarem. Muhamamd wants to go back to school and earn a degree. He came to FATEN for a loan to pay for high school exam fees and the college tuition next year.

Muhammad is a smart and respected man who wants to improve his situation and continue his education to improve his life and get a better job.


Muhammad is receiving the loan at the Tulkarem branch office in the picture above.

loans.use: To pay for high school exam now and university tuition fees later

loans.name: Maria Angelica

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “BUENA ESPERANZA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria Angelica; ella tiene 29 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de desayunos,ella prepara dieferentes desayunos como leche,chocolate,café y sandwichs,ella trabaja desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia quiere mejorar y ampliar el negocio de desayunos.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para preparar desayunos. 
 
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower is a member of the "Buena Esperanza" ["Good Hope"] communal bank, which is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

This borrower is Ms. Maria Angelica.  She is 29 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has two children.  Maria Angelica divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling breakfast.  She prepares a variety of breakfasts, such as milk, hot chocolate, coffee, and sandwiches.  She works from 5:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m.  She hopes to expand and improve her breakfast business.  She is requesting a loan to buy products for preparing breakfasts.

Maria Angelica is happy to receive this loan and promises to comply with the established repayment schedule.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for preparing breakfast

loans.name: Jenny's Group

texts.en: To make a living, Jenny G. owns and operates a general store selling a variety of different products in her community. She is 29 years old, married and has two school-aged children. They are from the village of Nabbotuan. Jenny has been in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Jenny joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She is requesting for a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her first loan from ASKI. She plans to use additional income to improve and expand her business. Jenny is the leader of a six member group accessing a loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members, if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is "Jenny G.". About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Fidelina

texts.es:
La Sra. Fidelina C. es originaria del municipio de Achuapa, es casada y cuenta con el apoyo de su hija las cuales trabajan en conjunto en su negocio el cual consiste en una Pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación desde hace 15 años.
Desde que inició su negocio se ha caracterizado por dar una buena atención a sus clientes y gracias al esfuerzo propio y de su familia ha podido diversificarlo en productos y a bajos precios lo que atrae la atención de los mismos. Una de las necesidades que tiene esta señora es contar con mas capital para adquirir productos básicos como arroz, azúcar, frijoles, jabón, aceite, ace, gaseosas y pollo los que son más consumidos por los clientes y así satisfacer la demanda de los mismos, por tal razón decidió solicitar su primer crédito en Ceprodel con el objetivo de cumplir con su necesidad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fidelina C. is from the town of Achuapa.  She is married and has a dauther who helps run the grocery store that they have had in their home for 15 years.

Since the start of her business she has been well known for her attention to customers.  Thanks to her own hard work and her family's support she has been able to branch out into different product lines offering low prices.  She is now in need of more capital to buy basic goods such as rice, sugar, beans, soap, oil, softdrinks and chicken, which are what her customers demand most.

She requested this loan, her first through Ceprodel, in order to help cover her needs.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, beans, soap, oil, softdrinks and chicken

loans.name: Jose Roberto

texts.es: El Sr. Roberto, construirá una pequeña habitación, porque actualmente están viviendo en casa de su suegra, en donde ya se les dio un pedacito de terreno para que construyan una habitación para el  bebe que ellos tienen, ya que es un matrimonio joven que tiene muchos proyectos a futuro y son muy trabajadores, es por eso que decidieron ser padres, por este motivo que ellos, están construyendo esa otra habitación, para tener un poco mas de privacidad y darle a su familia un hogar
texts.en: Sr. Roberto will construct a small house, because he and his wife are now living in the home of his mother-in-law, where she has already given them a little piece of land so that they can build a house for their baby. Since they are a young married couple, they have many projects for the future, and they are very hard-working. This is why they decided to become parents, and this is why they are constructing another house, so that they can have a little more privacy and give their family a home.

loans.use: Construct a room

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Adelisa

texts.en:
Adelisa is a married woman who lives in  Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a general store, a carenderia (local eatery) and a tricycle transport business. Her husband Carlito, who is 52 years old, works as a carpenter to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have four children who are between 22 and 28 years old. 

Adelisa joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1993 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 18 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Adelisa has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 23,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 11,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 19th loan, she is borrowing PHP 25,000 to buy more stock for the store so that she can continue to save up for the future enlargement of her business. Adelisa is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Sudat

texts.en:
Sudat is 27 years old and a single mother of one child living in her own house in Hioma, Uganda. 

She has no other dependents and her family goal is to be able to provide basic needs for her child. 

For three years she has been running a salon business and hopes that her salon will grow bigger and that she can relocate it to a better place. 

She needs the loan for buying weaves and a hair drier for her salon.

loans.use: to pay for weaves and a hair drier for her salon

loans.name: Merilyn's Group

texts.en:
Merilyn O. is from the village of Sinonoc, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 42 years old. Merilyn is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Merilyn is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Merilyn owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Merilyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Merilyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Merilyn has successfully repaid previous loans from GDMPC.  Merilyn O.'s group is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Merilyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy 4 sets of plastic tables and chairs, a microwave oven, a blender, 6 gallons of paint, 2 quintals of American rice, 80 lbs of pork, 70 lbs of beef, 1 quintal of beans, 2 quintals of sugar and 2 barrels of oil

loans.name: Agarjav

texts.en:
Mr. Agarjav B. is 34 years old and a former dancer. He lives with his younger sister in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

Until 2010, he was working as a professional dancer in a military dance ensemble. In 2010 he quit the ensemble due to an injury and started running a dance class for children. He works together with his former teacher. 

At the moment, his group has around 40 children aged 6 to 14. 

Agarjav’s younger sister is unemployed at the moment. Therefore, he wants to run a grocery retail kiosk at the food market to involve his sister.  

The loan Agarjav is taking will be used to install big mirrors in his dance classroom and part will be used to buy the necessary products to resell in his kiosk.

loans.use: To install big mirrors in his dance classroom and to buy necessary products to resell in his kiosk.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
Nilda es socia del  Banco Comunal “Hermanas de Choquetanca II”, ubicado en el distrito Ilave, provincia El Collao departamento de Puno, tiene 24 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos.  Nos cuenta que sólo puedo estudiar hasta 3ro de secundaria.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde  hace un ciclo, con su primer préstamo solicitado fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio compra y venta de animales domésticos como ovino, vacuno y porcinos.  Como casi todas las pobladoras de Puno, también se dedica la chacra.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, incrementará al capital de su negocio para comprar  cinco unidades de ovejas.  En el negocio trabaja junto con su esposo, también cuenta que su esposo trabaja en la pesca. 
Su sueño es tener ganados mejorados y así tener mayores ganancias.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la reunión y la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Nilda is a member of the Sisters of Choquetanca II Communal Bank, located in the Llave district, province of El Collao, department of Puno. She is 24 years old, married and has two children; she says that she was only able to study up to her junior year of high school.

Nilda has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for a year, her first loan was S/. 500.00 nuevos soles and was used in her business, buying and selling domestic animals like sheep, cattle and pigs. As most of the inhabitants of Puno she works in a small farm.

With this new loan of S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles she will increase her work capital to buy five sheep. Nilda works with her husband who also works as a fisherman.

Nilda’s dream is to have better cattle to have more profits.

What she enjoys about her Communal Bank is the meetings and the ease of getting the loan.

loans.use: buy 5 sheep.

loans.name: Nora

texts.es: Nora, de 31 años, es una mujer fuerte y luchadora, convive con Ronald, de 26 años, ambos tienen 3 hijos Josue de 12, Yens de 8 y Yoice de 4 años, ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en la selva peruana (comunidad nativa Centro Pumpuriani). Todas las mañanas como de costumbre, se dirige con su hija Yoice a cuidar sus cultivos de café, plátano y yuca. Lo que les gusta es poder limpiar, podar y cuidar de sus plantaciones; ya que desde los 12 años su abuelita le enseñó a trabajar la tierra y sobrevivir de ella. Más le desagrada tener que caminar horas para poder llegar a sus terrenos de cultivo que se ubican en la zona alta de su localidad. Cuando sus cultivos están maduros los vende a los comerciantes que llegan constantemente a la comunidad, caso contrario sucede con el cultivo de Yuca; Nora viaja una vez por semana al mercado central de su ciudad para poder vender su producto. Ahora esta pensando sembrar maíz hibrido (llamado también polenta), ya que tiene mayor demanda en la zona; de la misma manera sembrará plantas estables como cítricos y con ello asegurará su producción en el futuro. Como también desea invertir en la creación de una tienda de comestibles, donde pueda vender productos de primera necesidad a los pobladores del lugar, ya que por ser una zona alejada de la ciudad no hay negocio de este rubro. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Abejitas de Pumpuriani”, y este es el quinto crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Nora de obtener su ayuda; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico para esparcirlos en sus cultivos de café. Ya que se fertiliza 3 veces al año para mantenerlos fuertes.
texts.en:
Nora, 31, is a strong, tenacious woman.  She lives with Ronald, 26, and they have three children: Josué, 12, Yens, 8 and Yoice, 4. They live in their own house located in the Peruvian jungle (native community of Centro Pumpuriani).

Every morning, as usual, she takes her daughter Yoice with her to care for her coffee, banana and manioc crops.   What she enjoys doing is weeding, pruning and caring for her plants.  Since the age of 12 her grandmother taught her how to work the soil and subsist from it.  However, she does not enjoy having to walk hours to reach her farmland which is located in a higher zone of her location.  When her crops are mature she sells them to merchants that constantly visit the community.  She does the opposite, though, with the manioc crops: Nora travels once a week to the city’s central market to sell it.

Now, she’s planning to farm a hybrid strain of corn, also called polenta, since it’s in high demand in the zone.  She will also plant stable plants, like citrus, which will assure future production.

In addition, she also wants to invest in a grocery store where she can sell basics to local residents because given that the area is far from the city there are no such businesses there.

She’s a member of the “Abejitas de Pumpuriani” (Little Bees from Pumpuriani) communal bank and this is the fifth loan with MFP where she hopes to have its cooperation to make her plans a reality.

On the other hand, she once again commits to pay her installments like she’s done with her past loans.  Besides, she enjoys being part of her communal bank because all the members are responsible, mutually supportive people.

If Nora were to get this help she will invest the requested money in the purchase of several sacks of organic manure to spread among her coffee crops since they have to be fertilized three times a year in order to keep them strong.

loans.use: to buy several sacks of organic manure.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 44 years old. She is a married woman with four children. The oldest child is 21.

Gemma’s husband works as a farmer. Gemma is also a farmer, working in Sto. Nino South Cotabato. She has been growing rice for 8 years. Gemma earns PHP 11,000 per month doing this farming. 

This loan will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers. In the future, Gemma hopes to own a bigger farm.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Maritza Del Socorro

texts.es: Maritza Del Socorro tiene 42 años, tiene tres hijos. Su actividad económica de es la venta de ropa usada. Hace más de 6 años que ella decide iniciar este negocio porque no tenía un trabajo estable y necesitaba proporcionarle a su familia el pan de cada día, es así que ella empieza a visitar a sus amigos vecinos y otras personas que le realizaban encargos, hasta que logro establecerse en su vivienda. Ella solicita este financiamiento para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, trajes, camisetas y prendas de vestir con tallas mucho más grande pues tiene ciertos pedidos.
texts.en: Maritza Del Socorro is 42 years old; she has three children.  Her economic activity is clothing sales.  She started the business over six years ago because she did not have stable employment and she needed to provide for her family’s daily nutrition.  She, therefore, started visiting friends and neighbors and other people who’d place orders with her until she was able to set herself up at home.  She is asking for the loan to buy pants, shirts, skirts, suits, t-shirts and items of clothing in much larger sizes because she has certain pending orders.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, skirts, suits and t-shirts.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 38 years old, married and has two children in school.  

He is able to provide for his family with the income he gets from his barber shop. He has been running the business for six years.  

In addition, he owns a green grocery which earns him extra income. He was previously selling second-hand clothes.

Paul hopes to open other outlets of his business for more income generation. He has requested 20,000 KES to expand his business premises and buy additional seats for his barber shop.

loans.use: To expand his business premises and buy additional seats for his barber shop.

loans.name: Solijon

texts.en:
Solijon lives and works in Isfara, Tajikistan. For the last six years, he has been running a business processing dried fruits. He processes apricots and then sells them in the local market of Isfara city for a reasonable price. With the profit Solijon made from this business, he repaired his house and improved his living conditions. Currently his business is going well and he wants to expand his business. Solijon would like to get a loan of US $2100 to purchase apricots to process and make a good profit.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy fresh apricots

loans.name: Maria De Lourdes

texts.es:
Doña Maria es comerciante, desde hace trece años, vende comida en un cafetin que junta a su hermana trabaja, su esposo labora como cadete de taxi, siendo de su propiedad. Ha logrado vender variedad de platillos de comida gracias a prestamo que Afodenic ha dado, en varios ciclos.
Para ella es de gran sastifaccion haber salido adelante al trabajar, para apoyar a su familia. Hoy en dia necesita el financiamiento para el cambio de techo de su casa, es de cuartones y zinc, en donde pondra perlines,el cual ira parte por parte ya que todo esta ah altos costos y tiene que equilibrase para surtir el cafetin tambien.
Materiales a comprar laminas de zinc, perlines, golosos entre otros para hacer la obra.
texts.en:
María is a merchant.  For the last thirteen years she’s been selling food in a snack bar that she runs with her sister.  Her husband works as a taxi driver; he owns the taxi.  She has managed to sell a variety of dishes thanks to the loans that Afodenic has given her during several cycles.

For her, it’s very gratifying to get ahead trough work to support her family.  Today, she needs the loan to replace the roof on her house, which is made of wood beams and zinc metal sheets.  She will install purlines section by section because costs are very high and she has to budget to also stock the snack bar.  She will buy materials like zinc metal sheets, purlines and screws, among others to do the project.

loans.use: to buy zinc metal sheets, purlines and screws to repair the roof.

loans.name: Khun

texts.en:
Khun is a 56-year-old woman who is married and has five children. Three of her children have already married and live independently. The other two of her children are working as local construction workers in Phnom Penh city, where they earn a low salary per month. 

She has been running a business as a mix goods seller in front of her house. Khun wants to buy more products to sell in her store but she doesn't have enough cash to pay for them. Therefore, she wants to request some funds for supporting her business. 

When Khun receives funds from HKL, a Kiva partner, she will be able to purchase goods to add to her store. She hopes to sell more products and increase her family's income.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell in her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sacks of beans, tomatoes and wheat flour.

loans.name: Emie

texts.en:
Emie is 29 years old and lives in Small Potungan, Concepcion. She is married with one child.
 
Emie has a general store. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase assorted stocks for her general store.

Emie has been a member of PMPC for a month.

loans.use: to purchase assorted stocks for her general store.

location.town: Calamba - Small Potungan, Concepcion Mis. Occ

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. Fe has been in this business for 25 years.

Fe requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

In the future, Fe would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru: Замира замужем и у них двое детей. Её муж работает сторожем, и она занимается купля продажей тканей на местном рынке. Она привозить высококачественные товары, и она имеет много постоянных клиентов. В этом бизнесе помогает ей её свекровь. Более 6 лет она продолжает этот бизнес и у неё очень богатый опыт. Замира хотела бы получить займ для покупки нового ассортимента тканей для продажи.
texts.en: Zamira is married and has two children.  Her husband works as a security guard, and she is involved in buying and selling fabrics at the local market.  She brings in high quality merchandise and has many loyal customers.  Her mother-in-law helps her with this business.  Zamira has been running this business for over six years and has a rich experience in it.  Zamira wants to obtain a loan to purchase a new assortment of fabrics for sale.

loans.use: to purchase a new assortment of fabrics for sale

loans.name: Fa-Nou Group

texts.fr: Le groupe FA-NOU est formé de trois personnes qui vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Adjoa Bénédicte, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Adjoa Bénédicte est âgée de 25 ans et est célibataire. Adjoa Bénédicte n'a pas d'enfant. Adjoa Bénédicte vit seule et assure seule ses différentes charges. Adjoa Bénédicte a été scolarisé. Adjoa Bénédicte exerce comme activité, la vente de chaussures de façon ambulante ; ce qui lui permet de répondre à ses besoins. Adjoa Bénédicte exerce cette activité depuis une dizaine d'année. Adjoa Bénédicte s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Adjoa Bénédicte désire renforcer ses stocks de produits et rehausser le niveau de son activité. Pour ce faire, Adjoa Bénédicte sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe FA-NOU, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: The Fa-Nou group is made up of three people who live in the same neighborhood. The representative of this group, whose name is Adjoa Bénédicte, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. It is the first time that this group has requested a loan from Alidé and they are doing so in order to increase their business volume. Adjoa Bénédicte is 25 years old and single. She does not have any children. She lives alone and takes care of her own expenses. She has had an education and now has a business selling shoes on a door-to-door basis; this enables her to provide for her own needs. Adjoa Bénédicte has been carrying out this activity for around 12 years. She gets her supplies in a market in Benin. With a view to responding better to customer demand she would like to boost her stock and increase her business volume. In order to do this, she is requesting a first loan from Alidé, along with other members of the Fa-Nou group,

loans.use: to buy shoes

loans.name: Yadira Monserrate

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Los Jazmines  de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Mujer y Fortaleza.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Yadira, tiene 40 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 16, 10 y 3 años  de edad, los dos mayores estudian en colegio y escuela. Su marido es decorador.

Ella tiene un negocio en el centro de la ciudad en el cual vende una gran variedad de artículos, allí sus clientes pueden conseguir gafas, relojes, calculadoras, electrodomésticos en general, entre otras cosas, trabaja todos los días desde las 08h00 hasta las 18h00, trabaja en unión y compañía de sus familiares ya que este es un negocio familiar que lo heredaron de sus padres. Lleva en este negocio 15 años y les va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar ventiladores, calculadoras, gafas, relojes, entre otras cosas. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos.
 
Su meta es tener otro local.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the 'Mujer y Fortaleza' (Woman and Strength) community bank meet in Los Jazmines district, in the city of Portoviejo.  Portoviejo is the capital of Manabí province and has been known for many years as the 'City of the Royal Tamarind Trees'.

Here we meet 40-year-old Yadira who lives with her common-law husband.  The couple have three children aged 16, 10 and 3.  Her two eldest children are in school.  Her husband is a decorator.

Yadira has a business in the city center where she sells a large range of items.  There her customers can buy glasses, watches, calculators, general electrical appliances and other products.  She works every day, from 8.00am to 6.00pm.  She works with her family members as this is a family business which they inherited from their parents.  She has been in this business for 15 years and it is doing very well.

Yadira will use this loan to buy fans, calculators, glasses, watches and other products.  She has been a member of her community bank from the beginning and she likes it because of the help that she receives from the loans.  Her goal is to have another sales location.

loans.use: to buy fans, calculators, glasses, watches, etc.

loans.name: Maria Marleny

texts.es:
La señora Marleny  trabaja junto con su esposo todos los días en su tienda ubicada muy cerca de su vivienda localizada en el municipio de Envigado al Sur de Antioquia. La señora Marleny tiene 50 años de edad y vela por el bienestar de sus tres hijos y esposo.  
La señora Marleny espera comprar surtido para su tienda como gaseosas, snaks, dulces, productos de panadería y demás que vende en su negocio con el fin ofrecer a sus cliente mayor variedad y de esta forma incrementar sus ventas para poder en un futuro tener un negocio más posicionado y consolidado en el sector.
texts.en:
Marleny works alongside her husband every day in her store located very near to her house in the town of Envigado in south Antioquia.  Marleny is 50 years old and watches over her husband and her three children’s wellbeing.

Marleny hopes to buy an assortment of merchandise for her store like soft-drinks, snacks, candy, baked goods and others that she sells in her store to offer her customers a wider variety and increase sales so that in the future she can have a better positioned, consolidated business in the sector.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Janeth Jacqueline

texts.es:
Janeth de 42 años, empezó su negocio con la ayuda de su madre quien fue la que le enseño esta actividad, y con sus esfuerzos pudo salir adelante.

Realiza su trabajo todos los días sin horas fijas, por la mañana elabora su ropa y por las tarde sale a venderla.

La única dificultad que ha tenido es la delincuencia. Es madre soltera y su hijo de 12 años estudia en una escuela fiscal.

Su meta es poder agrandar más su taller ya que es muy reducido el espacio.
texts.en:
Janeth is 42 years old and started her business with her mother’s help, who taught her this activity.  She got ahead with much effort and works every day without set hours.  She makes her clothing in the morning and goes out in the evenings to sell it.

The only problem she’s had is with the crime.  She’s a single mother with a 12 year old son who attends the local school.

Her goal is to expand her workshop because she currently does not have much space.

loans.use: to buy fabric and buttons

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Margarita works hard to support her family. She has a basket weaving business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from hog raising. Margarita is borrowing 12,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to buy materials for her basket weaving business. 
Margarita has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for basket weaving.

loans.name: Ma.liza

texts.en: Ma.Liza is 41 years old and married with 3 children. She has been raising pigs for 2 years and also earns additional income from selling dried fish and ready-to-wear clothing. Ma.Liza is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Ma.Liza  works tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Suraiya's Group

texts.en:
Suraiya is a married woman living with her husband and their four children. Her eldest son is involved in the decorative embroidery business, while the other three children are in school.

Decorative embroidery is her family’s main source of income. She, her husband, and her son perform this kind of work to generate revenue. Suraiya and her husband are very experienced in this line of work, so they teach their son about their business so that he can start an independent embroidery business of his own someday to supplement the family's income.

She is requesting a loan to buy more embroidery materials such as beads, lace, colorful threads and clothes so that they can continue to craft beautiful embroidery designs and thereby generate additional profits. They are hopeful about their business’s future financial prospects with the help of the requested loan.

Note: One of the group's members sells sweets, which is why they are holding boxes of sweets.

loans.use: To purchase additional embroidery materials and clothes

loans.name: Jeanith

texts.en:
Jeanith is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.

Jeanith has a shop from which she sells detergents, soaps and dishwashing liquids. She has been in business for five years.

Jeanith has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. She has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy additional stocks of detergents and soaps to sell. Her hope is to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of detergents and soaps to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mary would like to pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She would like to buy a water tank

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.en:
Bernardo has dedicated himself to transportation for more than 5 years. Because of the lack of jobs in his country, he wanted to go to the United States. He saved a little money, but he didn't want to leave his family behind. He is in a common-law marriage and he has three small children, and therefore he decided to invest his money in the purchase of a truck to transport goods, and he has been working in this since. Luckily, his business has been going well, and after a while he was able to buy a second truck.

At this moment, he needs a loan of $925 that he will use to maintain his trucks to avoid any accident that could occur, and to ensure a high level of service to his customers. He commits to pay back the loan in 6 to 12 months.

Be an important part of Bernardo's success! Bernardo and his family thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Ramón F. Kolb, Kiva Volunteer.

Bernardo se dedica a los fletes desde hace más de 5 años, por la falta de trabajo en el país pretendía irse a trabajar a Estados Unidos, juntó un poco de dinero pero no quería dejar sola a su familia, él vive en unión libre y tiene tres pequeños hijos, entonces invirtió este dinero en la compra de un camión para fletes y desde entonces se dedica a esta labor. Afortunadamente su negocio ha prosperado y poco después logró comprar otro camión.

En estos momentos necesita un préstamo por $ 925 dólares que utilizará en el mantenimiento de sus camiones para evitar cualquier accidente que pudiera presentarse y poder ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes, él se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses.

Se parte importante en los logros de Bernardo, él y su familia te lo agradecerán.

loans.use: Maintenance of his trucks

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio A. produces chipa, a very popular, typical snack in Paraguay. It is a very common type of corn bread sold in the streets, where vendors carry large baskets of chipa all day long, selling it on the streets and buses.

Rogelio is 57 years old, married, and has 5 children. The oldest son is 38 years old and the youngest is 17. Rogelio works Mondays through Fridays starting at 7 in the morning. He spends four hours every morning baking chipas, taking 25 minutes to complete each batch. He works behind his house where he has a large brick oven that he uses to bake the chipas.

Rogelio started his chipas business 20 years ago. At first, he bought the chipas from other people and sold them on the streets. Now his family helps him by selling the chipas in the streets after he finishes making them. They travel by bus an hour and half to Asuncion to sell their chipas.

Rogelio needs a loan of US$100 to buy more cheese and milk in large quantities to produce the chipas.

loans.use: Purchase cheese and milk in large quantities.

loans.name: Rasul

texts.en: H. Rasul  is 39 years old. He is a refugee from the Azerbaijan- Armenian conflict territory in Khojavand region in Eastern Azerbaijan. Right now, he lives with his family in Baku. He started his meat business in 2001. He buys sheep, slaughters them and sells the meat. He needs some money to help him buy more sheep for his business. He heard about Normicro loans and decided to apply for a loan. This is his first loan. He has applied for a $500 loan to buy 10 sheep and expand his business.

loans.use: To buy 10 sheep

loans.name: Zahir

texts.en: Zahir O. lives in the Ashigli village of Beylagan - a small city in the south-west Azerbaijan.  He is 42 years old, is married and has 2 children.  He is engaged in sheep-breeding.  To grow his business, he is requesting a loan of $800 to buy 10 more sheep.

loans.use: To buy 10 sheep

loans.name: Ramiz

texts.en: Ramiz is a single man who has his own farming business.  This man lives in the Salyan region in the Khaladj village.  This 26-year-old man is requesting a loan of $1200 for buying fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional stock for her grocery store in bulk

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 22 year old man who lives with his family in south Lebanon, in Tyre. Ali works to provide for himself and his wife. He owns a bakery and wants to develop his business so as to be able to continue building his house. Ali needs a loan to buy provisions to increase his productivity.

loans.use: To buy provisions

loans.name: Trun

texts.en: Mr. Trun P., 42, works as taxi driver and also rent his car to the customers. He earns around eight dollars a day. His wife supplements the household income by renting rooms to local workers making, on average, about two dollars a day. This couple has three children; one of whom is married. The two other children are unemployed. Mr. P. would like to request a loan of $1000 from Kiva to fix his car as it is the family's main source of income.

loans.use: To make car repairs

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is 50 years old and is a divorced woman with 4 children, ages 23, 21, 10 and 9 years old. She also takes care of 2 other children, ages 10 and 9 years old. Halima is a clothing seller, and she started in 2004. Every day she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more cloth for her business.

loans.use: To buy more cloth for her business.

loans.name: Ester's Amani Group

texts.en:
Ester is 28 years old and is a married woman with 2 children, ages 12 and 9 years old. Ester owns a small general store, which she started in 2000. Every day, she works from 10 am to 9 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $175 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Tabitha, Lilian and Anna, who have businesses dealing in hair salon, stationery sales and a general store owner.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Pech

texts.en:
Pech P. lives in Or Rumchang Village, Pursat Province, Cambodia. She is married and has two children. She makes around $1.50 per day making khmer noodles. Her husband, Mr. Khum Samon, 35, is a farmer who makes around $1.50 per day. All of their children are young and attend school.

She seeks a loan to purchase a noodle-making machine for her business. This loan will help to increase her income and improve her business conditions.

loans.use: To purchase a noodle-making machine for her business

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadores Elegantes Group

texts.en:
Cerna A. is a middle-aged mother with two daughters.  When asked about her dreams for her future, she replies, “For now, I juS.have to keep moving ahead”.  Her firS.loan from Esperanza allowed her to do juS.that, and now she has returned for a second.  Cerna sells rice, chicken and beans from her home in Puerto Plata, Dominican Republic.  When she is not preparing food at lunch time, she sells pants, shoes, shirts and blouses in the street and from her home. She will use the money from this loan to buy more food to cook and sell, as well as to buy more clothing to sell in the street.

Cerna A. leads a 10-person group, Mujeres Trabajadores Elegantes, which means “Elegant Working Women." Each of these Dominican entrepreneurs unites with the others in solidarity, allowing them to access funding that they would never otherwise be able to get on their own. This group pays its loan back together to reduce the risk of one person defaulting, as the others gladly help cover one another’s payments in order to receive their next loan together.  Each woman has her own individual business, but finds support from the others as they come together every two weeks to learn business skills and make their payments together.

On behalf of Cerna, Mujeres Trabajadores Elegantes and the entire team here at Esperanza International, we thank you for your support and awareness of the global issue of poverty, and for your commitment to make a difference.

loans.use: To buy shoes, pants, shirts and blouses, as well as rice, beans, and chicken, for resale.

loans.name: Toch

texts.en:
Mrs. Toch K., 28, is a grocer who lives in Phteah Rung Commune, Pursat Province. K. sells vegetable and fruit that she buys from growers in her area and resells for a profit. She earns approximately $1.8 per day while her husband is a farmer and earns around $1 per day. They have two children, both of whom are in school. Because her business is growing and to reduce the cost of transportation, K. is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase a secondhand motorcycle to use to transport vegetables and fruit to sell.

About Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL):

HKL is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life, by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings. In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.

loans.use: To purchase a secondhand motorcycle to use to transport vegetables and fruit to sell

loans.name: Tamima

texts.en:
Tamima is 28 years old. She is married with 1 child, age 4. She has been a clothing seller since 2005. Every day she works from 9:30 AM to 6:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $35 from her sales.

Tamima now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Su ardua dedicación a la venta de videos musicales, hicieron de Ana una mujer de negocio, ya que cuenta en la actualidad con dos puestos de venta de CDs. Es madre soltera y su ardua labor como padre y madre hacen que salga adelante. Se dedica a este negocio desde hace muchos años atrás, y gracias a esto solventa las necesidades de sus 3 hijos estudiantes, se siente orgullosa de tener unos hijos lindos y buenos.  Ahora Ana tiene la necesidad de ampliar y mejorar sus puestos. Para seguir creciendo en su negocio, es que solicita esta cantidad de dinero, y con e tiempo tener un local propio y amplio para vender sus CDs. Ayudemos a la señora Ana a cumplir con su propósito.
texts.en:
Her strong commitment to selling music videos has made Ana a woman of business and she now has two CD sales stands. She's a single mother and the difficult responsibility of being both father and mother has pushed her to get ahead. She has worked at her business for many years and thanks to it she's been able to provide for her 3 school-aged children. She's proud of having such good and beautiful children. Ana now needs to expand and improve her stands. She's applying for this loan so that she can continue to grow her business and, in time, have her own large shop for selling her CDs. Let's help Ana meet her goal.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand and improve stand for CD sales business.

loans.name: Violeta Auxiliadora

texts.es:
El negocio de la señora Violeta B. es la venta de ropa y calzado el cual es comercializado en el mercado Israel Lewites de Managua. Esta dama ha sido una persona que por varios años atravesó difíciles momentos en su negocio pero desde que comenzó a trabajar con Ceprodel mejoró su situación por lo que ahora ha logrado mejorar el negocio y ha salido adelante en sus ventas.

La razón por la que ella ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel es para obtener el crédito y de esta forma salir adelante en el negocio adquiriendo la mercadería de sus proveedores. Con el crédito se beneficia porque mejora las condiciones de su negocio.
texts.en:
Violeta B.'s business is in sales of clothing and shoes, which she vends at the Israel Lewites market in Managua. This woman has been someone who for many years as overcome difficult moments in her business, but since starting to work with Ceprodel her situation has improved. Now she has improved her business and has surged ahead in her sales. The reason for which she has requested the help of Ceprodel is to obtain a credit. This loan will allow her to move ahead in the business, acquiring merchandise from her providers. With this loan she will benefit greatly, because she will better the conditions of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Khy

texts.en: Mrs. Khy C. is  46 years old and lives in the Kradass Kor village in the Kampong Cham Province. She and her husband, Mr. Yorn Yin, are farmers who own a small piece of land and cultivate rice for a living. The plantation has become infertile which is lowering the crop yield. In order to solve this problem, Mrs. Khy C. is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers to support the field and make it more productive. Mrs. Khy C. has four children, two of whom work in a garment factory and the remaining two attend the local school. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers to increase crop yield.

loans.name: Dionicio

texts.es: Dionicio tiene 55 años, vive con su esposa y sus hijos Godofredo de 30, Yanet de 28, Luis Enrique de 26, Marco Antoni de 24 e Indira de 5 años. La venta de colchas (cubre camas) es el negocio de Dionicio, al cual se dedica desde hace 15 años, ya que le ha arrojado buenos ingresos para poder mantener a su familia. El trae las colchas de la ciudad de Desaguadero, frontera con Bolivia, vendiéndolas a precios cómodos, atrayendo la preferencia del público. Lo más difícil de su trabajo son los constantes viajes que debe realizar a este lugar para poder adquirir su mercadería. Lo bueno es que toda su familia lo apoya haciendo que el negocio progrese y salga adelante. Dionicio se encuentra en su segundo préstamo en Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado viajará a comprar más colchas, para venderlas en estas fiestas navideñas.
texts.en:
Dionicio is 55 years old and lives with his wife and their children, Godofredo, 30, Yanet, 28, Luis Enrique, 26, Marco Antoni, 24 and Indira, 5. For the past 15 years Dionicio has sold comforters (for beds). This provides a good income that he uses to support his family. He gets the comforters in the city of Desaguadero, on the border with Bolivia, and he sells them at reasonable prices, which helps him earn his customer’s loyalty. The most difficult thing about his job are the constant trips to the border to buy merchandise. The good thing is that his whole family helps him and the business has grown. Dionicio is in his second loan cycle with Microfinanza Prisma. With the loan money he will travel to buy more comforters to sell during the holidays.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the merchandise he sells

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity N. raises poultry and  she sells birds and eggs. She has been in this business for the past 10 years. She needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more birds to sell. Charity is 34 years old and married with 5 children. She says thanks to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more birds to sell

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: Khady D. est une jeune femme de 30 ans mariée, mère de 3 enfants dont le mari prend la charge. Elle souhaiterait néanmoins ne pas rester inactive. Ce prêt lui servira à acheter des balaies, du jus de citron, de l’huile de palme, du sucre qu’elle va revendre à Ziguinchor et Dakar avec l’aide de son mari qui est transporteur de camions. Elle pense ainsi contribuer à améliorer leurs conditions de vie familiale.
texts.en:
Khady D., 30, is a young married woman and mother of 3 children, whose husband is the breadwinner for the family. She would nevertheless not like to remain inactive. This loan will allow her to buy brooms, lemon juice, palm oil, and sugar which she is going to re-sell in Ziguinchor et Dakar with the help of her husband who does truck transport. She believes that in this way she will be able to contribute to improving family living conditions.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: bolster her business in lemon juice, palm oil, and brooms

loans.name: Carolyn

texts.en:
Simple yet hard-working describes Mrs. Carolyn V., 41 years old, married and living at Tawi-tawi, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She was blessed with 3 children. Her husband is a fisherman. With the increasing prices on basic commodities, Carolyn thought of helping her husband by selling fish in the market. Some of these fish were caught by her husband and some were bought from other fisherman. Her customers are her neighbors, friends and the people of Aloran.

In order to have additional working capital, she decided to join Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative to request a loan in July 2008. She has received loans two times already. Now, she is applying for PHP 10,000 to buy kilos/"cavans" (a Filipino measuring unit similar to bushel) of fish and also fishing net. She really wants to see her business succeed by having a stall in the market and an additional pump boat for fishing.

loans.use: to buy kilos of fish and fishing net

loans.name: Kossi Malibita

texts.fr:
Monsieur KPOBIE Kossi est né le 15 décembre 1972 à Tomégbé, localité située à 147 km de la capitale togolaise. Il est marié et père de trois (3) enfants. Depuis 2006, il a ouvert une librairie dans le quartier Adidogomé à Lomé. Dans sa librairie « ETS GRACE ET PAIX » on peut trouver les livres des cours primaires et secondaires. 
Il est à son troisième cycle de crédit auprès de WAGES et rembourse toujours bien.
Ce crédit qu’il sollicite lui permettra d’acheter 5 cartons de livre de cours primaires et 2 cartons de livre littéraires.
texts.en:
Mr. Kossi Kpobie was born December 15, 1972 in Tomégbé, situated 147 km from the Togolaise capital. He is married and the father of 3 children. He opened his bookstore in 2006 in the Adidogomé neighborhood of Lomé. In his bookstore "Est.Mercy and Peace" one can find books for primary and secondary level classes. He is on his third credit cycle with WAGES and has always repaid well. The loan he is requesting will allow him to purchase 5 cartons of primary schoolbooks and 2 cartons of literary books.

Translated from French by Tim Hassett, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Books

loans.name: Firuza

texts.en: Firuza U. is 30 years old, and she is married with 3 children. Firuza lives in a big house with her parents and brothers. Firuza opened a trade outlet inside her home and trades food products. She has been engaged in the business of food trading for 14 years and knows the specifications by season. Firuza applied to Kiva for a business support loan of 1600 STJ in order to purchase drinks from a factory. She thanks Kiva for its support.

loans.use: To purchase drinks

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Since 2005, Nancy E. has worked as a petty trader selling clothing and provisions at Sekondi Market near Shama Junction. She is married with three children and received an education through senior high school. Nancy is responsible for helping to pay for her family’s financial expenses, especially housekeeping money.

Her loan will be used to purchase for her business various provisions such as rice, soup and oil as well as clothing. She hopes to use her newly gained profits to reinvest and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase clothing and various provisions such as rice, soup and oil

loans.name: Gulsanam

texts.ru: Номуродова  Гулсанам – женщина  32  лет,  замужем,  имеет  одного  ребёнка. Вместе  со своим  мужем  Кобиловым  Хайдархуджа  она занимается  куплей  и  продажей  крупного  и  мелкорогатого  скота. Наряду  с  этим  она  занимается  переработкой  и  продажей  молока. Гулсанам  и  её  муж  имеют  достаточный  опыт в сфере животноводства и таким образом ведут своё хозяйство.  Недавно  от  своих  коллег  по  бизнесу  она  узнала  о  возможности  получения  кредита  в  нашей  организации.  Когда  она  пришла  получать  кредит  у  неё  было  малое  количество  скота.  Благодаря  нашим  кредиторам  она  увеличила  своё  стадо  и  очень  довольна  этим.
texts.en:
Gulsanam N. is a 32-year-old woman, who is married and has one child. She and her husband Haydarhuj Kobilov buy and sell large- and small-horned cattle. In addition, she processes and sells the milk. Gulsanam and her husband have enough experience raising cattle to keep the farm going. From others in the business, she recently learned about the possibility of taking out a loan with MicroInvest. When she first came to apply for a loan, Gulsanam had only a few head of cattle. Thanks to the lenders, she has increased the size of her herd, and is quite pleased with that fact.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Felix Antonio

texts.es: Félix Antonio R. M. tiene 55 años de edad, tiene 5 hijos pero todos ellos viven de manera independiente, esta dedicado a la reparación y venta de repuestos electrodomésticos, el inicio este negocio hace 20 años aproximadamente. Desde entonces este ha sido su negocio fuente de ingresos, de esta manera Félix presta servicios como la instalación eléctrica, reparación de abanicos, licuadoras, planchas, televisores, y todo tipo de artículos que tengan relación con su actividad. Félix ha sido una persona que ha tenido que enfrentar momentos muy duros y aunque su mayor preocupación es enfermarse gravemente alega que prefiere morir luchando que jamás haberlo intentado. Esta vez Félix ha acudido a Fundación León 2000 para que se le otorgue un financiamiento el cual le servirá en la compra de herramientas de limpieza para los electrodomésticos como alambres, tomacorrientes, lámparas para mejor visualización y otros equipos que requieren de una cantidad de dinero que en estos momentos el no cuenta pero que los necesita para seguir subsistiendo.
texts.en:
Felix Antonio R. M. is 55 years old and has 5 children, all of whom live independently. He repairs and sells parts for electrical appliances--a business which he started about 20 years ago. Since then, he has offered his services installing electrical equipment, and repairing fans, blenders, irons, TVs, and all kinds of other appliances that might be related to his line of work. Felix has been a person who has had to face some very difficult times, and although his greatest worry is that he will fall seriously ill, he believes that it is better to die fighting than to never have tried at all. This time, Felix has come to Fundacion Leon 2000 for financing that he will use for the purchase of things like wire, electrical outlets, work lights, and other equipment that cost more money than he has right now, but which he needs in order to continue getting by.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha has a business vending different kinds of vegetables in her rural village of San Jose Norte 1 in Mallig, Isabela. She roams to every house in the village to sell her products. She is thankful that she can support her family and help her husband with this simple business. She has four children, who all attend either college or high school. She does her best to generate more income to meet her family's immediate needs.

Editha is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva lenders in the amount of PHP 5,000 to expand her business. She is hoping that Kiva will extend their assistance to help her improve her business and invest in hog raising as another source of income.

loans.use: To expand her business selling vegetables and invest in a new business rasing hogs.

loans.name: Sandra Maria

texts.es: La Señora Sandra María E. A. tiene la edad de 28 años. Es una joven soltera. Tiene 2 hijos y todavía no asisten a una escuela. Su actividad económica es ofrecer los servicios de alquiler de teléfonos, venta de recargas telefónicas. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ella decide buscar una fuente de ingresos para su familia, ya que sus hijos tienen muchas necesidades, y como una madre responsable decide incursionar en este trabajo, algunas veces Sandra tiene que pasar mucho tiempo bajo el sol, porque su pequeño negocio está situado en un lugar donde transitan muchas personas y es así como decide seguir adelante con su negocio. Por lo que el dinero que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de teléfonos, recargas para abastecer a la demanda de sus clientes. El sueño de Sandra es lograr obtener un cyber en donde pueda darles un mejor servicios a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sra. Sandra Maria E. A. is 28 years old, and single. She has two children, who are not in school yet. Her business is to offer the services of rental phones, and sales of cards to recharge minutes for cell phones. She has had this business for more than four years. She decided to look for a source of income for her family, since her two children have many needs, and as a responsible mother, she decided to foray into this work.

Sometimes Sandra has to spend a lot of time in the sun, because her small business is located in a place where many people pass by, and that is how she decided to move forward with her business. The money that she is requesting is for working capital for the purchase of telephones, and recharge cards to supply the demand of her customers. Sandra´s dream is to succeed in obtaining a cyber-cafe where she can give better services to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Geolita

texts.en: Geolita S. is from the city of Oroquieta. She is 54 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Geolita owns and operates a specialized retail store, primarily selling coconuts in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2004, Geolita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Geolita is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 14th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and used as working capital

loans.name: Las Amapolas Group

texts.es: Las socias del banco comunal “La Amapolas” están representadas por la señora Virginia Julia y conformada por 12 miembros los cuales la mayoría se dedican a la venta D. ropa, comida, saladitos y cosméticos por catálogo. La competencia a nivel comercial es alta pero la socias tienen mucha experiencia y saben como sacar adelante sus negocios ofreciendo productos variados y D. buena calidad. El destino del financiamiento es para adquisición D. mercadería mas acorD. a las necesidades que exige el mercado en especial por el cambio D. temporada, así como para materia prima  para la adquisición insumos y materiales que ayuden a genera un mayor ingreso para el sustento D. sus familias y para el mejoramiento D. su hogar. En cuanto a sus antecedentes crediticios los socios tienen amplio conocimiento del trabajo en grupos solidarios gracias a créditos en entidades similares a la Fundación Agrocapital en la que van cursando su segundo ciclo demostrando capacidad para el manejo D. los fondos, responsabilidad en los pagos y sobre todo unidad en el grupo el cual les brinda un apoyo económico para seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The partners of the community bank "La Amapolas" are represented by señora Virginia Julia and the group is comprised of 12 members. The majority sell clothing, food, snacks and cosmetics from catalogs. They have a high level of competence because the women have a lot of experience and know how to advance their businesses by offering various products of good quality. They will use their loan to buy products more tailored to the needs of the market which have changed with the new season. For instance, the purchase of primary materials, supplies and other materials to sell will help them make larger investments in their family and improve their homes. The women of this community bank have ample knowledge of how to work in solidarity groups because of their previous participation in similar groups with Fundación Agrocapital where they are finishing their second loan cycle. This indicates their ability to manage funds, repay responsibly, and, above all, the unity within their group helps them economically and allows them to continue growing.

Translated from Spanish by Sierra Visher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operations Capital

loans.name: God Give Group

texts.en:
God Give is a group of 5 borrowers, led by Krubo K., living in Zorzor, Lofa County, Liberia.  Krubo is a widow with 2 children, ages 12 and 18, who are in 3rd and 9th grade.   Both her children are a bit behind, because they were forced to drop out of school during the war.  Krubo is 35 years old, illiterate, and lives in Borkeza Town.  

Krubo’s business is selling dry goods retail in the market, including onions, manpo (local spice), biscuits, batteries, etc. She buys these items wholesale in neighboring Guinea.  She has been running her business for 3 years.   Now, she is taking a loan to increase her inventory so she can serve more customers.  With the profits she dreams of building a more permanent shop and investing in the future of her children, especially investing in educations since she was unable to attend school.

loans.use: Purchasing inventory

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo, or Romy as he was called, is living in the village of Lawig, Lamut, Ifugao. He is married to Marilyn and they have been gifted with six children who are in the high school and elementary level.  

He and his wife are helping one another in managing their business.  They operate a general store and also sell fruits and vegetables in front of their store.  At present, he is requesting to avail a loan of PHP5,000 from the KIVA lenders. This amount will be of great value in the business for it is their source of income and it helps them in sending their children to school.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Juana Francisca

texts.es: La señora Juana López de 43 años de edad, su negocio es la elaboración de manualidades, hace bellos manteles bordados,  cortinas los cuales los vende al extranjero. Desde pequeña aprendió a tejer pero nunca imagino que seria su profesión, la cual hasta hoy ejerce para ayudar a su familia. Reside en el barrio Laureles Sur en  la capital de Managua, su esposo  es mecánico, tiene dos hijos  el mayor casado y uno menor que estudia, sus planes es poder terminar de hacer su casa. Con este financiamiento comprara lana, tela, para hacer sus manualidades  y poder abrir mas mercado en el extranjero ya que como gustan mucho son muchos los pedidos que le hacen por su estilo bonito. Agradece Afodenic por hacer posible aumentar el inventario de su negocio lo cual es de muchos beneficios para la captación de clientes, como las ganancias que obtendrá mediante las ventas.

loans.use: Comprar lana, tela, para invertir mas en las ventas

loans.name: Denise

texts.fr: D. Denise est née en 1976 à Adja au Mono. Denise réside depuis vingt neuf ans dans le quartier Cadjèhoun à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à NOUMON André un mécanicien moto, Denise a à sa charge cinq enfants, dont quatre sont ses propres enfants. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés et sont à la charge de Denise et de André. Denise n’a jamais été à l’école, c’est pourquoi elle s’est très tôt mise dans la vente de produits vivriers (riz, maïs, haricot) à son domicile. Denise vend également des boissons et de l’eau glacée. Denise achète les produits vivriers à Adja au Mono et s’approvisionne en boissons à la Société Béninoise de Brasserie du Bénin. Denise est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui a déjà bénéficié de trois crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés à ALIDé. Pour accroître son fonds de roulement afin de mieux satisfaire ses clients et obtenir plus d’économies, Denise sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Denise D. was born in 1976 in Adja au Mono. Denise has lived for 19 years in the Cadjèhoun à Cotonou neighborhood, economic capital of Bénin. She is married to André Noumon, a bike mechanic, Denise has five children in her care, of which four are her own children. All of the children attend school and are dependent on Denise and André. Denise never went to school, because she began at an early age to sell provisions (rice, corn, beans) from her home. Denise also sells drinks and frozen water. Denise buys the provisions in Adja au Mono and obtains the drinks from the Benin Brewery Corporation of Benin. Denise is a former client of ALIDé who has already benefited from three loans that she repaid well to ALIDé. In order to increase her working capital so she can better satisfy her clients and earn more profits, Denise requests a fourth loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, corn and beans for resale

loans.name: Francis Njuguna

texts.en:
Francis is a 35-year-old father of three children who are 10, 7 and 4 years old. He is married to Jane Wanjiru. All three children go to a primary school in Kapsabet town.

He was introduced to Kadet by a Kadet client and is happy to have joined Kadet. With this first loan, he plans to purchase more bags of oranges and mangoes to supply to an increasing number of retailers.

His business is located at the market in the town centre. He wishes to become a big supplier of oranges and mangoes in the town. With the profits, he wishes to educate his children and to buy a plot where he can build his own home.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy more bags of oranges and mangoes to sell to retailers

loans.name: Ma. Lourdes

texts.en:
Ma. Lourdes G. lives in the village of Brgy San Jose, Binalbagan, Negros Occidental. She is 35 years old, married, and has 2 children aged nine and fourteen years old who are presently attending school. She works hard because she wants to give her children all they need, including good food, an education and a good family to support them when they grow up.  She also wants to help her husband earn additional income for their family.

In the past, she was a plain housewife whose main day-to-day activity was to take good care of her children and husband. She would wait for her husband to bring home his salary and then budget it for the week.  However, she noticed that the budget was never enough for the whole week. She thought of trying to start a business so she could earn money and help her husband, which is why she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon.   Having some capital to invest in business, Ma. Lourdes decided to try her luck with a ready-to-wear and used clothing business. She goes to different places to sell her goods. She wakes up early to go to market and sell her wares so that she can earn more income. From her business, she is able to earn PHP 10,000 every month, which is a big help to her family, especially for the education of her two children.

Ma. Lourdes’ previous loan of PHP 19,500 was used to buy additional clothes, both ready-to-wear and used. Because the funds went toward her business, she was able to maintain a good credit rating by paying her previous loan on time and in full, without any delay. Now, for her 11th cycle loan, she is borrowing the same amount of PHP 19,500, which she will use for her business, to save for her children’s education, and for household expenses.

In the picture, Ma. Lourdes is involved in her business during market day.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned its respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: additional working capital for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional goods in bulk for her business

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is 28 years old. Her husband is a local football coach in Ibadan. She has three children and her youngest child is just 1 year old. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo state, Nigeria. She is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa. 

Comfort has a salon where she makes lovely hairstyles for her customers. She also sells hair extensions and cream. This is the high season for business and she hopes to make more profits. She is requesting a loan of 40,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more hair extensions and cream to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions and cream to sell

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter sells building materials at retail prices to his customers. He loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that he has with his customers. He is 45 years old and married with 4 children. His eldest child is 14 years old. His children are still dependent on him and they go to school. He is a hard working man and an honest and faithful LAPO (Lift above poverty organization) client. LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. Peter has been in this business for a long time. He is requesting a loan amount of NGN 120,000 to purchase more building materials to sell. He says "thanks" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more building materials to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn Vale

texts.en:
Jocelyn Vale P. is a 30-year-old mother with the good faith to get out from under the ties of poverty. She is the mother of an only child, Christian John, who is a minor. Jocelyn is married to Reynaldo, a laborer, but his salary is not enough for their daily expenditures.

As a mother with big dreams, in 2007 Jocelyn joined ASHI (Ahon sa Hirap, Inc.), a micro-finance institution and Kiva partner in the Philippines. Since then, she started a variety store and it has really helped them to meet their needs. Her business is growing because the people in her neighborhood like her products and find what they need in her store instead of going to the town proper.

Now on her seventh loan, Jocelyn proposes the amount of 25,000 pesos to pay for cases of soft drinks, liquor, rice, and groceries for her store.

Jocelyn dreams of growing her variety store into a mini-grocery store and expanding it to other places. She hopes that, with the help of ASHI and Kiva, she can reach her goal to step out of poverty and have a good living. She now feels very glad about her work and the services of ASHI and Kiva. They offer her big opportunities to make her dreams come true.

loans.use: To buy cases of soft drinks, liquor, rice and groceries for her variety store

loans.name: Mercilyn's Group

texts.en:
Mercilyn S., 38, is from Ozamiz City. She is the group leader of a four-member group with a loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Mercilyn is widowed and has three school-aged children. She owns and operates a retail store selling soft drinks, snack food, noodles, eggs, shampoo, toothpaste, cooking oil, vinegar, soy sauce and other daily use products in the local community. Mercilyn has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Mercilyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mercilyn is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Mercilyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the her family's general living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mbéne

texts.en: Mbéne N. is a 48-year-old woman from Diourbel, Senegal. She is married and the mother of six children. She has been a member of the "MBarry Gouytane" village bank for eight years. Mbéne N. raises cattle and sheep and sells them in the market. With this loan, she will buy new cattle and sheep.

loans.use: To buy new livestock

loans.name: Marcelle
