texts.fr: Marcelle D. est une femme de 52 ans et mère de 7 enfants en charge, elle est membre du Banc Villageois de NGOHE depuis 11 ans et a 22 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit qu'elle a toujours remboursés sans difficulté. Elle fait de l'embouche bovine, elle achète des bœufs pour les engraisser pendant 4 ou 5 mois et les revend sur pied. Les profits générés par son activité lui permettent de participer à la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
Marcelle D. is a 52-year old woman who has seven chidren in her care. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois in NGOHE for 11 years and has had 22 consecutive loans, which she has always repaid without any problem. She has a beef fattening activity and buys oxen to fatten them up for four or five months before reselling them on foot. The profits generated by her activity allow her to participate in taking care of her family.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy four oxen

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha owns a 2-hectare (5-acre) cornfield in Norala, South Cotabato. She has a good harvest on it and it really helps her family.

Editha started her farming business way back in 2007. Today she is requesting a loan of 15,000 Php from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to buy farm supplies.

Editha is 48 years old and has five children, her eldest child being 18 years old. She wants her children to finish their studies soon and that’s why she works hard on the farm to provide their needs as a family.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Seun

texts.en:
Mrs. Seun S., 54 (pictured here) and her husband, Mr. Nem Preum, 52, have been married since 1979 and have seven children: five sons and two daughters. Both of their daughters weave silk at home. Two of their sons assist their father in the construction business, one is a driver, and the other two attend school. The family lives on an Island in the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Seun used to be a silk weaver. She has now transferred her loom to her daughters. Her husband has been constructing wooden houses for almost four years. She is asking for her first loan of $1,100 to purchase materials for her husband’s business. And she also will use a part of her loan to fill-up the land in front of her house.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her husband’s construction business.

loans.name: Maria Lee

texts.en:
Maria Lee B. is from the village of Salvacion, Kadingilan Bukidnon. She is 32 years old, married, and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Maria Lee owns & operates a tailoring business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing general  alteration & tailoring services to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately  earns 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Maria Lee joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional tailoring equipment such as needles, thread and fabric. Maria Lee is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fabric & materials. This will be Maria Lee’s 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabric & materials

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick is 42 years old. He is married and has five children between the ages of 6 and 14 years. All of the children attend school. Erick is a farmer from Rift Valley Kenya near Litein town. He has been farming for twelve years and selling his milk and tea to the local market. He also earns income from the sale of vegetables from his farm. He was employed before he ventured into the farming business.

He has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo for 45,000 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. This loan will enable him to acquire a quality cow that will produce enough milk and earn him enough income to provide for his family. His main challenges in this business are lack of enough market for his milk and poor transportation that has led to delays in getting the milk to the market. In the future he would like to increase the number of his dairy animals so as to  increase his milk production.

He says he would like to get a larger loan in the future.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Mamyaneboe Group

texts.en:
Peter C., who is holding the sign in the photo, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Mamyaneboe. He is 40 years old and married. He has two children and they are 3 and 7 years old. He was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to financial difficulties. 

For 15 years, he has been selling used clothes at the Harbel Market in Harbel, Margibi County, outside of Monrovia, Liberia. 

He plans to use his 4,000-Liberian-Dollars portion of this 20,000-Liberian-Dollars group loan to buy more used clothes.

His dream is to grow his business, be financially independent and to continue to support his children so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes.

loans.name: Khot

texts.en:
Mrs. K. is an older mother blessed with six children, all of whom are single. To help the family, two of her children are working in Malay.

K. raises a few pigs and rice crops on her own land next to her house. She always receives help from her husband in this business operation.

The coming rainfall season is good for growing, but K. lacks money to buy supplies to use on her farm field. This is why she has decided to ask a loan to buy seed to plant and fertilizer, as well as to buy another piglet for her stall.

loans.use: To buy seed and fertilizers plus another piglet to raise

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es:
El señor Jose Francisco J. P., tiene 65 años de edad es casado y con su esposa habitan en el barrio de Santa Rosa, ellos tienen 3 hijos mayores de edad, casados e independientes, su esposa se dedica a la venta de frutas, pan, sorbetes, y hielo, el señor trabaja como ebanista desde hace mas de 20 años, es de esta manera que la familia se sostiene económicamente y que con sus propios esfuerzos les abrieron camino a  sus hijos,  que actualmente son ciudadanos de bien que trabajan y sostienen a sus familias respectivamente.

Dentro de los problemas a los que se enfrentaron en su negocio tras todos estos años ha sido la falta de financiamiento y los precios altos de la madera, debido al alza de combustible que le han obstaculizado, compra de un mayor inventario de materias primas, ha sido con su esfuerzo propio que logro la apertura de su negocio, es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo para la compra de materia prima que le permita llevara a cabo las ordenes de trabajo, esta inversión le favorece en un  futuro contar con los recursos económicos necesarios, para la remodelación de su vivienda, y la tranquilidad necesaria de morar sus días de adultez en un lugar amplio, cómodo y digno de habitar.
texts.en:
José Francisco J. P. is 65 years old. He is married and lives with his wife in the barrio of Santa Rosa. They have three adult children who are married and independent. His wife sells fruit, bread, sorbets, and ice. José has worked as a cabinet-maker for over 20 years. In this way, he supported his family financially and through his hard work, he has paved the way for his children who are now good citizens who work and support their own families. One of the problems he has faced in his business during all these years has been the lack of financing. The high price of wood, due to the rise in fuel costs, has deterred him from purchasing a larger inventory of raw materials. However, he overcame these difficulties and opened his business through his own efforts. For this reason he is requesting a loan for the purchase of raw material which will allow him to fill his work orders. This investment will enable him to count on having the resources he will need in the future for the remodeling of his home, so that he can live his days of adulthood peacefully in a spacious home that is comfortable and habitable.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Francoletti-Putz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase raw materials which will allow him to fill his work orders.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en: Nenita J. is from the village of San Roque, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 49 years old and is married with three adult children. Nenita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Nenita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jamoliddin

texts.en:
A. Jamoliddin is married and has three children whom he is very proud of since they are struggling to get ahead. With the faith that his children will be able to go to college to get ahead, he started a business of processing and selling dried apricots to be able to make enough money to pay for their schooling. He is experienced in this kind of business that allows him to expand his clientele day by day.

Right now Jamoliddin requests 5000 Somoni for purchasing apricots to  further process and to sell. With your help, Jamoliddin will be able to feel proud that through much effort, his children went to college and became honorable people.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy apricots to expand his business

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes M. is a 40-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures: a general store and a pig-fattening business. She lives in Brgy. Manghanoy, La Castellana, Negros Occidental. 

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2003 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 4000. 

Lourdes  is borrowing PHP 29500 so that she can purchase more stock for her general store. This will be her 17th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 29500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Lourdes aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon — a title of esteem bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more inventory

loans.name: Feliuai

texts.en:
Feliuai A. is 42 and married with no children. She owns a business venture, planting and harvesting taro for sale.  Feliuai has twp years of experience in this business. Feliuai needs a loan of 1200 talas to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US$ 195 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Feliuai joined SPBD. This is her 2nd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Feliuai's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Nyabubare Intergrated Farmers Group

texts.en:
Hardworking K. Magidu has been running his business for over five years, selling produce including maize, sorghum, millet, beans and groundnuts as an additional source of income alongside pineapple sales. His business prospers because maize flour used in prepared food is in high favor with many Ugandans.

In Nyabubare, Bushenyi, this 52-year-old married father of eight is referred to as the early riser with the lark. He is a stickler for hard work and as such his children are all basking in the glow of his enterprising nature as he has been able to pay up their school dues. This business brings him monthly profits of 120,000 Ugandan shillings, and he is looking at business expansion in the future. With this loan he will purchase more stock to help meet the increasing demand from his customers and thereby earn more revenue.

loans.use: To purchase  more stock

loans.name: Christopher Kipruto

texts.en:
Christopher Kipruto M. is a 33-year-old man married to Irene M. and has two children aged two and eleven years. They live in Ngeria on the outskirts of Eldoret town. Christopher raises and sells livestock. He has been in this business for the past ten years, earning 15,000 KES per month.

Christopher was introduced to KADET by a credit officer. He is applying for his seventh loan of 90,000 KES from KADET, which he plans to use to purchase nine more head of cows to rear and sell later at a profit.

Christopher hopes to operate a large-scale livestock operation that would allow him to supply livestock to butcheries in Eldoret.

loans.use: To purchase nine more cows

loans.name: Arsenio

texts.en:
Arsenio F. is from the village of Brgy. Tucal, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 48 years old. Arsenio is married and has 4 children. To make a living, Arsenio owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for breeding. Arsenio has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Arsenio joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arsenio has successfully repaid a previous loan of 35,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. Arsenio is requesting a new loan of 40,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be the 8th loan taken out by Arsenio from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha S. lives in the Kisaasi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is widowed and has  4 children, all of whom are in school.   She also takes care of additional family members (in- laws).  Aisha  has a poultry farming business.  She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week.    

Aisha sells her products from home, by means of wholesale/retail.  Aisha  has requested a loan of 1,500,000  Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of chicken feeds.  She also generates additional income through brick laying and room renting.

The main business challenges for Aisha include thieves and the ever increasing prices of chicken feeds.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are  to own a delivery van and also to own 2000 chickens.    

Aisha lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy chicken feeds  for poultry farm business.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en: Damaris, 28 years old, is single and a mother of two children. She has been operating a clothing stall in Nairobi as her primary business for the last seven years. She got to know about KADET through a friend who was already a member, and she has never borrowed from other financial institutions. With this loan advance, she plans to buy more stock and move to a more spacious shop for her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock and to move to a more spacious shop

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius M., 32 years old, is a single man who operates a motorcycle transport business popularly known as ‘bodaboda’ in Kenya; he also supplies household goods. Julius operates from Kahawa West, a highly populated area. He supports his parents with the income that he gets from his business. He was introduced to KADET by existing clients.

Julius’s transport and supplies business has been in operation for two years and it gives him a monthly profit of KES 13,000. With this loan of KES 40,000, his second loan with KADET, he intends to use KES 25,000 to increase his stock of food supplies and household goods and KES 15,000 to repair and build a carrier for his motorbike to enable him to transport many goods at once. Julius plans to plough back the extra profits into his supplies business since he gets many orders and some of his clients need him to extend credit periods. This will help him run the business comfortably. Julius hopes to expand his business and buy land where he can build his own house.

loans.use: to increase stocks of household goods and food supplies and build a carrier on his motorcycle

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma S. is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past 15 years, she has operated a natural juice selling business. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. Fatuma faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

With the 25000 KES she wants to purchase a freezer for storing juices for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase a freezer for storing juices for sale

loans.name: Annelyn

texts.en:
Annelyn G. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 40 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Annelyn plants and harvests rice for sale. Annelyn works hard to support her family – especially her children's education.

Annelyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Annelyn is requesting a new loan of 16,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) which will be used to buy fertilizers and other farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Anelyn

texts.en:
Anelyn A. is from the village of Bunawan, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 24 years old. Anelyn is married and has one infant-aged child. To make a living, she owns and operates a service-based business, providing passenger services in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $50 a month from these activities.

In 2010, Anelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to expand the services she provides. 

Anelyn is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which again will be used to purchase materials needed to provide better service. This will be her 2nd loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: María Carmen

texts.es:
La Señora. María L. es socia del banco comunal Unión Progresista, vive en la comunidad de Pichacay que  pertenece a la parroquia de Santa Ana, en esta parroquia se puede admirar gran parte de la ciudad de Cuenca, cuenta con una hermosa vista de la naturaleza, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales y agricultura, muchos laboran en la ciudad en diferentes cargos.
 
Doña María tiene 53 años, es madre soltera y tiene 8 hijos, tres son casados y viven  independientes, sus tres hijos siguientes trabajan para sus gastos, una de sus hijas pasa en casa y le ayudan en los quehaceres del hogar y su ultimo hijo estudia en un colegio de la ciudad. Con su trabajo ha logrado construir su casa propia.

La Señora. María se dedica a la agricultura y lo que produce es solo para su consumo, cría ganado y la leche que obtiene realiza quesillos que vende en la ciudad, también cría cerdos, gallinas y borregos los que vende cuando tiene alguna necesidad.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 2 años, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de semillas y de animales. Su meta es  tener más ganado.
texts.en:
Maria es a member of the Union Progresista (Progressive Union) Communal Bank. She lives in the community of Pichacay in Santa Ana parish. From this parish you can admire a grand part of the city of Cuenca. It also has a beautiful view of nature.  The people are dedicated to raising livestock and to agriculture. Many work in the city in different jobs.

Maria is 53 years old and a single mother with 8 children. Three are married and live independently. Her next 3 children work to pay their own way. One of her daughters still lives at home and helps Maria with household chores. Her last child studies in a city school. From her own work she has been able to construct her own house.

Maria works in agriculture and what she produces is only for their consumption. She raises cattle and with the milk she makes cheeses to sell in the city. Also, she raises pigs, chickens, and sheep, which she sells when there is the necessity.

Maria has been a member of her communal bank for some 2 years. The loan will be invested in buying seeds and livestock. Her goal is to have more cattle.

loans.use: TO BUY FARM ANIMALS AND SEEDS

loans.name: Jose Noe

texts.es:
José, reside en Corinto departamento de Morazán, tiene 35 años de edad, vive con su esposa y una hija de 6 meses de edad, posee una tienda donde ofrece a los vecinos y amigos productos para el hogar, esté negocio tiene 1 año de existir, lo atiende de 6 de la mañana a 7 de la noche; José quiere invertirle al negocio y para realizarlo solicita un préstamo que le brinde los recursos para abastecer el inventario.
El préstamo será utilizado en bebidas, arroz, frijoles, jabón y detergente, esta compra le ayudara para crecer con el negocio, cubrirá la demanda y mejorar su condición.
Entre los sueños de José esta ver a su hija crecer sanamente, continuar trabajando con el negocio y seguir arreglando poco a poco la casa.
texts.en:
José resides in Corinto, within the department of Morazán.  He is 35 years old, and lives with his wife and a 6-month old daughter.  He has a store where he offers neighbors and friends products for the home.  The business has been in existence for 1 year; he tends to it from 6 am until 7 pm.  José would like to invest in the business, and requests a loan to have the resources to supply his inventory.  

The loan would be used for beverages, rice, beans, soap and detergent.  These purchases would help him to grow his business, as he would be able to meet demand and improve his situation.  José’s dreams include seeing his daughter grow up healthy, continuing to work  on his business and, little by little, making improvements to their home.

loans.use: To purchase beverages, rice, beans, soap and detergent.

loans.name: Oscar Osmin

texts.es:
Oscar de 40 años de edad, es sastre, vive con sus hijas de 14 y 16 años de edad, residen en Jucuapa departamento de Usulután, la casa que habitan es alquilada, ahí mismo posee el taller de sastrería, donde confecciona de toda clase de ropa, este oficio lo aprendió hace 18 años y hasta el momento ha sido su fuente de ingreso, no tiene un horario fijo para realizar los trabajos.
El actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar telas de diferentes colores y estilos, hilos, ciper, botones y broches, al realizar esta compra Oscar estará más seguro de su trabajo, pues al tener todo lo necesario para confeccionar ropa también podrá hacer los trabajos en menor tiempo y de calidad.
El aspira que después de la inversión el taller se vuelva fuerte en trabajos, con materiales nuevos para realizar los encargos, también quiere recibir mejores ganancias y que su familia cuente con una calidad de vida excelente.
texts.en:
Oscar, 40 years of age, is a tailor.  He lives with his daughters, ages 14 and 16, in the department of Jucuapa in Usulután.  The house they live in is rented, and it is there that he has the tailor’s shop where he makes all types of clothing.  He learned this trade 18 years ago and, to this day, it has been his source of income.  He does not have a fixed schedule in which to do his work.

He currently requests a loan to purchase fabric in different colors and styles, threads, zippers, buttons and clasps.  Upon buying these supplies, Oscar will be able to work more securely since, by having what he needs to make clothes, he will also be able to do his work in less time and higher quality.

He hopes that, after his investment, his workshop will be busy.  With new materials to fill orders, he also wants to increase his income so that his family can count on a higher standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase fabric in different colors and styles, threads, zippers, buttons and clasps.

loans.name: Andrelly

texts.en:
Andrelly is a married woman from the town of San Francisco. She has 3 children, aged 10, 4 and 3. Her oldest child is the only one in school right now. 

Andrelly works hard to earn and save for her children's education. She and her husband are both farmers. They till their land to plant and harvest rice crops. Andrelly has applied for a loan of 4000 PHP, which she will use to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

Andrelly wishes for her children to have bright futures.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine N. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Nasana in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is married and has two children.  Both of her children are currently in school.  Josephine has a business selling clothes, which she has had for five years.  She also has a second business selling shoes. 

To help expand her businesses, Josephine has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more clothes and shoes for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Josephine hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children.  In the future, Josephine hopes to own a permanent shop and stop her mobile-sales (door-to-door) business.  

Josephine is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by making new friends who have played a big role in her life.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma has a fruit vending business, and she also earns additional income from raising pigs. Thelma is a requesting a loan of PHP 11,000 through NWTF in order to buy more fruits to sell in her stall. Thelma and her husband have seven children. 

Thelma works hard to support her family. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream to build and expand her business, securing a stable future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell in her stall

loans.name: Virginia Nieves

texts.es:
Virginia es socia del  Banco Comunal “Las Retamas”, ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 40 años de edad, es conviviente, con  grado de instrucción  educación superior y tiene 3 hijos en estudio. 
Su primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento  Manuela  Ramos que fue por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, lo utilizó en su negocio de venta al por menor de artículos artesanales, también cuenta que utilizó parte del dinero para comprar una máquina para sus tejidos.  Es socia de Manuela Ramos desde hace dos años y medio.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/ 100.00 nuevo soles, comprará tres conos de lana de alpaca para la elaboración de sus chompas.   Su esposo trabaja en construcción civil pero cuando le es posible la ayuda en el negocio.
Su sueño es ser empresaria de artesanías al por mayor.
Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la puntualidad y la responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Virginia is a member of the “Las Retamas” community bank which is located in Puno district, in Puno province and department.  She is 40 years old, lives with her partner, completed her higher education, and has three children who are all in school.

Virginia's first loan from Movimiento Manuela Ramos was for 300 Peruvian soles and she invested that money in her business selling craft products retail.  She tells us that she used part of the money to buy a machine for making her knitted products.  She has been a member of Movimiento Manuela Ramos for two and a half years.

Virginia will use this new loan for 100 soles to buy three cones of alpaca yarn with which to make sweaters.  Her husband works in civil engineering but, whenever possible, he also helps her in her business.

Virginia's dream is to be a businesswoman who sells handicrafts wholesale.  What she likes about her community bank is the punctuality and responsibility.

loans.use: to buy three cones of alpaca yarn

loans.name: Izafa

texts.ru:
Izafa S. zamujem i imeyet 2 detey. Ona yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmete so svoim mujem i detmi. Izafa rodilas v 1971 qodu. 
Ona uje 5 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov. Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2300 AZN chtobi kupit korov dlya razvitiya svoyeqo biznessa i uvelicheniya molochnoqo produkta dlya prodaji.
texts.en: Izafa S. is married and has two children.  She is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  She is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives in the Fuzuli region with her husband and children.  Izafa was born in 1971.  She has been a herdsman and cattle breeder for five years. Now she needs 2300 AZN to buy cows to expand her business and the production of milk for sale.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Kossiwa Félicité

texts.fr: Mme Kossiwa  est mariée à un Revendeuse de produits de denrées alimentaires, des médicaments et du sodabi (boisson locale faite à base de palmier à huile très  appréciée chez nous) depuis 2000 et mariée à transitaire et mère de 04 enfants. Elle achète au Grand marché de Lomé et revend à son domicile. Elle sollicite ce second prêt pour renforcer son activité.
texts.en: Mrs. Kossiwa  has been a retailer of food products, medicines and sodabi (a local drink made from palm-tree oil that is well-loved in her homeland) since 2000 and is married to a forwarding agent and is the mother of 4 children.  She buys at the Big Market of Lomé and re-sells from her home.  She is asking for a second loan to strengthen her business.

loans.use: to purchase commercial products to strengthen her business.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es: La señora Bertha es de la comunidad de Moyotepec, Ayala, en el estado de Morelos, México, ella tiene 61 años de edad, ella es sola tiene 4 hijos María Luisa de 42 años de edad, Francisca Susana de 40 años de edad, Bertha de 38 años de edad, Israel de 29 años de edad, todos sus hijos ya son casados e independientes, ella vende colchas, cobertores y cortinas, ella solicito su crédito para comprar colchas, cobertores y cortinas, ella inicio su negocio hace 10 años con un dinero que tenía guardado de su trabajo anterior, por iniciativa propia y por la necesidad de recursos económicos, ella sale a ofrecer sus productos en Moyotepec con sus vecinas y conocidas es ambulante va caminando o en transporte colectivo, su negocio es importante porque gana es el sustento para sobrevivir y puede obtener ganancias para volver a surtirse de mercancía, los desafíos que enfrenta su negocio son el clima en tiempo de calor bajan su ventas. Moyotepec es un pueblo bonito se celebra el 6 de enero la fiesta del Pueblo celebran a los reyes Magos hay misas, primeras comuniones, bautizos, baile, toros, hay campo siembran maíz, cebolla, caña, sus sueños y esperanzas son seguir trabajando en las ventas de sus colchas, cobertores y cortinas y que sus hijos estén bien y que sigan adelante con sus hijos y sus familias, ella quiere decirle a Kiva y a Fundación realidad “les damos las gracias, gracias a ustedes podemos salir adelante y se pueden realizar los  sueños de progresar y que sigan ayudando a más personas”.
texts.en:
Bertha, 61, is from Moyotepec, Ayala, in the state of Morelos, Mexico.  She is single  and has 1 son and 3 daughters: Maria Luisa, 42, Francisca Susana, 40, Bertha, 38 and Israel, 29.  All are married and living on their own.
She sells mattresses, bedspreads, and curtains.  By her own initiative  and because of  her financial need, she started her business 10 years ago with money that she had saved from her previous work.  She is requesting the loan to buy mattresses, bedspreads and curtains.  She sells these items in Moyotepec to her neighbors and acquaintances.  She is a street merchant and walks or takes communal taxis.  Her business is important because it is her only source of income and she can make a profit and reinvest in purchasing merchandise.
The challenge that she faces with her business is that during the hot season, sales drop.

Moyotepec is a pretty town that holds its Saint’s Day on January 6th, the three Kings.  There are masses, first communions, baptisms, dances, and bullfighting.  There are fields where corn, onions, and sugar cane are planted.
Her dreams and hopes are to continue working, selling mattresses, bedspreads and curtains and that her son and daughters are well and get ahead with their children and their families.

She wants to tell Kiva and the Realidad Foundation that she gives them thanks, and thanks to you, we can get ahead and continue progressing and realize our dreams and help more people.

loans.use: To buy mattresses, bedspreads and curtains

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en: Juanita is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. Juanita has operated a shop selling fish such as sardines and milk fish for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy additional fish. Juanita has been a member of HSPFI since 2007. In the future, Juanita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish

loans.name: Pedro Darío

texts.es:
Pedro Darío tiene 23 años, es soltero vive con sus hermanos, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.  No tiene hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. VALLE ALTO, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Voluntad de Dios en el Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra maíz y arroz.


 Pedro se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz,  Compra sus productos en Comercial Peña y los vende sus productos en los comisariatos y tiendas.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz y arroz, compra de insumos y fertilizantes para los cultivos.   Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para mejorar su producción  y suplir sus necesidades. Su sueño es tener una casa propia.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Pedro Darío is 23 years old, single, and lives with his siblings in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.  He doesn't have any children.

The Valle Alto community bank is located in Voluntad de Dios, in Ventanas canton.  The members of this bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn and rice.

Pedro is a farmer who grows corn and rice.  He buys his products in Comercial Peña and sells his products in co-op stores and regular stores.

Pedro is requesting this loan so that he can sow his corn and rice.  He will buy supplies and fertilizers for his crops.  The support of this loan will help him financially to improve his production and meet his needs.  His dream is to own his own home.

Pedro enjoys taking part in sports.

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizers for his crops

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en:
Jamal is a 47 year old married man. He has been working in construction for 20 years. Jamal is an honest man, a hard worker, and has a very good reputation in his area.

Jamal is an Al Majmoua-Kiva partner for the first time. He has requested a loan in order to buy extra materials and tools needed to build an extra room for a project he is working on. It's hard to save extra money these days, that's why Jamal finds requesting a loan to do unfinished business is a blessing.

Jamal hopes to expand his business more and more in the future to cover his family's expenses and to make sure all their needs are met in a very satisfactory way.

loans.use: to buy extra materials and tools to build a requested room.

loans.name: Joelita

texts.en:
Joelita is married with 5 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 40 years old and has 3 children who are in school. She has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years. 

She requested a PHP 23,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase fishing gear and equipment.  Joelita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing gear and equipment.

loans.name: Marcial

texts.es: El señor Marcial, no es casado pero convive  con la señora Lenndy, desde hace 4 años, tienen 2 hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar y actualmente están dedicados a su emprendimiento de la confección de ropas, realizan chamarras, poleras, pantalón, variedad de prendas de vestir según a la temporada, para ello necesitaban el préstamo para la compra de materia prima (tela, hilo. Maquina cortadora de tela), el Sr. Marcial es una persona emprendedora con ganas de superación, agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sr. Marcial is not married, but has been in a relationship with Sra. Lenndy for the past four years. They have two children who are in school. He currently has a business making clothes such as jackets, sweatshirts, and a variety of other seasonal garments. Marcial needs a loan to buy raw materials, such as fabric and thread, and a cloth-cutting machine.

He is an enterprising individual who desires to succeed. Marcial appreciates the support that Emprender has provided.

loans.use: to buy materials, such as fabric and thread, and a cloth-cutting machine.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with five children.
 
Edna has a shop that sells clothing and beauty products from NATASHA & AVON. She has had this business for seven years. She requested a loan for 6,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy stock from NATASHA & AVON to sell.

Edna has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Edna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock from NATASHA and AVON to sell.

loans.name: Foryirra Group

texts.en:
Yeabu (pictured on the right) is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Yeabu was born in Mayorlow village, on the outskirts of Magburaka town, about 45 years ago. Yeabu is a widow with four children: one is in primary school, two are in secondary school and one is grown-up. Yeabu sells rice, pepper, palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), etc. She has been a businesswoman for many years now. 

With the help of this loan, Yeabu and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Yeabu will use her share of the loan (500,000 SLL) to buy rice, pepper, palm oil, etc. in larger quantities to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy rice, pepper, palm oil, etc. in larger quantities

loans.name: Long

texts.en: Long, 27, resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Long is employed at a garment factory, earning an income of USD 3.33 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 4.66 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 40 on food and USD 15 on the other necessary expenses. Long is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase clothes and cosmetics to resell. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy clothes and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Natalia

texts.en:
Natalia is from the village of Bredza in the eastern part of the country. She is 56 years old and married.  She lives with her husband, Akaki, her 31 year-old son, her daughter-in-law and her 3 year-old granddaughter. 

Natalia’s son has seasonal work. He is employed as a construction worker and is busy seasonally, mainly in the spring and summer seasons. Natalia and her husband are leading the agricultural business of the family, which is an important source of income for the family. Natalia and Akaki grow beans, wheat and tulips on family-owned 2 hectares of land. Natalia sells harvested vegetables and flowers in Khashuri (nearby town).  Total average income of the family is 800 Laris per month. 

Natalia requested credit for cultivation of the land and to purchase wheat for sowing. After proper cultivation and purchasing high quality seeds, Natalia will get a good harvest next spring and sell it for a fair price. The family will get the planned amount of income, which will be used for financing family daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay for land cultivation and to purchase wheat for sowing

loans.name: Karimjon

texts.ru: Каримчон женат и любящий отец троих детей. Он умный и целеустремленный человек. Каримчон хочет содержит свою семью в хороших условиях жизни и обеспечить их всему то, что они хотят. С этой целью он начал заниматься услугами такси 8 лет тому назад и до сегодняшней день успешно продолжает данный бизнес. Его жена занимается шитьем одежды и помогает мужу по пополнению семейного бюджета. Каримчон хотел бы получить займ для покупки нового автомобиля. Он заранее благодарить всех кредиторов за поддержку и доброту.
texts.en: Karimjon is married and is a loving father of three children.  He is a smart and goal-oriented person.  Karimjon wants to supply his family with a good quality of life and provide them with everything that they want.  With this goal in mind, he became involved in offering taxi services 8 years ago and successfully continues his business today.  His wife is involved in sewing clothing and helps her husband with adding to the family budget.  Karimjon wants to obtain a loan to buy a new car.  He thanks all creditors in advance for the support and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase a new car

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 35 years old and lives in the town of Soroti in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has six children who are all currently in school. For the past fifteen years, Peter has been working hard to manage his retail shop, where he sells home supplies, food and fresh produce. 

To help expand his business, Peter has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva field partner BRAC Uganda. He will use the loan to buy more food to sell at his shop. Peter is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP), which primarily serves small entrepreneurs who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

Peter hopes he will be able to generate greater profits and improve his family's welfare. He hopes that in the future he will be able to start offering new kinds of produce to his customers.

loans.use: to buy more food items for resale

loans.name: María Monserrate

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Constructoras Del Éxito, esta ciudad se la conoce desde hace mucho con el nombre de Ciudad Del Valle por estar encerrada por muchos cerros que rodean la urbe.

Aquí conocimos a María, tiene 21 años  de edad, está soltera y estudia el quinto semestre de Administración de Empresas en una Universidad de Manabí. Ella vive en casa de sus padres. Lleva en el Banco Comunal seis ciclos y le gusta por las facilidades para conseguir los créditos.

Es una preciosa jovencita que además de ser muy dedicada a sus estudios también se dedica al comercio, ella vende ropa por catalogo y  productos de Avon  (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los  días ya que vende por su casa y también en la universidad donde estudia,  deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene cuatro años que se dedica a esta actividad y es con esto que se ayuda para seguir con sus estudios.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y ropa.

Sus sueños son terminar sus estudios  y ser una gran empresaria.
texts.en:
The “Constructoras Del Éxito” (Success Builders) communal bank meets every two weeks in the city of Portoviejo known for many years as “Ciudad Del Valle” (City of the Valley) because the city is surrounded by many hills.

We met María, 21, here.  She’s single and studying fifth semester of Business Administration at a university in Manabí.  She lives with her parents and has been in the communal bank for six cycles; she likes it because of the ease in getting loans.

She is a lovely young lady who  besides being dedicated to her studies is also a merchant; she sells clothes via catalogue and Avon brand products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and women’s accessories).  She works every day because she sells both at home and also at the university she attends.  She sells on credit and collects weekly.  She’s been in business four years and this is how she helps to pay her school costs. 

This loan is to buy perfume, cream, cosmetics and clothes.  Her dream is to finish her schooling and become a great businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and clothes.

loans.name: Mendez Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MENDEZ” iniciará su decimo tercer en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal German Busch, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Cristina. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: productos Herbalay, venta de fruta, venta de ropa, venta de comida, tejido de busos, venta de bañadores, venta de verduras, tejidos, pollos a la broster.

La señora Cristina, indica que hace seis meses que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una vecina. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido que viene trabajando hace años, aprendiendo el mismo de su familia.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de lana) que comprara de la 16 de julio y posteriormente lo venderá a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene cuatro hijos.  

En al fotografía nos acompaña la prima de la señora Alicia, ella es la que esta con sombrero blanco y esta agachada.
texts.en:
The “Mendez” communal bank will start its thirteenth cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the German Busch focal center.  It has nine members led by a governing board headed by Cristina.  The members of the communal bank carry out a variety of businesses among which se have Herbalife products sales, fruit sales, clothing sales, food sales, sweatshirt making, swimsuit sales, vegetable sales, knitting and Broasted-style chicken sales.

Cristina indicates that she’s been working in Pro Mujer for six months and that she joined thanks to an invitation from a neighbor.  She currently has a knitting business that she’s had for several years having learned it in her family.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase capital.  She will buy wool in the 16 de Julio market and then will sell it on order.  This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family because she lives in a common law relationship and has four children.

The cousin of Alicia is also in the photo, she is wearing a white hat and is crouching.

loans.use: to buy wool yarn.

loans.name: Rocio Del Pilar

texts.es:
Rocio tiene 23 años de edad, es soltera y reside junto a sus padres y a sus hermanos en una zona marginal del distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola ubicada en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace más de tres años a la comercialización de productos de belleza y cosméticos por catálogo. Ella cuenta con un grupo de clientes que acuden con frecuencia a solicitarle los productos que ofrece, usualmente trabaja en base a pedidos, aunque también cuenta con un stock propio que utiliza cada vez que un cliente tiene urgencia de los productos que ofrece.

Paralelamente se dedica a trabajar en una peluquería de la zona, ya que ha estudiado cosmetología.

Rocío ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que planea utilizar en la compra de más mercadería para aumentar su negocio y poder recibir mejores ganancias.

Ella es una cliente que ya ha tenido créditos con Edpyme Alternativa y que ha demostrado puntualidad, responsabilidad y honradez al momento de asumir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Rocio is 23 years old. She is single and lives alongside her parents and her brothers in a suburb of Tambogrande, an agricultural area located in the Piura region, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo.

For more than three years, she has been dedicated to selling beauty products and cosmetics from catalogs. She has a group of customers who go to her frequently to request the products she offers. She usually works based on orders although she also has her own stock that she uses every time a customer needs a product she offers urgently.

At the same time, she is dedicated to working in a salon in the area since she has studied cosmetology.

Rocio has requested from Edpyme Alternativa a lon of 1,000 "soles" that she plans to use in the purchase of more merchandise to expand her business and to be able to receive greater earnings.

She is a client who has already had loans with Edpyme Alternativa and who has demonstrated punctuality, responsibility and honor at the time of completing her payments.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to expand her sales business

loans.name: Nathan

texts.en:
Nathan is a married man, age 57, living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is a businessman dealing in cattle and he has been in this business for 3 years. He has a challenge of inadequate capital to meet the high demand for cattle, as the Christmas season is fast approaching. Nathan intends to use the loan to buy cattle to sell.

The client's personal goal is to buy a motorcycle and his business goal is to own a ranch.

loans.use: to buy cattle to sell

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is 41 years old and lives in the town of Makindye in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She is single and has two children, both of whom are currently in school. For the past 11 years, Justine has been working hard to manage her salon, which does hair dressing.

To help expand her business, Justine has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Uganda shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy braids for the hair, and will help Justine to generate greater profits and expand her business. Justine hopes that in the future she will be able to improve her childrens' standards of living. 

Justine is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Justine who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: To buy braids for the hair.

loans.name: Violet

texts.en: Violet, aged 34, is a single mother of two children aged 5 and 15. She has a quarrying business that earns her a monthly income of 12,000 KES. This is Violet's second loan; she has successfully repaid a previous loan. She will use the funds to buy quarrying tools and pay wages to the workers. Violet hopes to start a construction company in the future.

loans.use: to buy quarrying tools.

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma is a married man with two children who are 18 and 22 years old respectively.  He describes himself as humble, God fearing, honest, and social.  Juma operates a retail business selling clothes. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a residential area and his primary customers are the area residents.  In addition, Juma is a farmer and runs a grocery store to increase his income. His biggest business challenges are transportation problems when delivering clothes and the high cost of clothes. 

Juma will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more clothes to sell.  His business goal is to start a wholesale retail shop within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell from his retail business.

loans.name: Inshuti Group

texts.en: INSHUTI is a group led by Patricie who is 33 years old. The group name means “Friends” in English. She has been a group leader for nine years. She sells clothes and has been in the business for nine years. With the loan, she would like to buy more clothes to resell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine A. is a colleague participant of Julie of Sibebe Enterprise. Mama Josephine, as she is popularly called, sells variety of products to members of the community called Christian Village with a population of of about 25,000 inhabitants. She has prepared a business plan and she keeps simple basic accounting records of her activities. She requires a loan of $700 to improve her business transactions.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Telesia

texts.en:
Telesia’s business is sewing. She is 50 years old and is divorced from her husband. Telesia’s sewing talent keeps her family clothed and is a major source of income for the family.

Telesia agrees that "A journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step"  An electric sewing machine was purchased with her first loan. “The machine can pay its own bill and even feed the whole family”. She started her business sewing by hand with a needle, and it took a whole day to make a T-shirt. But now she produces her clothing items much faster. 

Telesia is requesting a loan to buy more fabric and thread, and looks forward to establishing "Telesia's Fashion Wear" in her town as her business progresses.

loans.use: To purchase rolls of materials and threads

loans.name: Martina Del Socorro

texts.en:
Martina is a very active woman and entrepreneur. She is 43 years old, married and mother of two children aged 13 and 21. Her husband works for a department store, however, the wages he makes are insufficient for the family's needs.

In order to earn a little extra income which would allow her older son to continue studying, 5 years ago Martha started her own business selling stationary and perfumes.

Her home is located on the way to a school. Taking advantage of this situation she started selling outside her house. Fortunately the business has done well.

In order to increase her sales, Martina requests a loan of $275 which she will use to buy merchandise and continue growing to cover the demand of her clientèle. She is committing to pay back this quantity in 4 to 8 months. With your help you will strengthen this business and improve the life quality of this family. They will be thankful.

Translated from Spanish by Luis López Martinelli, Kiva Volunteer.


Martina es una mujer emprendedora y muy activa, tiene 43 años de edad, es casada y madre de dos hijos, de 13 y 21 años. Su esposo es empleado en una tienda departamental, sin embargo, el salario que recibe es insuficiente para las necesidades de su familia, para obtener un ingreso extra que permitiera continuar estudiando a su hijo mayor, hace cinco años, Martina inició su propio negocio con la venta de artículos de papelería y perfumería, su casa se ubica camino a una escuela y aprovechando esta situación empezó a vender afuera de su casa, afortunadamente le ha ido bien con su negocio.

Para poder incrementar sus ventas, Martina solicita un crédito de $ 275 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía para continuar creciendo y poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en un lapso de 4 a 8 meses. Con tu ayuda fortalecerás este negocio y mejorarás la vida de esta familia, ellos te lo agradecerán.

loans.use: Purchasing Merchandise

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia is the mother of three children, ages 9, 11, and 15. She’s married and lives in the city of Monterrey, Nuevo León. When her oldest son began the secondary level of school, the cost of the school fees went up, making it very difficult to cover all the expenses with her husbands wages alone. This was why, three years ago, Silvia started up her business selling tostadas, tacos and soups from her home. Not long ago she was able to open a restaurant, causing business to grow faster.

Silvia would like to provide a better service to her customers to make sure they keep coming back. She is asking for a $200 loan so that she could buy furniture to make her business more comfortable. She will pay the loan back in 3 months. Play a key role in the growth of this business. Silvia and her family truly appreciate it.

Silvia tiene tres hijos, de 9, 11 y 15 años de edad, es casada y viven en la ciudad de Monterrey, Nuevo León. Cuando su hijo mayor comenzó la secundaria los costos de las colegiaturas se incrementaron y fue muy difícil cubrir todos los gastos sólo con el salario de su esposo, esta fue la razón por la que hace tres años Silvia inició su negocio con la venta de tostadas, tacos y caldos, comenzó en su propio domicilio y hace poco logró abrir un local en el que ha hecho crecer su negocio más rápidamente.

Silvia busca ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes y seguir contando con su preferencia para lo que solicita un préstamo de $ 200 dólares que destinará a la compra de muebles para acondicionar mejor su negocio, ella ofrece devolver esta cantidad en 3 meses. Se parte fundamental en el crecimiento de este negocio, Silvia y su familia agradecen sinceramente tu ayuda.

loans.use:
Remodeling

Remodelación

loans.name: Alisakhib

texts.en: Alisakhib A. is a 47-year-old married man with 2 children  who lives in Khaladj, in the Salyan region of Azerbaijan. Alisakhib has his own vineyard and 13 years of experience in this business. He would like a loan of $1200 to buy pesticides and fertilizer. He plans to develop his vineyard and increase his yields.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Carlos Alberto is 43 years old and has been married to his wife, Ramona, for the past 14 years. Together they have 5 children, three of whom are grown and married and two who are still in primary school. 

Carlos works as a tailor and is skilled in all areas of the trade. He first learned this trade from his uncle at a very young age. He is especially talented at making overalls, underwear, t-shirts and cowboy boots.  After making these items in his home he travels a great distance to sell his wares in the commerical markets in Encarnación, Paraguay. Encarnación is more than 270 km from the town of Itá, where Carlos lives.
	
Carlos has told us that in the past he traveled to Argentina and Brazil to obtain work experience and perfect his skills. After working in these places for several years he decided to return to Paraguay and work in a factory. Having worked in this position for some time, Carlos decided to leave this job and begin his own business. 

With the money he has gained from his store, Carlos, has been able to give his family a good life. He has requested a loan in order to buy the materials he uses to make clothing, including: cloth, needles and zipper.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MATERIALS FOR HIS TAILORING BUSINESS, SUCH AS CLOTH, NEEDLES AND ZIPPERS.

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en: Khalil G. lives in the Ashigli village of Beylagan, a small city in southwestern Azerbaijan.  He is 46 years old, married and has three children.  He is engaged in sheep-breding.  Khalil has 20 years of experience in this business.  He wants to buy some sheep to expand his business.  To do this, he needs a loan in amount $600.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Zebonisso

texts.ru:
Zebonisso O. is 22 years old, she has a high school diploma and is single. Zebonisso sews traditional dresses for local people. She has been doing this during the past 2 years. She plans to use the credit in order to purchase material and thread for her products. These products are supplied to local markets and they are very successful with local public. The credit will give Zebonisso the opportunity to produce more goods, and local people will be able to obtain these products at decent prices.

The client plans to repay the credit in 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva volunteer.

Одилова Зебониссо, возраст – 22 года, образование среднее, не замужем. Зебониссо занимается пошивом национальных платьев и курпачей для местного населения. Этим видом деятельности она занимается уже в течение 2 лет. Полученнй кредит она планирует использовьать на приобретение тканей, ниток для необходимых для производимой продукции. Свою продукцию она поставляет на местные рынки и она пользуется большим спросом среди местного населения. Данный кредит даст возможность Зебониссо производить больше продукции, а местные жители смогут приобретать их по приемлемым ценам. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 10 месяцев.

loans.use: Obtain material, thread and other products for sewing

loans.name: Sunita

texts.en:
Mrs. Sunita M. is a shopkeeper in Tangal, Lalitpur. Tangal is one of the busiest towns in Lalitpur district. Most of the people in this region are engaged in business work. Mrs. Sunita lives in a single family home with her husband and two sons. Her husband Mr. Shrawan M. works in a garment factory. Her older son is in grade 2 and her younger son is only 2 years of age.

Mrs. M. opened her cosmetics shop 3 years ago. She sells different types of cosmetic goods in her shop like creams, lipsticks, glass bangles, etc. The demand for these types of goods is increasing in that area because of the wedding season. So she is requesting a Rs 15000 loan to buy cosmetic goods for her shop.

loans.use: To buy cosmetic goods for her shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in an assortment of materials for a beauty parlor.

loans.name: Tupone

texts.en:
Tupone is 40 years old and is a married woman with 5 children, ages 3-18 years old. Tupone owns a small charcoal store, which she started in 2005. Everyday, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $190 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Slon's Amani Group

texts.en:
Slon is 32 years old and is a single woman. Slon owns a small grocery, which she started in 2007. Every day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more grocery items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Paulina, Joyce and Upendo, who have businesses dealing in groceries, a salon and animals food sales.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items for her business.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy U. is a petty trader who sells foodstuffs at Igbelerin community in Okoko, Lagos State, Nigeria.  She has been in this business since 1998. Her shop is scanty because she doesn’t have enough capital to make it bigger, although she has been borrowing a little capital from LAPO Microfinance for the past 2 years.  She is now soliciting a loan of $425 to buy more foodstuffs so that she can enlarge her business and increase her profit margin. Joy is business oriented and she has the desire to travel to central Lagos to buy more crayfish in large quantities to supply her fellow small-scale retailers. Joy is 38 years old and married with 2 children. She is thankful to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy wholesale inventory

loans.name: Wolali

texts.fr:
Wolali A. is 34 years old, married, and the father of two. He is an automobile electrician in Assahoun, a village located about 50 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. Mr. Wolali wishes to use this loan to fix up his shop and to acquire tools of the trade to better meet customer needs and to earn more to provide for his family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Wolali A. est âgé de 34 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. Il est électricien auto à Assahoun, un village situé à environ 50 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Monsieur Wolali désire avec ce crédit aménager son atelier et acquérir des outils de travail pour mieux répondre aux besoins de la clientèle et de gagner plus pour subvenir les besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To fix up his shop and to acquire tools of the trade to meet customer needs better

loans.name: Regina Namuli's Group

texts.en:
Regina N. is the leader of a group of 5 women.  She is 43 and a single mother with four children ages 20, 18, 16 and 14.  Regina lives in a semi-urban slum on the outskirts of Kampala that is prone to flooding during the rainy season.

Regina has been selling beer at her bar for the past 8 years.  The market for her beer is fair.  Regina plans to use this loan to boost her business by increasing her stock.  

Since she began working with MCDT, Regina has successfully repaid eight loans.  With these loans, Regina's business has prospered and with the profits she has been able to educate her children and look after her family.

Regina hopes to one day be able to build a house for her family.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Zuhra

texts.en:
Zuhra is a 31-year-old woman, the mother of two children. She lives with her family in the town Banovići. In her current business, she does the agriculture while her husband works in Slovenija.

Zuhra has requested a loan in the amount of 800 KM ($US600). This is her first loan and she is asking for it because she wants to buy chicken for fattening. Her business with selling vegetables has been successful so far and she can earn up to 300 KM per month. Her wish is to expand the business with chicken during the winter. She hopes to increase her income through this loan, and thinks that this purchase will help her with money during the winter.

loans.use: To buy chicken.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Mrs. Chan N., 51, is a widow with two daughters. One of her daughters is married and lives outside the family home, and the youngest daughter is a garment factory worker. The family lives in a small village off National Road Two about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Chan has been selling clothes for eight years. She buys them from the market in Phnom Penh for resale in her village and nearby villages. Chan is requesting a loan of $300 to purchase more clothes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for resale

loans.name: Erika Jazmin

texts.es:
Erika inicio su negocio para apoyar a su esposo con la economía de la casa y para darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos, su necesidad en aquel entonces era tener un negocio el cual pudiera manejar desde su casa para no descuidar a sus hijos. Inicio haciendo los dulces y arreglos de fiesta para familiares que le pedían y actualmente las personas de las escuelas cercanas le hacen pedidos, lo que le ha permitido mejorar sus ingresos.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $300 que pagara en 5 meses para comprar material de trabajo ya que va a realizar algunos arreglos que le encargaron para el día de brujas.
texts.en:
Erika started her business to help her husband with family finances and to give her children a better quality of life. At that time, she needed to have a business that she could handle from her house, so she would not neglect her children. She started making sweets and party arrangements for relatives who asked her, and now people from nearby schools give her orders, which has permitted her to improve her income. She needs a loan of US $300, that she will repay in 5 months, to buy working supplies, since she will be creating some arrangements that have been ordered for Halloween.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy working supplies

loans.name: Ny

texts.en: Mrs. Ny T., 46, is a grocery seller who lives in Kompong Tom Province. She is running the business from her home and now is doing very well, so she has many regular clients. Ny has six children, four of whom are students, one is married and the other daughter is a teacher. Her husband, Mr. Seur Seng, 51, makes a living breeding pigs. Ny requested a loan of 500,000 riel ($125) to buy more groceries for resale and hopes that a loan will help to increase her income.

loans.use: To buy more groceries for resale

loans.name: Kha

texts.en: Mrs. Kha S. is 28 years old and lives Taing Chrey village in Kampong Cham province. She and her husband, Mr. Len Roeun, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice. Even though they work hard, they still do not earn enough money to support their family. Thus, Mrs. Kha S. decided to ask for a loan to buy ducklings and duck food to start a breeding business. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan after she sells the ducks. She has three children who are all staying at home. Her husband is presented with her in the picture.

loans.use: To buy ducklings and duck food to start a breeding business.

loans.name: Lubov

texts.en:
Lubov is a market entrepreneur from Kahovka, south of Ukraine. She sells clothing in the city market. Lubov has been in this business for 15 years. She was forced to find ways to survive and earn her living which is why she launched this business. 
Lubov is seeking a loan of $600 to increase capital. She is hoping to press on with her expansion plans and ultimately save enough to open a new vending facility in the future. We believe Lubov’s enterprising spirit will help her achieve all her goals and see her dreams come true.

loans.use: To increase capital

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret A., 25, is married with three children. All the kids are currently in school. She is a very resourceful and hard-working mother whose hard effort brings livelihood to the family. Margaret supports her kids through making and selling brooms. Selling brooms has a very big market share in Ghana. Brooms are made from palm branches, by first removing the leaves, leaving the tiny sticks on, and these are gathered to get bunches of brooms for sweeping. She says it is economically good to do that business and has been selling brooms for the past three years. She travels to nearby villages to buy the palm branches and prepares them for retail. She wants to use the loan to buy more palm branches to increase her inventory. She believes this loan would help her save for her children's future and also to rent a store to sell out of. 

Margaret belongs to a village bank called ‘Nyame yekese’ which means "God is bigger". She hopes to receive GHS 500 to make business progress by restocking her inventory. This would enable her to save more to help her husband in taking care of the children's educational needs.

loans.use: To buy increased numbers of palm branches for preparation of brooms

loans.name: Plaxeda Nakitto Group

texts.en:
Plaxeda is 37 years of age, and is married with four children between the age of 14 and 20. All of the children are at school. Plaxeda stays in a six room house with electricity but no piped water. She fetches her water from the well.
She has two meals a day and her greatest expense every month is food, school fees, and transportation to her workplace.

She sells matooke (bananas) in the market where she rents a room to store her bananas. She works four days a week and she receives about 50 customers a day. She sells both retail and wholesale. She has done this business for fifteen years now and the challenge she finds in her business is that at times she gets into accidents on the way from collecting her bananas from the village.

She has worked with MCDT for four years now and the reason why she chose to work with MCDT is because she wanted some capital to put in her business. She plans to construct a rental house to improve her income.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To increase stock.

loans.name: Eliana

texts.es: Eliana tiene 50 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Ella es propietaria de 2 motocarros, los que desde hace 5 años son fuente de ingresos económicos para su familia. Estas herramientas de trabajo son manejadas uno por su esposo y la otra por su hijo, quienes se dedican al transporte de pasajeros, y Eliana se encarga de la administración de las ganancias diarias, que lo que le gusta de este negocio, que puede ver los ingresos cada día.  Adicionalmente, Eliana se dedica a la venta de ropa de segundo uso, la que lleva a vender de casa en casa por los diferentes lugares de su zona. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque existe mucho compañerismo y hay responsabilidad en sus pagos, por lo que nombraron a su banco, “Trabajando Juntos”. Mil soles del dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la reparación y mantenimiento de sus motocarros, con el resto comprará más ropa de segundo uso para la venta.
texts.en:
Eliana is 50-years-old. She lives with her husband and her two children in their own home. She owns two motorcycle rickshaws, which for five years have been the source of income for her family. These vehicles are driven by her husband and her son, who transport passengers in them. Eliana is in charge of managing their daily profits. What she likes about this business is being able to see their income every day. Additionally, Eliana sells used clothing, which she takes from house to house to sell in different places in their area. This is her second loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She likes to work with her communal bank because there is a lot of camaraderie and responsibility to make their payments. This is why they named their bank, "Trabajando Juntos" (Working Together).
