One thousand soles of this money will be invested in repairing and maintenance of the motorcycle rickshaws. The rest will go towards purchasing more used clothing to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair her motorcycle rickshaws

loans.name: Dure

texts.en:
Dure A. currently sells onions, tomatoes and cooking oil and is requesting a loan to open up a shop. Dure is 32 years old, married, and has one child who doesn't go to school. Her husband is a driver. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rent

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open up a shop

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es: Agustina es una mujer D. 47 años muy trabajadora y decidida, vive en su propia casa junto a sus 2 hijas; Eva D. 17 y Paola D. 11 a quienes desea dar una mejor vida. Ella tiene un puesto D. venta D. ropa en el mercado Laykakota (mercado importante D. la ciudad D. Puno), el cual es muy concurrido por sus clientes, ya que siempre encuentran prendas novedosas, ella es una vendedora muy cortés, siempre recibe a las personas con una sonrisa en los labios. Lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y lo que más le gusta es vender, Agustina espera en el futuro tener una tienda más granD. donD. pueda vender una mayor cantidad D. ropa y pueda atender mejor a sus clientes, y unas D. las cosas que menos le gusta D. su trabajo es tener que permanecer todo el día dentro D. su puesto, sin poder salir a la calle, aun así ella quiere seguir para adelante y cumplir sus sueños. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo y está dispuesta a hacerlo, en su banco comunal es una socia muy respetada por la responsabilidad que demuestra. Con los 700 soles que solicita planea incrementar la mercadería que tiene en su puesto D. venta.
texts.en:
Agustina is a very determined and hardworking woman, 47 years old. She lives in her own house with her 2 daughters; Eva is 17 and Paola is 11. She wants to give them a better life. She has a clothing stand at the Laykakota market (a large market in Puno), which is very popular with her customers, who can always find new items.

Agustina is a very polite salesperson, she always greets customers with a smile. She has been doing this job for 20 years, and what she enjoys most is selling. She hopes to one day have a larger store where she can offer a greater quantity of clothes and better assist her customers. What she likes least about the job is having to stay at the stand all day, without being able to go outsiD.. However, she wants to continue her work to achieve her dreams.

This is her first loan from MFP. She knows that she has to make all of her payments on time, and she is dedicated to doing so. She is a respected member of her communal bank because of the responsibility she demonstrates. With the 700 soles that she is requesting she plans to increase the merchandise available at her stand.

Translated from Spanish by Kristen Beck, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en: Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 45-year-old Sophia A. from Mbeya. She is a widow with four children between the ages of 14 and 27. Sophia has been running a soap production business since 2006, making and selling soap. She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, six days per week and currently earns about $50 a month. Sophia is requesting a loan in order to purchase material in bulk for her soap production. In the future, she plans to open a new business. She thanks you for your support! ABOUT SELFINA: SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase material in bulk for her soap production

loans.name: Dionisia Eulalia

texts.es: Dionisia Eulalia B. Martínez tiene 48 años de edad, su estado civil es soltera. La actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 5 que se dedica a este negocio. Inicialmente comenzó su negocio asociándose a una compañía de maquillaje y productos femeninos, y fue así como logro apoderarse del mercado. Dionisia solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa interior, cosméticos, bisuterías, bolsos entre otras cosas. Su deseo es incrementar su negocio para darles a sus hijos un buen porvenir.
texts.en:
Dionisia Eulalia B. M. is 48 years-old and is not married. For the past 5 years, she has sold general merchandise, a venture which she got into doing sales for a make-up and feminine product manufacturer. This was how she was able to stake out a place in the marketplace. Dionisia is asking for a loan for the purchase of underwear, cosmetics, imitation jewelry, bags, etc. Her wish is to expand her business and give her children a good future.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Sebastiana

texts.en: Sebastiana G. is from the village of Sta. Felomina, Iligan City. She is 54 years old, married, and has six school-aged children. Sebastiana owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, primarily selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Sebastiana joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Santa Felomena, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Mercedes Del Socorro

texts.es: Mercedes del Socorro Ríos tiene la edad de 35 años. Es madre soltera. Tiene 2 hijos y estudian. Mercedes tiene un buen ánimo y espíritu de salir adelante esto fue lo que la motivo a dedicarse a ofrecer productos de medicinas naturales. Desde que inicio ha logrado acaparar la atención de sus clientes, pues algunas veces sus clientes recurren a su casa de habitación, solicitando consejos de los productos que ella ofrece, por lo que ella les dedica la atención personalizada que se merecen. Con este financiamiento comprara productos omnylife que es la casa comercial que distribuye estos productos. Sus sueños son de comprar su propia casa para que sus hijos tengan donde dormir el día de mañana.
texts.en:
Mercedes is 35 years old. She is a single mother with two sons in school.. Mercedes has a good mind and a forward-looking spirit which motivated her to sell natural medicines. Since beginning the business she has succeeded in grabbing the attention of her customers. Sometimes her customers come to the house she lives in asking for advice about the products she sells. She gives them the personalized attention they deserve.

With this financing she will buy Omnilife products from a commercial distributor. Her dream is to buy her own house so that her sons have somewhere to sleep in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anacorita

texts.en:
Anacorita S., 54 years old, is from the village of Kauswagan. She is married and has 3 adult children. Anacorita owns & operates a handicraft business selling general handicrafts to tourists and local community members. Anacorita has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2000, Anacorita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Anacorita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Anacorita is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP to be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be the 7th loan taken out by Anacorita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Milagros Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Milagros inicia su Cuarto ciclo con 22 socias. 
	
Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. cereales, ropa, abarrotes en general, cosméticos, verduras, comidas, cereales, pescado, animales menores.
	
Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 600 soles, 900 soles  haciendo un total D. 13,600 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. trigo, cebada, arroz, azúcar, leche, cosméticos, verduras y animales menores.

Los sueños D. las socias son ampliar sus negocios, tener local estable, casa propia y que sus hijos tengan una buena educación y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
The Milagros (Miracles) Communal Bank began its fourth cycle with 22 members. They engage in different retail businesses selling grain, clothing, groceries, cosmetics, vegetables, meats, and small animals.

The members need different loan amounts ranging from 300 soles, 600 soles, to 900 soles for a total of 13,600 soles to the entire Communal Bank.

Their loans will used to purchase wheat, barley, rice, sugar, milk, cosmetics, vegetables and small animals.

The members dream of expanding their businesses, having stable vending locations, owning their own homes, and educating their children so that they can become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wheat, barley, rice, sugar, milk, cosmetics, vegetables and small animals

loans.name: Neri

texts.es:
El señor Neri R. de 53 años está casado hace 28 años con la señora Edelia Cristaldo de 46 años de edad, el matrimonio cuenta con siete hijos de los cuales 6 siguen viviendo con sus padres, las dos últimas de los hijos de 15 y 17 años están estudiando, el primero está cursando el primer año del bachillerato en contabilidad y la otra sigue el bachillerato en salud y el anhelo de los padres es que estos hijos puedan terminar una carrera universitaria ya que los otros no tuvieron esa posibilidad.-
El Sr. Neri está en este negocio como vendedor ambulante hace 7 años, con un capital que pudo juntar de su  trabajo anterior porque trabajo mucho tiempo en una cervecería y de esa liquidación compró para su vehículo y más tarde empezó a dedicarse a la venta ambulante de mercaderías. 
Solicita este préstamo para compra de mercaderías como pinturas para cabellos, hilos, sombrillas, pinza para  cejas, maquillajes, portarretratos, reloj de pared, medias y ropas  interior para damas. 
 Así logrará aumentar su stock de mercaderías y ofrecer de esta forma variedad a sus clientes.

loans.use: Para la compra de pinturas para cabellos,compra de hilo, compra de sombrilla, compra de pinza para cejas, compra de maquillaje, compra de portaretratos, compra de reloj de pared, compra de media, etc.

loans.name: Pen

texts.en:
Pen Y. currently makes rattan furniture. She is 57 years old and a resident of Kompong Tom province, located about 200 km from the capital, Phnom Penh. She has five children: two are married and three are single. Pen Y. saves up over 10 sets of rattan and then sells them to her customers for profit. Usually, her valued clients need to order a few days or a week in advance. Her husband helps her transport the finished products directly to customers' houses.

Pen Y. is facing a problem with transportation because she doesn't have her own vehicle for her and her family's riding requirement. Thus, she would like a loan in order to buy a used motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy a used motorcycle

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi owns an education institute in Mukuru Kwa njenga slums in Nairobi. She has run this business successfully for the last four years alongside rental units and a scrap metal depot.  Naomi has requested a loan of Kes. 50,000 in order to buy more assets for smooth running of the school. Naomi hopes to give solution to the challenge of illiteracy by growing her young school into a fully fledged learning institution. She describes herself as hardworking and focussed.



About Faulu Kenya:
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Add assets

loans.name: Zoñith

texts.es: Zoñith es una mujer trabajadora y dinámica, vive en el caserío Señor D. los Milagros que se encuentra ubicado en el distrito D. Campo VerD. región D. Ucayali, tiene 57 años, es madre D. cuatro hijos mayores D. edad,  ella se dedica a la siembra D. arroz, frejol, plátanos, yuca y frutas, trabaja junto con su esposo en esta actividad. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mi Señor D. los Milagros” desD. hace un año, el primer crédito que recibió fue D. 500 soles que invirtió en la compra D. animales como, pollos, patos, carneros para criar y posteriormente  venderlos en la ciudad D. Pucallpa.  Actualmente ella necesita un crédito D. 1000 soles que será utilizado para comprar un motocarro D. segunda mano ya que le hace falta. La meta D. Zoñith es tener una tienda D. venta D. repuestos y lubricantes D. motos y motokar.
texts.en:
Zoñith is a hard-working, dynamic, 57-year-old, mother of 4 adult children. She lives in the Señor D. los Milagros hamlet which is in the Campo VerD. district, Ucayali region. She farms rice, beans, plantain, yucca and fruits. She works alongsiD. her husband. She has been a member of the “Mi Señor D. los Milagros” communal bank for the past year. Her first 500 sol loan was used to buy small farm animals like chickens, ducks, and lambs to raise and then sell in the city of Pucallpa. Currently, she needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy a used three-wheel motor van which she needs. Her goal is to have a store specializing in replacement parts and lubricants for motorcycles and three-wheel motor vans.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a used three-wheel motorvan.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana tiene 45 años, es una dama muy trabajadora, comparte su vida con su esposo Juan de 50 años, quien trabaja repartiendo dulces en diferentes  tiendas de la ciudad. Ellos tienen 4 hijos: Claudia de 26, Juan Alberto de 25, Luis de 22 y Carol de 13 años.

Desde hace 6 años se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza de una marca que se encuentra posicionada a nivel mundial; se inicia en este negocio motivada por una amiga y desde entonces han pasado muchos años, pero sigue teniendo el entusiasmo de al principio. Su actividad le es muy rentable porque no requiere de mucho tiempo y lo puede compartir con su trabajo de asistente en un consultorio dental que desempeña durante el día.
Pero en las noches y los fines de semana se dedica por entero a la venta de los productos de belleza, Juana es una mujer muy hacendosa y le gusta siempre verse bien, por eso le gusta también ofrecer estos productos, además le sobra poder de convencimiento para que sus asiduas clientes le compren los cosméticos. Pues ella aprendió mucho sobre ventas en los talleres que brinda esta compañía de belleza, además es una líder en su zona.

Este es el sétimo préstamo que tiene con MFP y promete ser muy puntual con cada pago, porque así manifiesta ser una persona responsable. Juana ya tiene pensado el destino del dinero que solicita, pues lo invertirá en comprar mercadería, es decir productos de belleza. También lo usará en la reparación del auto de su esposo con el que reparte los pasteles.
texts.en:
Juana is 45 years old and a hardworking woman. She shares her life with her husband Juan, who is 50 years old and works as a distributor of sweets to different shops in town. They have 4 children: Claudia (age 26), Juan Alberto (age 25), Luis (age 22), and Carol (age 13).

For 6 years, Juana has been selling beauty products from a well-known global brand. She was encouraged by a friend to start this business and continues to display the same level of enthusiasm that she had when she first began many years ago. Her business is very profitable because it does not require much of her time and she can continue her day job as a dental assistant. In the evenings and on the weekends, she devotes herself entirely to selling beauty products. Being an industrious woman who likes to look good, Juana is very credible when convincing her frequent customers to buy cosmetics. She has learned a great deal about sales in the workshops her company offers. As a result, she has become a leader in her district.

This is Juana’s seventh loan with MFP. She promises to be punctual with each payment because it demonstrates that she is a responsible person. With the funds that were requested, she will purchase more beauty products and use some of the money for repairs to her husband’s vehicle used for delivering pastries.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her inventory of beauty products & pay for repairs to her husband's delivery vehicle

loans.name: Aluwesa

texts.en:
Aluwesa J. is currently in the business of selling groundnut phaste (groundnuts crushed into liquid) and charcoal and is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of charcoal to sell. Aluwesa is 38 years old and married to a soldier. She has nine children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her family settlement.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Purchase more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Karegyeya Kyakusimire Resty Group

texts.en: K. Resty is the group representative. She has four children. Three of the children are going to school. She also looks after one dependent. She has been a farmer on her own for over 20 years. She is using the loan on her plantations. She is managing to pay school fees for her children. She is an ambitious businesswoman whose dream is to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer, seeds, pay wages, and so forth

loans.name: Lucina Miliana

texts.es:
La señora LUCINA MILIANA tiene 44 años, vive en el distrito de Trujillo, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal MUJERES AL ÉXITO II. La socia presenta estudios superiores de educación (incompletos), refiere que por falta de recursos económicos no pudo continuar estudiando. Es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos de los cuales 1 depende económicamente de ella. La socia se dedica a la crianza y venta de pollos vivos y por kilos. El primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles, lo utilizó para comprar pollos bebes y alimento balanceado al por mayor.
Con este crédito de 400.00 nuevos soles lo utilizará para comprar pollos, patos y alimento balanceado al por mayor. Ella sueña con tener una granja de pollos.
texts.en:
Miss LUCINA MILIANA is 44 years old, she lives in the Trujillo district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department – Perú. She belongs to the Communal Bank of MUJERES AL ÉXITO II (WOMEN TO SUCCESS). The partner presents incomplete higher education studies, she could not continue studying due to lack of economical resources. She is a single mother of two children, one of whom is still economically dependant. This member is dedicated to raising and selling chickens (both alive and by kilograms). She used her first credit of 300.00 new soles to purchase baby chickens and wholesale balanced chicken food. With this credit of 400.00 new soles she will purchasse chickens, ducks and wholesale balanced chicken and duck food. She dreams of having a chicken farm

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: PURCHASE CHICKEN, DUCKS AND WHOLESALE CHICKEN AND DUCK FOOD

loans.name: Loveth

texts.en:
Loveth is still single and lives in Delta State. She sells groceries and foodstuffs which she buys from other distributors and returns home to sell. She has been in business for the past four years and uses the proceeds of her business for savings and also to take care of herself. 

With the aim of improving her business, Loveth needs the loan of N150,000 to purchase more groceries and foodstuffs to sell. This will help to improve her finances. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Satou

texts.fr: Satou F. est âgée de 43 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 10 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de PALENE et y a bénéficié de 10 prêts qu'elle a bien gérés et remboursés. Elle fait de l'embouche bovine et les revenus générés par son activité lui permet de participer à la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
Satou F. is 43 years old, married and mother of ten children. She is a member of the ‘Banc Villageois’ loan group of PALENE, and was granted ten loans that were used well and reimbursed. She fattens cattle for a living, and the income generated by this activity allows her to participate in supporting family expenses.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Reinforce and develop her activity

loans.name: Sen

texts.en: S. is 42 years of age and currently lives with other family members who include her elderly mother, daughters, and a son-in-law. She was married, but divorced her husband when her kids were young. To earn a living, S. sells poultry that she slaughters herself. Also, she buys chickens and ducks in bulk at reasonable prices from rural people and raises them in her home for a while. S. has an old small house which is frequently in need of repairs and this affects her daily life. Therefore, she is seeking a loan through Kiva partner HKL to be used to decorate and repair her existing house.

loans.use: To decorate and repair her existing house.

loans.name: Afouchata

texts.fr:
Née le 31 Août 1987  à Sikasso, Afouchata B.est une femme mariée et mère de 2 enfants qui  réside avec son époux et leurs enfants dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie à Bougoula Ville, Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Après mener beaucoup d’activités sans succès, Afouchata s’est initiée  aux activités d’achat et de vente de pagnes et d’encens  il y a environ 7 ans. Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a deux ans. Après un prêt solidaire (prêt du groupe) dans une association des femmes de son quartier, elle est à son premier prêt individuel. 
Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt, 2 balles de pagnes et des sacs d'encens.                                                                                                Elle s’approvisionne à Bobo Dioulasso (Burkina Faso) ensuite elle les revend de façon ambulante, en détail au comptant et à crédit, dans les différents quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 75 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Afouchata B.was born on August 31, 1987 in Sikasso. She is married and the mother of two children. She lives with her husband and their children in a large traditional extended family in Bougoula Town, Sikasso (Third administrative region of the Republic of Mali) After having unsuccessfully tried a lot of activities, seven years ago Afouchata trained herself in the business of trading incense and pagnes [bright colorful West African cloth]. With the objective to better meet the needs of her ever increasing customers, two years ago she joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. After a group loan in a women’s association of her neighborhood, this is her first individual loan. With this loan she is planning to buy to two bales of pagnes and bags of incense. She gets her supplies in Bobo Dioulasso (Burkina Faso). She then retails them as an itinerant vendor, for cash or credit in the different neighborhoods of Sikasso town to customers who are mostly women. With this loan, she is planning to make a monthly profit of 75, 000 Francs CFA that will be used mostly to increase her working capital, contribute to the family’s expenses, pay her loan and invest the rest in her activity.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various items

loans.name: Vaqif

texts.en: Vaqif K., 42, has a veterinary drug store in a small village near Agsu. He is married and has three children, who are the meaning of his life. His drug store is very popular in his village because most of the local people are involved in livestock breeding. Vaqif says the most popular products are vaccines for cows and sheep. He applied for a loan of 1600 AZN because he would like to expand his business.

loans.use: purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Soth

texts.en:
Soth P., age 24, is married and resides with her children in Takeo province, Cambodia. She has two children. She and her husband are engaged in a business buying rice for resale, earning an income of USD 5 each per day to help cover the family expenses. They also raise pigs at home for another source of income as well. Their standard of living has improved since P. and her husband have had this business. 

P. is requesting a loan of 800 USD to purchase a new motorbike with a trailer attached to transport the rice to sell at the market. This is her first loan from CREDIT, partnered with Kiva.

loans.use: buy a new motorbike to transport rice for sale

loans.name: Teresita Parmisana Group

texts.en:
Teresita P. is from the village of Macabayao, Jimenez Mis. Occ.. She is 42 years old. Teresita is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Teresita P. Group.

Teresita is married and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Teresita owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 3,600 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Teresita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase baby livestock to raise and then sell in the future. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Teresita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house. 

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies.

loans.name: Nicolau Azarias

texts.pt:
Nicolau Azarias Dgedge nasceu no Distrito de Chibuto, Província de Gaza, sul de Moçambique tem 47 anos de idade, casado e pai de 5 filhos de 18, 15, 09, 05 anos de idade e o ultimo com 2 meses de idade, os três mais velhos vão a escola. Fez somente 8ą classe não continuou porque foi incorporado para o serviço militar obrigatório. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Saiu de Chibuto para Boane a procura de melhores condições de vida. Tem um negócio próprio ha mais de 5 anos, possui três empregados que lhe auxiliam no seu negócio e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 7.000.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigos que já são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 25.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção para revenda (chapas de zinco, cimento, pedra e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para poder desenvolver o seu negócio.
texts.en:
Nicolau Azarias was born in the Chibuto District, in the Gaza Province, in South Mozambique. He is 47 years old, married and the father of 5 children who are 18, 15, 9 and 5 years old and the youngest is 2 months old. The oldest three children go to school. He only went to school until the 8th grade and didn't because he was drafted for mandatory military service. He lives with his family in his own house and doesn't support anyone else. He left Chibuto to go to Boane looking for a better life. He has had his own business for more than 5 years and has 3 employees who help him. He has an income of around 7.000.00mt per month, which goes towards household expenses and he still manages to save some money in his savings account. He has never requested loans with other banks. He came to know Hluvuku through friends who were already partners of the institution. This loan, in the amount of 25.000.00mt, is his first and he intends to buy building materials for resale (zinc screens, cement, stone and others) in order to increase his inventory. He is committed to paying this loan on time in order to be able to request other loans. In the future, he would like to request more loans to develop his business.

Translated from Portuguese by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of zinc screens, cement, stone and others

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
After having been through many problems in life, 40-year-old Evangeline S. has remained strong and tough to face more challenges to achieve her goal of bringing her family out of the shadow of poverty. Loans that she has taken out through her membership in ASHI have equipped her to have her own business and income to augment the small and sporadic earnings of her husband who works as a laborer. Eventually, Evangeline’s small “sari-sari” (variety) store has grown and has been able to acquire more customers from their neighborhood and even from other villages. Sari-sari means that various foodstuffs, beverages and an assortment of grocery items are sold in a small open room of their house. 

Evangeline is currently happy with the achievements of her business. However, its proceeds are still too small for her to set up a savings fund since almost everything her family needs for food, clothing, etc. are provided through this. Therefore, Evangeline is requesting a much larger loan so she can increase the inventory of her store and sustain its operation despite providing credit to her customers. Soon all four of her children will be in school with her eldest in college and her second eldest in high school. Through her business's profit, Evangeline hopes to support her children until they earn their own degree in college and have a better future.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs, beverages and grocery items to sell

loans.name: Rael

texts.en: Rael is a 60 year old farmer. She is married to an accountant and she is blessed with three children. She has been farming for ten years and has one employee. She uses her income to provide for the family, including educating her two children who are in school. She is in Kyeni Ngeleni group, in Faulu Kenya, where she saves part of her income on a weekly basis. She has requested for a loan of KES15,000 to buy animal feeds. She hopes to improve her living standards in the future.

loans.use: To buy animal feed.

loans.name: Arnulfo

texts.en:
Arnulfo S. M. is a 56-year-old pepper farmer and father of five who lives in the region of Coquital de Los Chiles de San Carlos, located in Northern Costa Rica. The rural zone where Arnulfo and his family live is one of the few places in Costa Rica without running water; the family must pump water from a nearby well as needed. Arnulfo is working hard towards the sustenance of his family, striving to reap the maximum benefits from his land and his labour.

Arnulfo is a dedicated farmer and father. He plans to focus his efforts on the planting and harvest of tabasco and cayenne peppers. He works in cooperation with his wife to strike a balance between accomplishing the daily tasks associated with agricultural production and the completion of domestic responsibilities. The land they work is their own. In addition to his agricultural activity, Arnulfo works at a local orange-processing factory as a harvesting laborer in order to supplement his family income. The money he earns helps pay bills for electricity and food.

Although this is an individual loan, the community in which Arnulfo and his family live is very close-knit and interdependent. Neighbors help and support one another by sharing experiences and expertise acquired over the years. All members of the Coquital community are dedicated to the improvement of living conditions for the region as a whole.

This loan will be used to finance the production of tabasco and cayenne peppers. Specifically, the loan will be used to finance the purchase of a variety of seedlings and necessary agricultural nutrients, fertilizers and chemicals in order to ensure a healthy harvest. All labor and logistical tasks associated with production will be carried out by Arnulfo with the help of his family members. Arnulfo will need roughly one year before his peppers reach maturity and are ready for harvest.

Piper and Capiscum Processors Compañía Agrícola Industrial, or PROPICA, is an international buyer and seller of chili pepper and ground pepper products. In cooperation with Fundación Mujer, PROPICA has guaranteed to purchase the agricultural products (the peppers) that are to be produced with the help of this loan. PROPICA acts as a guaranteed client for small agricultural producers in the area of Coquital, thus ensuring that their products will reach market.

In general, the work day is divided into mornings and afternoons. In the mornings, the domestic tasks are carried out such as cooking, cleaning and sending the children to school. Afternoons are generally dedicated to harvesting, planting, and working the land as needed. Arnulfo spends some days working as a laborer in the nearby orange-processing factory, but this work is sporadic.

Arnulfo says the main factor that has stood in the way of increasing his production levels has been the Costa Rican government and various other institutions. Formal banks, lending agencies and government bodies have failed to recognize the producers of the Coquital region as legitimate producers, worthy of financial and governmental support and services.

The collaboration of Fundación Mujer and PROPICA represents a unique opportunity to Arnulfo, his family and his community. By offering a source of start-up capital and a guaranteed client to purchase what is produced, this is a chance to improve family and community standards of living. Above all, Arnulfo wants to take advantage of the current opportunity that has been presented; he wants to profit from this collaboration and see improvements in his neighborhood.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and nutrients necessary for the production of peppers

loans.name: Norma Eulogia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORICHUSPA”; La socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco, del departamento de Cusco.
	
La  socia es la Sra. Norma; ella tiene 51 años de edad y La socia es casada y tiene 2 hijos estudiantes en la etapa superior; La socia es docente de inicial (jardín de niños) de profesión, La socia goza de un carácter muy agradable, ella trabaja en un jardín de niños y disfruta mucho de ellos, es una mujer muy querendona y con mucho amor a los niños, por lo que sigue enseñando en este su propio jardín, La socia cada cierto tiempo renueva y está implementando su jardín con materiales de estudio y otros. Ella también realiza en su propia casa materiales de educación bastantes didácticos para la venta a otros centros de formación inicial, ella realiza diversos tipos de trabajos entre los que está los sellos con dibujos dinámicos y otros materiales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar en la ciudad de Lima materiales para realizar útiles educativos dinámicos para formación inicial.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “Qorichuspa” communal bank. She lives in the Huanchac district, in the the province of Cusco, in the department of Cusco. The member is Norma. She is 51 years old. She is married and has 2 children who are in high school. She is a kindergarten teacher by profession. She has a very agreeable character. She works in a kindergarten and really enjoys it. She is a very affectionate person and has a lot of love for the children, which is why she teaches in her own kindergarten. Every so often she makes some changes and uses new study materials and other items in her kindergarten. She also creates her own educational materials, which are very instructive, for sale to other kindergartens. She makes a variety of materials, among which are stamps with dynamic drawings and other materials. Norma is requesting the loan to buy materials in Lima for making educational materials for kindergarten. She values and is infinitely grateful for the loan she has been granted because it will allow her to grow with her business and improve her quality of life. She promises to make her payments within the stipulated timeframe.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials for making education materials for sale

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco V. is from the village of Sta. Cruz. He is 55 years old. Francisco is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Francisco owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Francisco has been engaged in his business for over 30 years and earns approximately 30,000 PHP per harvest.

In 2010, Francisco joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Francisco is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Francisco from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Makongo Kk Group

texts.en:
Janeth D., aged 35, is married with two sons, 14 and 10.  She has been selling vitenge (fabrics) for 5 years.  She works from 9 am to 1 pm and she is able to make a monthly profit of about $33. This will be Janeth’s fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy ulezi (brown wheat) to make  porridge and started selling vitenge.  She sells from door to door and is really doing fine and has managed to pay back the loans successfully.  She hopes for a new loan to buy vitenge and bed sheets. Janeth’s dream is to buy a car and transport her products to more customers

Janeth will share this loan with her loan group, Makongo KK, which totals 16 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan. In the picture Janeth is  wearing a kitenge in the front row.

loans.use: To buy more fabrics and bedsheets to sell

loans.name: Legaspi

texts.en:
Legaspi A. is from the village of Salay in the municipality of Angadanan in Isabela Province. He is 30 years old. Legaspi is married and has one infant-age child. To make a living, Legaspi owns and operates a transportation business. The main source of income for the business comes from motorcycle transport. Legaspi has been engaged in his business for over 7 years, and he earns approximately 2800 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Legaspi joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Legaspi has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. Legaspi is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to repair another transport vehicle used in his business. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Legaspi from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family.

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Rina

texts.en:
Rina B. is from the village of Andarayan South, Solana, Cagayan. She is 28 years old. Rina is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Rina owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling different kinds of vegetables in the local community. Rina is just starting this business.

Rina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rina has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. Rina is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Rina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Amie

texts.en:
Amie V. is a 38-year old married woman who supports her family by operating as a Fish Dealer and Retailer. She lives in Brgy. 2, Sipalay City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her Fish Dealer and Retailer business, she is gradually making her family economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 8000 PHP.

Amie is borrowing 10000 PHP so she can purchase more bulk fish stock for sale. This will be her 10th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 25000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Amie aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: purchase bulk fish stocks for sale

loans.name: Emeline

texts.en:
Emeline A. is a married woman who lives in Hda. Milagrosa, Barangay 1-A, Manapla, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures: dried fish vending and pig fattening. Her husband Segundo, 43 years old, works as a laborer to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have 4 children who are 6 to 14 years old. Emeline joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1994 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 14 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Emeline has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 7,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 15th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000 which she intends to use to buy more piglets so that she could continue to save up for the future education of her children. Emeline A. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Fund Operations

loans.name: Perfecta

texts.en:
Perfecta E. is a married woman who lives in Camp Valdez, Brgy. Mambaroto, Sipalay City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  Tobacco vending and vegetable vending businesses. Her husband Mamerto E., who is 56 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have ten children between 15 and  36 years old. 

Perfecta joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1998 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 13 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Perfecta has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 5000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 14th loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000, which she intends to use as additional capital for tobacco vending so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. 

Perfecta E. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Fund the operations of tobacco sales

loans.name: Maria Jesusa

texts.es:
Maria Jesusa; tiene 54 años,   vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco, Perú y desD. hace mucho tiempo que participa en el banco comunal “Patrón D. San Sebastián” D. la Unidad D. Micro finanzas Arariwa. Maria Jesusa tiene 4 hijos y se considera una madre trabajadora y emprendedora, ella es ama D. casa y se dedica al cuidado D. su nieto. 

Maria Jesusa con su próximo préstamo que espera recibir D. $ 300 USD, ella invertirá el dinero para comprar tejas para cercar el muro D. la pared D. su terreno pues se están acercando la temporada D. lluvias en la ciudad del Cusco. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Maria Jesusa is 54 years old, and she lives in the beautiful city of Cusco, Peru.  She has been a member for some time with the communal bank "Patron D. San Sebastian" with Arariwa microfinance.  Maria Jesusa has 4 children and considers herself hard-working and entrepreneurial; she is also a housewife and cares for her grandson.

Maria Jesusa hopes to receive her $300 USD loan to purchase tiling to enclose a wall on her property; rain season in Cusco is approaching.

As a member she finds herself appreciative of the opportunity offered through this medium, therefore she comits to making her payments on schedule.

loans.use: Purchase tiling

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more palm oil, rice, and ground nuts.

loans.name: Josephine Andiah

texts.en:
Josephine Andiah is a 56-year-old ambitious and hardworking mother of three children. She is married to Jackson, a church official. Their two children are aged between 18 and 14 years old and are in secondary school.

Josephine operates a tailoring business in Igunga Shopping Center in the county of Vihiga. She designs clothing for all genders and the business is doing well. She earns a monthly profit of KES 27,000 and the sky is the limit for her. She is taking out a loan of KES 80,000, which she will use to buy tailoring material and a sewing machine. Demand for clothing is high as the festive season approaches since parents will be buying new clothing for their children.  Therefore Josephine anticipates making a profit. She will use the profits to repay her loan and to support her family by providing for their basic needs. Her long term project is to one day own a tailoring shop.

loans.use: to buy tailoring material and a sewing machine

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a married woman with one child who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and rent bills.

She has operated a natural soft drinks sales business for the past two years, selling in a shop to her neighbours and passersby. Joyce faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to build her own house in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase a deep freezer for storing soft drinks. She decided to join Yehu because of its good reputation in society.

loans.use: To purchase a deep freezer for storing soft drinks

loans.name: Fausto Homero

texts.es:
Fausto Homero O. B. tiene 42 años de edad el soltero vive solo en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar. No tiene hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNION SAN ANTONIO, Recinto San Antonio parroquia San José del Tambo distancia de la oficina a 150 minutos de la comunidad se encuentra dentro de los límites del Cantón Chillanes. Esta Ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, cacao, naranja yuca. Esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Fausto Homero se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, cacao, naranja, yuca. Compra sus productos en el Comercial  Matilde Esther y vende los  productos en Bucay.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz, cacao, naranja yuca. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener una vivienda propia.

Le gusta practicar el deporte.
texts.en:
Fausto Homero O. B., aged 42, is single and lives alone in the canton of Chillanes in the province of Bolívar. He has no children.

He belongs to a group of members of the rural branch of the communal bank "Unión San Antonio" in the neighborhood of San Antonio in the parish of San José del Tambo, located 150 minutes from the head office of the communal bank. This branch is specialized in short-term agricultural loans, mainly to finance corn, cacao, orange and cassava crops. They have been in this activity for a long time.

Fausto Homero is a farmer. He grows corn, cacao, oranges and cassava. He buys his supplies in the Matilde Esther Shopping Center and sells his products in Bucay.

He applies for the loan to buy farm consumables and fertilizer for his corn, cacao, orange and cassava crops. The loan will help him to pay for needed supplies. The challenges he faces are the plagues of insects and rats, the diseases and the variable weather. He dreams to live in his own dwelling.

He likes sport.

loans.use: To buy farm consumables and fertilizer

loans.name: Maria Rosario

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer trabajadora que ha hecho lo posible para que sus tres hijos tengan lo que necesitan ya que es madre soltera ella comenzó a vender cosas y juguetes para ser una comerciante informal. 

Viviendo en una zona urbana a estado trabajando como comerciante informal. Vende ropa, bisutería, juguetes de todo tipo etc. Recorre las calles en la mañana y también le vende a sus vecinos y conocidos las mercadería que vende. Tiene muchas aspiraciones para tener su propio local pero aun no ha tenido la oportunidad de concretar su meta por eso trabaja con dedicación. 

Por ahora con el préstamo quiere comprar juguetes, ropa para diversificar su mercadería. En el futuro quiere tener un local bien construido.
texts.en:
Maria is a hardworking woman who has made it possible for her three children to have what they need. Because she is a single mother, she started selling things and toys in order to be an informal merchant.

She is living in an urban area working as an informal merchant. She sells clothes, costume jewelry, all types of toys, etc. She sells on the street in the morning and also sells her merchandise to her neighbors and acquaintances. She has many aspirations to have her own store, but so far she has not had the opportunity to meet her goal, so she works with dedication.

For now, with this loan she wants to buy toys and clothes to diversify her merchandise. In the future she wants to have a nice store.

loans.use: Toys, clothes

loans.name: Leo Group

texts.es:
Esta unidad de desarollo (UDE) se llama Leo porque son fuertes y 
luchadores como un leon. Las UDEs son grupos de mas de 10 personas que tienen
una cuenta de banco y tienen que reunirse semanalmente o quincenalmente para
realizar sus pagos. Tiene un representante y un comite que lo gobierna. Este grupo 
esta ubicado en la comunidad de Tezonapa en el estado de VeraC.. Este grupo esta conformado
por diez integrantes.

El representante del grupo se llama Eloisa C. S. que tiene la edad de 45 años,
 estudio solo la primaria, es viuda y tiene una pequeña hija de nombre Lesli Alexandra de 10 años de edad 
que esta cursando el quinto grado de primaria. Doña Elo como la conocen en su comunidad desde hace 
mas de 31 años se dedica a la costura, ella confecciona ropa para dama y caballero, nos dice que en septiembre y 
noviembre es cuando mas trabajo tiene ya que sus clienta mandan a hacer con ella los uniformes escolares de sus hijos
tambien nos  dice que cuando es la fiesta del pueblo cose los trajes para los bailarines de las comparsas, tambien
nos platica que ella con los años aprendio a reparar y darle mantenimiento a sus maquinas de coser y ahora sus 
amigas y conocidas la buscan para que les repare sus maquinas y se gana un dinerito extra. Ella necesita este credito 
para invertirlo en la compra de una nueva maquina, agujas, hilos, cintametrica, ganchos, reglas, telas, encajes, listones,botones
 y cierrres. Ella espera que con esta inversion su negocio prospere ya que desea darle a Lesli una mejor calidad
de vida y espera que en un futuro su hija pueda tener una profesion.

Fabiola Elvira R. O. es parte del comite de este grupo. Ella tiene treinta años de edad, estudio hasta
la preparatoria y es Tecnico en alimentos, es madre soltera de un pequeño niño de 9 años de nombre Julio Fernando
Fabi como la llaman sus amigos nos platica que hace mas de 5 años vende junto a su mama cominida corrida en su casa,
algunas veces hace tamales o chiles rellenos los cuales vende casa por casa, fabi nos dice que algunas veces levanta pedidos
pero otras las personas van a buscar su comida ya que ya saben que vende todos los dias, ella tambien pone lonche a algunos trabajadores o 
les da de almorsar, sus vecinos nos comentan que ellas cocinan muy sabroso. Fabi necesita este prestamo para invertirlo en la compra 
de insumos (arroz, frijol, aceite, tomates, sal, azucar, cebolla, cafe, chiles, especies, maiz, huevos,carne, gas y desechables).
ella espera que este credito le de la oportunidad de creser y le deje buenas ganancias ya que en un futuro espera tener un 
pequeño local en el poner una pequeña fondita, tabien desea darle una mejor calidad a su hijo.

los otros 8 integrantes se llaman:

Irma L. G. - venta de ropa
Demian A. T. - transporte (taxi)
Marlen C. S. - pollos azados
Magdalena R. M.- abarrotes
Martina O. V.- deposito de refrescos
Elia O. V. . cosina economica
Vianey Natalia R. V.- venta de zapatos
Diodora B. G. - cosina economica
texts.en:
This development unit (UDE) is called Leo because they are strong and fighters like lions.  UDEs are groups of 10 or more people who have a bank account and have to meet weekly or bi-weekly to make their payments.  They have a representative and a governing committee.  This group is located in the community of Tezonapa in the state of VeraC..  It has 10 members. 

The group's representative is Eloisa C. S..  She is 45 years old and only attended elementary school.  She is widowed and has a small daughter named Lesli Alexandra who is 10 years old and in the 5th grade.  Doña Elo, as she is called in her community, has worked as a seamstress for more than 31 years.  She makes clothing for men and women. She tells us that she has the most work in September and November when her customers order school uniforms for their children.  She also tells us that for her town's festival, she sews costumes for the dancers in the "comparsa" (parade). Over the years she has also learned to repair and perform maintenance on her sewing machines and now her friends and acquaintances seek her out to repair their machines, so she earns a little extra money.  She needs this loan to invest in a new sewing machine, needles, thread, measuring tape, hooks, rulers, fabrics, lace, ribbons, buttons, and fasteners. She hopes that with this investment her business will prosper so she can give Lesli a better quality of life, and she hopes that in the future her daughter will have a profession.

Fabiola Elvira R. O. is part of the governing committee of this group.  She is 30 years old and completed her education through high school. She has a technical degree in nutrition.  She is a single mother of a 9 year old son named Julio Fernando.  Fabi, as she is called by her friends, tells us that for the past 5 years she and her mother have sold quick meals out of their home.  Sometimes they also make tamales or chiles rellenos (stuffed peppers) to sell door to door.  Fabi tells us that sometimes they take orders but other times people just show up for food since they know Fabi and her mother sell it every day. They also prepare lunches for workers.  Their neighbors comment that their food is very tasty.    

Fabi needs this loan to purchase ingredients (rice, beans, oil, tomatoes, salt, sugar, onion, coffee, peppers, spices, corn, eggs, meat, cooking gas, and disposable tableware. She hopes that this loan gives her the opportunity to grow and provides good income, as she would like to have a place to open a small restaurant in the future.  She also wants to provide her son with a better quality of life.

The other 8 members of the group are:

Irma L. G. - clothing sales
Demian A. T. - transportation (taxi)
Marlen C. S. - roasted chicken
Magdalena R. M.- groceries
Martina O. V.- drink stand
Elia O. V. - low cost meals
Vianey Natalia R. V.- shoe sales
Diodora B. G. - low cost meals

loans.use: chicken sales, prepared meals, dressmaking, taxi

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 27 years old, married, and has a 2-month-old son. She is currently in her fourth loan cycle with FINCA. She sells clothing and cosmetics, and is a cosmetologist. 

Lourdes will be using her loan of 2,500 nuevos soles to buy cosmetic products and school uniforms to sell before the school season begins in March. She also plans to buy some wood for her husband's construction business. 

Lourdes hopes to expand her business and save money for her son and future children and to buy land in Ayacucho.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics and clothing to resell

loans.name: Ke

texts.en: Ke T. is a 34-year-old married woman who lives in the province of Kompong Tom. She and her husband are both employed as local workers at the rubber plantation. The couple usually generates an average income of $7.50 per day for the family’s needs. They currently face a problem with their living conditions because their house is getting old and it isn't high enough off the ground. Ke T. is requesting a loan to raise the framework of the house and to buy fill to place under the house.

loans.use: to raise the framework of the house and to buy fill

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen W. is from the town of San Mariano, Isabela. She is 27 years old and single. To make a living, Karen owns and operates a clothing business.  Karen has been engaged in her business for more than 3 years and earns approximately 7500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Karen joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase additional fabric and materials. Karen is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business by purchasing more clothes to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Karen from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: William

texts.en: William is a 48-year-old married man who lives in his own house in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He trades in cattle and has been in business for five years. He smiles on his decision to take up this business. His desire is to educate his children and own a ranch. William would like a loan to buy cattle for resale.

loans.use: to buy cattle for resale

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina R. is from the village of Dela Paz, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 72 years old. Regina is widowed and has nine adult-aged children. To make a living, she operates a family member's business, raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately $233 a month for these activities.

In 2004, Regina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan  from GDMPC. 

Regina is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed. This will be her 24th loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed

loans.name: La Amistad Group

texts.es:
Amelia es una D. las siete integrantes D. L. Nueva Alcancia Comunal “L. AMISTAD”, es casada y resiD. en L. zona D. Matucana. Su negocio no tiene un nombre especifico pues se inicio hace 5 anos vendiendo gelatinas y con L. idea D. obtener mayores ganancias se compro un carrito sanguchero en donD. dia a dia apoya a su esposo con los gastos D. servicios como luz y agua. Junto a  su esposo han logrado adquirir un mototaxi por lo cual tienen otros ingresos para su familia. Amelia invertira el credito en L. compra D. gaseosas y golosinas para vender conjuntamente con las hamburguesas  y frituras que ofrece a sus comenzales.
Amelia nos cuenta que anheL. terminar construir su casa e inagurar una gran bodega D. venta D. productos D. primera necesidad. L. Alcancia Comunal “ L. Amistad” agradece L. confianza puesta en ellos y sus negocios y estan comprometidos ha trabajar con el programa Prosperidad.
texts.en:
Amelia is one of the seven members of the communal bank “L. AMISTAD”; she is married and lives in the Matucana area. Her business does not have a specific name -- she started five years ago selling jelly at first and then, in order to increase her income, purchased a "carrito sanguchero" (a mobile kitchen-cart for preparing fried food) where she now works day in and day out so that she could support her husband in meeting household expenses such as water and electricity bills. 

Together, Amelia and her husband were able to save and buy a mototaxi (a motorcycle with a tricycle-like attachment for transporting passengers), so now they have an additional source of income for the family. Amelia will use the loan to purchase sweets and soft drinks that she will sell alongsiD. hamburgers and fried dishes that she offers to her customers.

Amelia would also like to finish building her house and put up a convenience store with a wiD. range of basic necessity products. The communal bank "L. Amistad" appreciates the trust that is placed in them and their businesses and are committed to continue working with the Prosperidad (prosperity) program.

loans.use: to purchase sweets and soft drinks for resale

loans.name: Soutra Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Soutra, composé de veuve et de femmes mariées, ont en moyenne 51 ans, 7 enfants et vivent dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Gnanbourouthila, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments alimentaires et de charbon de bois.                                                                                                                          
Les femmes du groupe Soutra sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter des condiments et du charbon.                                                                          
BAHMALICK T. compte acheter des condiments avec les revendeuses de la ville de Dioïla, pour ensuite vendre sur place au village, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 40 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce de condiments.
texts.en:
The group Soutra is composed of widows and married women. They average 51 years of age and seven children each living in traditional extended families in the village of Gnanbourouthila, prefecture of Dioïla, Region of Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  The women know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. And they do commerce in condiments and charcoal. The group members are on their third solidarity loan, which will be used to buy condiments and charcoal.

Ms. BAHMALICK T. intends to use her loan to buy condiments from retailers in the city of Dioïla. Accepting cash or credit, she will sell the goods locally in the village to a customer base composed of women and men.  

She envisions making an average monthly profit of 40,000 francs CFA that will be used to make the loan payments and to help cover the costs of societal ceremonies. The rest of the profits will be reinvested in her condiments business.

loans.use: to buy condiments

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CAMINEMOS JUNTAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Zenaida; ella tiene 34 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de artesanía, ella tiene una tienda de artesanía donde vende chompas, chalinas y muñecas, ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6.00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de artesanía. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar implementar su tienda de artesanía y comprar artesanía al por mayor.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Zenaida is a member of the "Caminemos Juntas" community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

Zenaida is 34 years old, lives with her partner, and has three children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling handicrafts.  She owns a handicraft store where she sells sweaters, scarves and dolls.  She works from 8.00am to 6.00pm.  Through this business, she gets her children ahead in life.  Zenaida would like to expand her business selling handicrafts.  She is requesting this loan to stock her handicraft store and buy handicrafts wholesale.

Zenaida is happy to be receiving her loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to stock her handicraft store and to buy handicrafts wholesale

loans.name: Mariana Cecilia

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Las Exitosas  se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi , conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Mariana tiene años 33 años  de edad, es madre soltera de  un hijo de nueve años de edad que estudian en escuela. Hace varios años ella aprendió corte y confección en una academia en Montecristi.  Vive en casa de sus padres. Lleva tres ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos.

Tiene un pequeño taller de costura donde desde hace muchos años se dedica a coser, ella confecciona  ropa deportiva, trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares que llegan hasta su taller. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 22h00 y a veces hasta más tarde cuando tiene pedidos que entregar, nos cuenta que lleva cuatro años que se dedica a esta actividad y que le gusta lo que hace ya que además de ganarse la vida honradamente también está  al tanto del cuidado de su hijo.

Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar telas, hilos, botones, cierres  y otros materiales para la costura.
 
Su sueño es que nunca le falte trabajo.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Las Exitosas” (The Successful Ones) meets every 15 days in the canton of Montecristi, which is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its handicrafts that have received attention on a national and international level. This place is where the famous Panama hats are made.

It is here that one can meet Sra. Mariana. She is 33 years old and a single mother with a nine-year-old son who is in school. Mariana learned sewing and dressmaking several years ago at a school in Montecristi. She lives at the home of her parents. Mariana has been with the Communal Bank for three loan cycles and enjoys the assistance the loans have given her.

She has a small workshop where she has been sewing for many years. Mariana makes sportswear and works based on orders from customers who come to her establishment. She works every day from 6am to 10pm, and sometimes much later when she has orders to deliver. Mariana says that she has been in business for four years. She also likes the fact that she is able to earn an honest living so that she can take care of her son.

This new loan will be used to buy fabrics, thread, buttons, zippers, and other sewing materials. Her dream is to always have work to do.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics, thread, buttons, zippers, and other sewing materials.

loans.name: Nazia's Group

texts.en:
Nazia is very supportive lady by nature. In order to financially assist her husband, she does embroidery and prepares embroidered dresses. She also performs her daily household work very efficiently and tries to give comfort to her family by fulfilling their needs. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who is a wagon driver and provides transport services to his passengers.  His wagon needs repair work to run smoothly. With the loan, he will repair its body so that the passengers feel comfortable to get service from him. 

He has been operating his transport business for the past eight years and Nazia is confident that an investment will help him save his business asset and improve his business conditions. She is the mother of six children. All of them are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. Nazia is hopeful that after the loan investment, her husband will be able to run his business better and increase his profit.
