She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Nazia.

loans.use: To repair a wagon.

loans.name: Lidia Martha

texts.es:
Lidia nació en la ciudad de Puno (Perú) y tiene 49 años de edad. Actualmente, Lidia  vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco (Perú). Lidia tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio. Ella vende a sus vecinos diferentes productos de primera necesidad como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos y otras cosas más. Ya son 15 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad Lidia  requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo arroz, fideos, azúcar, tarros de leche, avena, gelatina, harina y otras cosas más. 

La socia es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Mosoq Allpa” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Lidia was born in the city of Puno (Peru) and is 49 years old.  She currently lives in the beautiful city of Cusco (Peru).  Lidia has a small grocery store in her home.  She sells different basic household products to her neighbors such as rice, sugar, noodles, etc.  She has been in this business for 15 years and is doing very well thanks to the effort that she puts into her work.

On this occasion, Lidia needs the loan to buy merchandise such as rice, noodles, sugar, jars of milk, oats, gelatin, flour, etc.  

Lidia is a responsible and hard-working person who, owing to these personal qualities, was invited by her friends to join Asociación Arariwa's "Mosoq Allpa" community bank.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Kassem

texts.en:
Kassem is a 41 year-old married man and father of three children.  He works as car mechanic and opened his garage in 1987.  Kassem works hard to improve his business and keeps his garage supplied with everything this business might need.

Kassem requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to increase his battery stock, because, in addition to fixing cars, he also sells car batteries and electronics. Kassem works hard for his family's safety and satisfaction.  He insists on providing them with the best things they need. He hopes he can continue providing the best education and be proud of them in the future.

loans.use: To increase his stock of batteries

loans.name: Vanny

texts.en:
Vanny is raising pigs and cattle for selling. Her husband is a soldier and a fortune teller, and their income is $15 per day. She has two children; one is studying and the other one is working in a factory. Every month, she has to spend $170 on food, $15 on electricity, $15 on rent, and $20 on school fees. 

She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy pig feed for feeding pigs to sell. If she can save enough money, she will extend her business by buy more pig or cattle to feed for selling because this career can make good income to support her family.

loans.use: To buy pig feed for feeding pigs to sell.

loans.name: Paula Argentina

texts.es: La señora Paula, es habitante del municipio de la Concepción Masaya, junto a su esposo e hijos, los planes hacia un futuro es mejorar las condiciones de vida y mejorar su vivienda, doña Paula desde hace varios años se dedica a vender frutas y verduras en el mercado de Managua , ya que con estos ah logrado mantener a su familia , doña Paula cuenta solo con su capital de trabajo y no le ajusta para la compra de zinc , perlines ,  clavos , etc. , para cambiar el techo de su vivienda ya que en tiempos de lluvia entra por todos lados el agua ya que está bien maltratado el zinc por los años de uso que lleva , Agradece el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atrávez de los fondo Kiva para que pueda compra los materiales que necesita para realizar la obra .
texts.en:
Paula lives with her husband and children in the Concepción Masaya municipality.  Her plans for the future are to improve their living conditions and improve her house.

Paula has been selling fruit and vegetables at the Managua market for several years.  This has been the way that she has managed to support her family.  

Paula only has her working capital, and it does not cover the purchase of zinc sheeting, beams, and nails, etc.  These items are to change the roof of her house because when it rains water comes in everywhere.  The zinc sheeting is in very bad condition because of how old it is.

She is grateful for the support from Afodenic through a Kiva loan.  With the loan she will be able to buy the materials she needs to do the job.

loans.use: to buy zinc sheeting.

loans.name: Dishon

texts.en: Dishon is a determined business man aged 29 years. He is married and blessed with a a two-and-a-half year-old child. For the last 13 years, he has been operating a barber shop to bring up his family. He supplements income from this venture with the earnings he makes from farming and selling car spare parts. Previously, he was selling cosmetics. In the next 5 years, he wants to have a wholesale business dealing with car spare parts. He is requesting a loan of 60,000 Kenya shillings to buy car spares part. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he is now business oriented.

loans.use: To buy car spare parts for his supplementary business

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. Her husband is a businessman and he contributes to his family's basic needs. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a charcoal-selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transporting charcoal from rural areas to her place of operation. She dreams of establishing a charcoal-selling stall in the future.

With the KSHS 20,000, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Estrella Tecson Group

texts.en:
Estrella is married with four children. Estrella is 56 years-old and lives in La Libertad Zamboanga Del Norte.

Estrella sells grocery items and dry goods in order to earn a living and has had this business for six years. Each month, she earns PHP 3,600 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase ten sacks of feed and other supplies for hog fattening.

Estrella has been a member of Kiva partner PMPC for two months. 

Estrella is the leader of a two person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to purchase ten sacks of feed and other supplies for hog fattening.

location.town: Liloy-La Libertad, Gutalac, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Guy Herman

texts.fr:
Client de 43 ans, marie et père de 3 enfants dont l'age varient entre  18 mois et 17 ans. A l’arrêt de ses études universitaires , il commence avec la vente de la friperie il y a de cela 17 ans.

Il est client a Hope depuis bientôt 3 cycles, il a rembourse avec succès et a fait des épargnes considérables, pour son quatrieme cycle, il veut toujours dans le même sens,acheter des ballots de fin de séries, tel que pantalons, polos, T shirts, qu'il nettoie et fait repasser au pressing pour vendre a ses clients.   

Ses ventes vont de 30000 fr a 95000 fr par jour, très enthousiaste , il promet aller loin avec Hope Congo, parce qu’il a pour projet d'ouvrir une boutique des habits prêts a porter.

Comme bon père de famille, il s'occupe bien de ses enfants, et est entrain de d'investir pour construire une maison pour sa famille.
texts.en:
Guy Herman is 43 years old and the father of 3 children aged between 18 months and 17 years. He started selling second hand clothing 17 years ago, after university. He is completing his third loan cycle with HOPE and has so far repaid his loans successfully and managed to build up considerable savings. He is requesting a fourth loan so that he can, once again, buy some bales of end of season clothing including trousers, polo shirts and t-shirts, which he will spruce up and take to the dry cleaners before reselling to his customers. He generally earns between 30 000 and 95 000 francs a day.

An enthusiastic businessman, Guy Herman intends to enjoy a long collaboration with HOPE Congo as he would one day like to open his own shop selling ready-to-wear clothing. An attentive father, he takes good care of his children and is currently investing in building a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy some bales of end of season clothing including trousers, t-shirts and polo shirts.

loans.name: Kurbonsho

texts.ru: Курбоншо проживает в районе Дангара. Возраст, 22 года. Холост. Живет вместе с родителями. Предоставляет услугу, такси. В этой области уже два года. Кроме этого он занимается разведением крупнорогатого скота. Он берет кредит для ремонта машины и закупа теленка.
texts.en: Kurbonsho lives in the Dangara district.  He is 22 years old, single and lives with his parents.  He provides a taxi service and has been involved in this business for two years.  Besides this, he is also involved in breeding cattle.  Kurbonsho is requesting this loan to make repairs to his car and to buy a calf.

loans.use: to make repairs to his car and to buy a calf

loans.name: Amneh

texts.en: Amneh is a 53-year-old woman, and she is married with five sons and six daughters. Her husband and one of her sons are construction workers with decent salaries. Amneh wants to help her husband purchase a new construction kit to improve his work, but the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay, so she needs to take a loan of $1,500 from FATEN. When Amneh gets the loan, she will be able to purchase the construction kit for her husband, so her husband will improve the quality of his work. He will work extra hours to increase his income and offer his family better living conditions. Amneh is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed instead.

loans.use: to purchase a new construction kit.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: Marina, D. 65 años, es una mujer buena, amable y muy responsable. Esta casada y tiene hijos que ya son mayores e independientes. Tiene una casa propia en donD. vive a lado D. su esposo con quien pasa sus días D. alegrías y trabajan mucho pues ellos desean brindarse lo mejor entre si. El trabajo D. Marina, consistirá en la venta D. comidas al paso, ella converso con su vecino y le pidió que pueda vender en la esquina D. su casa y le cedieron el espacio. Ahora sale por las noches a vender salchipapas, salchipollos, pollos broaster, y otros productos. Sabe que todo trabajo con mucho esfuerzo siempre sale bien, ahora tiene en mente hacer crecer su negocio en la venta D. comida. Este será el segundo crédito con la institución MFP, por ello espera D. su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes, asimismo se compromete una vez más en cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado, comprará ingredientes como arroz, pollo, papas y mas, además D. algunos implementos D. cocina para así poder iniciar con su nuevo proyecto.
texts.en:
Marina, 65, is a good, kind and very responsible woman. She’s married and has children who are all independent adults now.  She owns her house where she lives with her husband spending cheerful days; they work hard because they want to give each other the best.

Marina’s work consists in selling fast food.  She spoke with her neighbor and asked if she could sell from his house’s corner and they ceded the space to her.  Now, she goes out nightly to sell salchipapas [fried potatoes with fried sausage], salchipollos [fried potatoes with fried chicken], and Broaster-style chicken and other products.  She knows that any job will turn out well with effort.  Her plan now is to make her food sales business grow.

This will be her 2nd MFP loan and she hopes for your collaboration so that her plans can gel.  She also promises to once again make her installment payments.  She will use the requested amount to buy ingredients like rice, chicken, potatoes and more as well as some kitchen tools to start her new project.

loans.use: to buy rice, chicken and potatoes as well as kitchen tools.

loans.name: Brigida

texts.es:
La señora Brígida es socia del banco comunal Las Águilas, del Distrito de Calleria, Departamento De Ucayali, tiene 53 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive son sus 4 hijos.
Son cuatro años que viene trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos, tiene un tópico que funciona en la ciudad de san Ramón, como es enfermera de profesión es la que se encarga de la atención a las personas que acuden a solicitar sus servicio.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/.  1,200.00 nuevos soles comprara: una camilla,  1 kilo algodones,  1 paquete de gasa, una caja de  esparadrapo,  2 litros de alcohol, una caja de agujas descartables,  una caja de jeringas descartables, todas estas cosas son necesarios en su negocio para poder dar una buena atención a sus a las personas  que requieren de sus servicio.
El trabajo que realiza le ha dado muchas cosas, como buenas amistades y los ingresos que necesita para poder mantener su negocio, todo gracias a Manuela Ramos, solo espera que le siga dando los prestamos.
texts.en:
Brígida is a member of the “Las Águilas” (The Eagles) communal bank in Callería District, Ucayali Department.  She’s 53 years old and a single mother; she lives with her four children.

She’s been working with Manuela Ramos loans for four years.  She runs a health clinic in the city of San Ramón.  Since she’s a nurse by profession she’s who attends to people who come by requesting services.

She will use the 1200 new sol loan to buy: a stretcher, a kilo of cotton, a package of gauze, a box of adhesive bandages, 2 liters of alcohol, a box of disposable needles and a box of disposable syringes.   All these supplies are necessary in her business in order to provide good attention to the people needing care.

The work she does has given her many things like good friendships and income needed to stay in business, all thanks to Manuela Ramos.  Her only hope is that it will continue to grant her loans.

loans.use: to buy cotton.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is 50 years old and lives in Taboc Norte, Oroquieta City. She is married with 1 child. 

Lina has a fruit-vending business and earns approximately 3,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase different kinds of fruit for her fruit-vending business. Lina has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. 

In the future, Lina hopes to have a lot of capital in order to help their daily needs. Lina is a MIGS member of PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase different kinds of fruit for her fruit-vending business

loans.name: Nhiel

texts.en:
Nhier is 32 years old, married, and has three children, all of whom attend school. She sells fish in Dokuru bor, South Sudan, which she has been doing for three years.

Nhiel is requesting a loan from BRAC South Sudan, which she will use to purchase fish. She will use her extra income to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Daysi Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Daysi tiene 43 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive solo con su hijo. doña Daysi es una mujer con muchos deseos de superacion y lucha todos los dias para salir adelante con su hijo.
Daysi se dedica a la de venta de ropa nueva para dama, caballero y  niños. todos los dias se levanta temprano para abrir su negocio.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de ropa nueva, sus clientes le estan haciendo muchos pedidos y no tiene el capital para comprar la mercaderia.
Su unico deseo en esta epoca de navidad es que reine la paz y el amor, pues que esto prevalezca en los corazones de sus clientes, amigos y demas personas.
texts.en:
Daysi, age 34, is a single mother; and she lives with her son.  Daysi is a woman with a lot of desire for self-improvement.  She struggles every day in order to get her son ahead.

Daysi sells new clothes for women, men, and children.  She gets up early every day in order to open her business.

She will use the loan to buy new clothes.  Her customers are giving her a lot of orders, and she does not have the capital to buy the merchandise.

Her only wish during this Christmas season if for peace and love to reign.  This prevails in the hearts of her customers, friends, and other people.

loans.use: to buy new clothes.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 31 years old and married with two children. He repairs motor vehicles to earn a living. He has been in the business for 3 years. He describes his business environment as competitive because many people do the same business.

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Peter has been able to save his income. He hopes to be financially stable in the future. He has applied for a loan of 30,000 Kenya Shillings (KES) to buy motor vehicle spare parts.

loans.use: To buy motor vehicle spare parts.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es:
Lucy eses una joven de 32 años madre de 2 hijos a los cuales quiere muchísimo, son el mayor regalo que Dios le ha dado y por ello lucha cada dia para poder brindarles una vida digna y sobre todo darles lo que ella no pudo tener de niña, ya que debido a los pocos recursos económicos de sus padres ella solo pudo estudiar hasta el cuarto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera encantado estudiar la carrera de contabilidad.

Cada día Lucy se levanta muy temprano para realizar los quehaceres del hogar y luego sale a visitar a sus clientes ya que ella tiene su negocio de venta de productos de belleza y zapatos por catalogo; ella trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al día y puede atender hasta 5 clientes diariamente y ella cree que esta saliendo adelante en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes.

Lucy está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá mejorar su vivienda ya que comprara madera, calamina, entre otros para poder arreglar su techo y así mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Terminar de construir su vivienda y darle una buena educación a sus hijos”.
texts.en:
Lucy is a 32-year-old young lady. She is a mother to two children whom she loves very much; they are the greatest gift that God has given her and she fights every day in order to give them a good life, and above all to give them everything that she didn't have as a child, since due to few economic resources her parents were only able to let her study until the fourth grade of secondary school (9th grade), but she would have loved to have a career in accounting.

Every day, Lucy gets up very early in order to do the household chores and then leaves to visit her clients, since she has a business selling beauty products and shoes from a catalog. She works about nine hours per day and can attend to about five clients daily. She believes that she is getting ahead in business because she is very friendly with her clients.

Lucy is very thankful for the Kiva loans since, thanks to the help that they have brought her, she will be able to improve her home since she will buy wood, iron, and other materials in order to repair her roof. This will improve the quality of life for her family and she will be able to continue fighting in order to make her biggest dream a reality: to finish building her house and to give a good education to her children.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials such as wood and iron, among others

loans.name: Irine

texts.en:
Jerotich lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is extremely fertile for agriculture. She has four children and has been doing this work for four years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs and crops.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'selling farm products'. Her biggest challenge is 'reaching the market during the rainy season'. Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Tuikong'. 

Jerotich was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'gives loans to farmers'. This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'proper record-keeping is important for a farmer'. 

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked 'How will this loan benefit her family', Jerotich replied 'improve livelihood since income will rise'. 

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Jerotich owns the following: 'cow, poultry' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net' but does not have 'electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV, DVD'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To purchase poultry.

loans.name: Ilhama Tevon Gizi

texts.en:
37-year old Ilhama lives her family with three children. Her family’s living condition is not good enough. The family income is rather limited. She is IDP.  Since 2001 Ilhama has been engaged in selling building materials to improve her family’s living condition. As she didn't have enough financial resources, she couldn't develop her business well enough in the beginning. 

She applies for a loan amount of 1000$ in first time to further develop her business, to increase her incomes, to improve her family's living condition with these additional incomes, to obtain some funds for the education of her children.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Isabella Neh

texts.en:
Isabella is a married mother of four children. Growing up as an orphan, she remembers hardship. Memories of when she became indebted and couldn’t contribute to the education of her children are reasons she advanced for joining GHAPE in 2003. Having received training in credit management, marketing techniques, leadership shills, and group dynamics, she has been able to manage successfully and repay her first three loans. She provided dresses, shoes, and bags for women and children in her community and was able to pay some of her debts.

With a loan of $800, she plans to increase her stock by buying at least two pieces of each design to meet the clothing needs of women and children in her community.

She plans to pay back her loan in 18 months. The first installment of the repayment shall be due on the fourth month from the date of disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: Selling clothes, shoes, bags, and earrings

loans.name: Khim

texts.en:
Khim S. E. is 27 years old, married with 3 children, and lives with her husband (pictured here because Khim S. E. is unavailable) in Kampongcham province, Cambodia. She makes her living by growing crops and raising animals in a field behind her house. The cycle of this business makes very little money for her. Meanwhile, her husband operates a business by driving a horse-cart (instead of motor-taxi or tuk tuk) to transport villagers to and from market and typically makes around $4/day to support his family. This couple’s children are too young to attend school. 
S. E. hopes the loan will assist her to purchase a horse and a cart for her husband to operate a business.

loans.use: To purchase a horse-cart to run a business.

loans.name: Yola América

texts.en:
7 ½ years ago, América C. Garcia started cooking and selling hamburgers in Ayacucho, Peru, to supplement her husband’s income and help support their 3 children. She was granted her first loan with FINCA Peru five years ago, and has been a model banker ever since. She cherishes the opportunity for conversation with friends at her weekly meetings, as well as the health, social, and economic lessons that are incorporated into each.

With the seed money loaned to her, América was able to expand her business, and began also selling beverages. A few years ago her husband joined her to help with the expanding business. What was once a small hamburger cart has expanded into a bustling, two-room restaurant with 14 tables. Now that América has so much more space, she would like to use the money from her next loan to make small repairs and improvements to her restaurant, such as fixing a broken door adjoining the two dining rooms.

loans.use: Yola would like to use the money from her next loan to make small repairs and improvements to her restaurant, such as fixing a broken door adjoining the two dining rooms.

loans.name: Felizarda Luísa

texts.pt:
Felizarda Luísa G. is 39 years old. She is a single mother of 3 children. She lives in the neighborhood of Infulene in Maputo. She raises chickens and sells clothes to support her family. Felizarda joined the credit program in April 2007. Her first loan was of 6.000mt. She is in the second phase of the program, and requests a loan in order to increase her inventory and grow her business.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Felizarda Luísa G. tem 39 anos de idade e é mãe solteira de três filhos. Vive no bairro do Infulene em Maputo.Cria frangos e vende roupa. Entrou para o Programa em Abril de 2007 com um empréstimo de 6.000MT. Vai para o 2º ciclo e vai voltar a tomar o mesmo valor para pagar em 5 meses. É ainda prematuro falarv e crescimento do negócio uma vez que está a pouco tempo no programa.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Carmen Julia

texts.en:
After high school Carmen studied cosmetology and for the past 13 years has had her own beauty salon in her house. She also has several regular clients she travels to see. Her husband is a chauffeur, and together they have three children, ages 11, 5, and 2 (her youngest is pictured with her).

With this loan Carmen will expand her inventory so she can work towards her long-term goal of opening her own beauty salon in a building outside of her home, though she will have to wait until her youngest child is in school. She also would like to study more and specialize in some area of cosmetology. Carmen also loves to sew and would someday like to combine her beauty salon with a clothing business.

loans.use: expand her inventory to work towards her long-term goal of opening her own beauty salon outside her home

loans.name: Alejandrina Manzueta

texts.en:
Alejandrina sells empanadas, pâtés, sandwiches and juices in the public square in her community. She is a 36-year-old single mother of five children, two of them girls. They all attend school. This business activity is the principal source of income of the entrepreneur. She says she learned the meaning of working hard to make a living and care for a large family.

Alejandrina doesn´t plan on having her own locale yet. She says she can’t afford it for now. She will keep on selling at the public square and attracting new customers by offering new and varied types of empanadas.

With her loan, Alejandrina will buy raw materials to keep on running her business activity with the aim of reaching a comfortable lifestyle for her family.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials to prepare her sandwiches and  juices

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is 35 years old and has two young children.  She has been part of the community bank “Maria Antonieta” for the past four years.  Here she has learned to save, to be punctual, and to be an exceptional associate of the bank.  One year ago Teodora won a special certificate for good conduct from the organization.
For the past two years Teodora has had a small grocery store located near the cemetery in the town of Huamanga.  From the same store she serves breakfast and lunch.
With the loan of 1000 dollars she hopes to buy more groceries for her business such as oil, rice, beans, sugar, and milk.  She will also buy meat and vegetables for her prepared meals.
Teodora is saving to be able to buy a car so that her husband can work as a taxi driver
At the moment Teodora and her family live in the store.  For this reason her dream is to own a house.  It would be big and have a garage, and a separate room for each one of her children.

loans.use: With the loan of 1000 dollars she hopes to buy more groceries for her business such as oil, rice, beans, sugar, and milk.  She will also buy meat and vegetables for her prepared meals.

loans.name: Jamile

texts.en: Jamile is a 43 year old woman living in Saida, south Lebanon. Jamile owns a grocery store and is in the scrap selling business with her husband. She wants to buy a pickup truck for business use. She is therefore asking for a loan from A. Majmoua to continue sustaining and developing her business.

loans.use: To buy a pickup truck

loans.name: Kiyinki B1 South B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Beatrice N.. She is currently in the business of selling matooke and is requesting a loan to add more capital. Beatrice is 32 years old and is a widow. She has 1 child aged 14 who goes to school. Each week, Beatrice makes approximately UGX 10000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to re-invest in her business.

Beatrice is joined in her small group by Hasifa B., Deborah S., Harriet M., and Annet N.. Hasifa B. has a business running a retail shop and wants to purchase more shop items. Deborah S. is currently operating a retail shop business and wants a loan to purchase a fridge. Harriet M. operates a business selling paraffin and wants to boost business. Annet N. is currently in the business selling paraffin and is requesting a loan to expand business.

loans.use: To add working capital to matooke business

loans.name: Kokou Djigbodi

texts.fr:
Mr. Kokou Djigbodi L. was born March 23rd, 1983 in the town of Ahepe located 35 km away from Lomé. Since the year 2004, he has been doing business selling electrical equipment in the Nyékonakpoè neighborhood of Lomé. He wishes to increase his stock of electrical equipment and to this end is seeking a loan of 250,000 francs CFA to buy two boxes of button switches, one box of sockets, ten rolls of wire cable, and 12 boxes of neon bulbs. His new stock will allow him to improve his sales.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur L. Kokou Djigbodi est né le 23 mars 1983 à AHEPE localité située à 35 km de la ville de Lomé. Depuis l’année 2004, il exerce l’activité de vente de matériels électriques dans le quartier de Nyékonakpoè à Lomé. Il désire augmenter son stock de matériels électriques et sollicite à cet effet un crédit d’un montant de 250.000 FCFA pour acheter deux (2) cartons interrupteurs, un (1) carton de prises, dix (10) rouleaux de fils conducteurs et douze (12) cartons d’ampoule néon. Ainsi son nouveau stock va lui permettre d’améliorer son chiffre d’affaires.

loans.use: Expand merchandise stock

loans.name: Kelli

texts.en:
Kelli A. G. has a business selling rice, sugar, wheat, and corn in the town of Carabamba high in the sierras of La Libertad Region. As a distributor she provides many of the general stores in town with these goods. She has 7 years of experience and is very well known in the community.

Kelli is 25 years old, single, and has one child. She is happy because her economic situation is stable and she can send her child to school. Her main goal is to send her child to a University to study and become a professional.

A member of the community bank Union Y Fuerza, Kelli is requesting a loan of s/1000 to repay over 4 months. She will use the loan to buy more rice, sugar, wheat, and corn.

loans.use: She will use the loan to buy more rice, sugar, wheat, and corn.

loans.name: Ogundeje

texts.en: A. Ogundeje lives in Okiedo- Isshashi, Lagos State, Nigeria, where she sells clothes. She learned this skill for 4 years and has been in this business for the past 14 years.  A. is 48 years old and married with 3 children. She has been a leader in a lending group under LAPO Microfinance for the past 4years. She is asking for a loan of $1,200 to buy more clothes for sale.  She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sales

loans.name: Koku

texts.fr:
Mr. Koku G., 39, was born in Agou Akplolo, is married and the father of 3 children. He lives in Lomé. He is a professionally trained auto mechanic. Lacking the financial means to have his own garage and at the same time wanting to be his own boss, in 1995, he used the meager means at his disposal to begin selling spare parts for cars and motorcycles. In the meantime, he specializes in selling tires, but has also continued to sell some vital spare parts.

What’s unique about Mr. G.’s business is that he puts his knowledge of auto mechanics to good use in counseling his customers, which makes for a sort of after-sales service. This first loan that he is requesting will allow him to buy 150 tires to fill an order.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Né a Agou Akplolo, Monsieur G. Koku, a 39 ans est marié et père de trois enfants. Il vit à Lomé. Comme formation professionnelle il a fait la mécanique auto. Par faute de fond pour avoir son propre garage, et aussi avec le désir d’être son propre chef, il a commencé avec le peu de moyen qu’il disposait à faire le commerce des diverses pièces détachées pour voiture et moto depuis 1995. Au fil des temps il s’est spécialisé dans la vente de pneus sans toute fois laisser la vente de quelques pièces nécessaires.

La particularité du commerce de monsieur G., c’est qu’il use de ses connaissances en mécanique pour conseiller ses clients, ce qui constitue un service après vente. Ce premier crédit lui permettra de d’acheter 150 pneus pour répondre a une commande.

loans.use:
Purchase of tires

Achat de pneus

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr:
Yawa Z. is a small business owner and is 32 years old, married and a mother of 2 children. To earn money, she works at the general market in Avétonou, a village located approximately 100 kilometers from Lome, the Togolese capital. With this first credit from FECECAV, she would like to buy bags of rice, sugar, salt and other products in order to build her supplies and subsequently resell them. With this growth, she could better answer the requests of her customers and provide for the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Translator

Yawa Z. commerçante de petits détails est âgée de 32 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Pour gagner de l’argent elle opère un marché général à Avétonou, un village situé à environ 100 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale Togolaise. Avec son premier crédit de FECECAV, elle espère acheter des sacs de riz, du sucre, du sel et autres produits variés pour augmenter son stock et revendre en détail. Avec cet agrandissement, elle peut mieux répondre aux demandes de ses clients et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: Purchase of bags of rice, sugar, salt and other products

loans.name: Yemi

texts.en:
Yemi A. is 40 years old and married with three children. Her eldest child is a graduate while her last child is in a public university. She sells frozen food items like fish, chicken and turkey. She has been in this business for long time. She supplies to women who sell in the open market. In the photo, you see her standing beside the deep freezer.

Yemi needs this loan of $450 to buy more frozen items for sale. She says thank you

loans.use: Purchase more frozen foods

loans.name: Vusal

texts.en:
Vusal Q. is 25 years old. He is married with one child. 
Vusal raises and sells cattle. He purchases small cattle in the central market, feeds and cares for them, and then resells them at higher prices in the local market. Vusal has been in this business for four years. 
He is an expert in choosing and caring for the animals. He gets up every morning at five o’clock in order to feed the animals and to look after them. His knowledge and skills allow him to make his business successful, generating a considerable, stable income for his large family. 
Vusal is planning to enlarge his stock by purchasing more small cattle. For this purpose he requests $1,200 USD. You could become an important part of Vusal's family's life. He deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving him.

loans.use: To purchase four calves

loans.name: Mrs. Khen Kunthea Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Khen K. is a group leader of six who all live in Preak Roka Village in Kandal Province and all the members will use the loan for different purposes. 

Mrs. Khen K. owns a piece of land which is infertile so she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to make her crop more productive. Her husband, Mr. Mon Bunthoeurn, is a construction worker who can generate a small income to support the family. Mrs. Khen K. is 32 years old and the mother of a child who is too young to work or study because that child is only five years old.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Mohammad Karim

texts.en:
M. Karim was educated as an engineer and served for a long time in the Afghanistan ministry of Agriculture. He is an honest man in his work. M. Karim has 3 children; they are married and live together with Karim. They have a house and they live in the first floor. A few months ago they started to build the second floor but they now face some economical problems and so he wants to take a loan.

Therefore, he requested an individual loan of 50000 Afghans in the term of 18 months to complete his stock and start working again on his house to build the second floor and solve his problem.

M. Karim is very happy with the loan process in this country. He would like to mention that because of such a great program in Afghanistan, it could really solve his problem. Without this loan it would be impossible to start building his house. He would like to thank those that help with the loan process in Afghanistan.

loans.use: to complete his stock

loans.name: Yin

texts.en: Yin H., 44, is married and lives in the Kampong Cham province with her six children. She works as a farmer and is typically able to make $2.50 US each day. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have played into a difficult economic year for many Cambodians, as food prices have also been high. Her husband, San Sat, pictured here, has a business catching fish and typically makes $7 US every day. She is asking for a loan of $600 US to purchase a motorbike for family transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for family transportation.

loans.name: Marta Alicia

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Marta Alicia F. le esta haciendo falta el portón de enfrente, ya que  tiene tres hijas que desea que estén con la mayor seguridad, ya que están gran parte del día solas en la casa. 
El motivo es porque doña Marta Alicia tiene que ir a trabajar a una prestigiada maquiladora como operaria y su esposa el señor Juan Venegas trabaja en la construcción en la vecina ciudad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Marta Alicia F.’s home lacks a front door. Since she has three daughters, she wants to have more security because they spend most of the day alone in the house. The reason for this is that Mrs. Marta Alicia has to go to work at a prestigious factory as an operator, and her husband, Mr. Juan Venegas, works in construction in a neighboring city.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To put a front door in her house

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Mrs. Chantha V. is a farmer in Angk Prasat village in Takeo province. She owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice. Aside from this plantation, she is a rice middleman. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more rice to re-sell to earn more profit. Her husband, Mr. Thou Sophal, is a laborer.

Mrs. Chantha V. is 40 years old and the mother of four children, three of whom are enrolled in the local school while the other is too young to work or study. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more rice to keep in stock and re-sell at a better price

loans.name: Franca

texts.en: Franca is 30 years old and married with 2 children. She lives in Agbor, Delta state, Nigeria. She sells planks to builders. She needs the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more planks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more planks to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria tiene 39 años de edad, vive con sus dos hijos y su esposo en su casa propia, resultado de su trabajo. Su dedicación por la costura la aprendió de su madre, ahora Maria es una gran costurera, ya que para ella no existe prenda que no pueda confeccionar. Esta actividad la viene ejerciendo desde hace 18 años en forma constante en su casa, que es su taller. Lo que le gusta de su labor es relacionarse con varias personas quienes son sus clientes, además le es muy rentable porque ella misma lleva a vender la ropa que confecciona por los diferentes lugares de su localidad, también cuenta con una fiel clientela quienes confían en su buen trabajo y la buscan constantemente, y esta temporada ha tenido gran demanda por el inicio de las clases y para la elaboración de uniformes para los estudiantes. Más adelante a Maria le gustaría tener una tienda de ropa. Este es su 8vo préstamo con MFP, y con el dinero que solicita comprará materiales textiles, así podrá confeccionar más ropa que pueda llevar a vender.
texts.en:
Maria is 39 and lives with her husband and two children in her own house, which she worked to buy. She sews for a living, which she learned from her mother, and now she is a great seamstress, and there isn't a garment she can't make. She's been doing this continuously for 18 years in her house, which she uses as her shop. What she likes about her work is that she gets to interact with lots of different clients. It's also profitable because she can sell the clothes she makes to different places in her area. In addition, she has loyal clientele who trust her good work and seek her out all the time, and demand has been high because the school year is starting and she needs to make uniforms for the students. In the future Maria would like to have a clothing store. This will be her eighth loan with MFP. She plans to use the money to buy textiles so she can make more clothing to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials for her sewing business

loans.name: Ehtibar

texts.en: Ehtibar

loans.use: To purchase more dishes

loans.name: Muhayyo

texts.ru:
В свои 53 года Мухайё продолжает трудиться и заниматься предпринимательством. Для нее это основной источник дохода семьи, так как ее муж тоже работает, но стабильного заработка не имеет. Поэтому Мухайё и ее старший сын торгуют. Сама Мухайё производит дома соленые косточки, которые затем отсылают для продажи за пределы Таджикистана. Технология производства соленых косточек трудоемкая и занимает много времени. Сначала абрикосовые косточки немного раскалывают, а затем варят в специальном соляном растворе. После варки косточки выкладывают тонким слоем на солнце и сушат. Через несколько часов косточки готовы к реализации.
Старший сын Мухайё на центральном рынке торгует различными овощами и это тоже складывается в общий семейный бюджет. 
Мухайё решила получить небольшой займ на расширение своего бизнеса, так как сейчас цены на абрикосовые косточки упали и она хочет сделать небольшой запас для будущего.
texts.en:
53-year-old Muhayyo continues to work and to run a business that is the main source of income for her family. Although her husband also works, he does not have a steady job, and for this reason, Muhayyo and her eldest son are in trade. Muhayyo herself processes the salted apricot pits at home, and then exports them abroad. It is hard work and time-consuming. First, the apricot pits are cracked, then slightly blanched in a special brine. After blanching, the pits are spread out in a thin layer in the sun to dry. The pits are ready for sale in a few hours. Muhayyo's eldest son sells a variety of vegetables in the central market, and this also goes into the family kitty. Since the price of apricot pits has now dropped and she wants to stock up for the future, Muhayyo decided to take out a small loan to expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of apricot pits

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema has been a bites seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for six months. She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $95. She works at her business for 8 hours a day. Rehema is 20 years old and single. She is requesting a loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more rice, wheat flour, cooking oil and sugar for her business. She is hoping that through this loan her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for the future.
She belongs to H/maneno group loan (Group code 2007).

loans.use: To buy more rice, wheat flour, cooking oil and sugar

loans.name: Gloria Leida

texts.es:
Gloria es socia del Banco Comunal Obreras.
Gloria es soltera, tiene 45 años y 1 hija, Gloria vende panes, pasteles variados que son adquiridos en la ciudad de Lima, sus ventas los realiza a trabajadores de distintas instituciones, además Gloria vende cosméticos por catálogos.
Gloria necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de panes y cosméticos.
Los sueños de Gloria son educar a su hija en la universidad y tener mas clientes.
texts.en:
Gloria is a member of Communal Bank Obreras. She is 45 years old, single and has a daughter. She sells bread and a variety of pastries which she acquires in Lima. She sells to workers in various businesses. She also does catalog sales of cosmetics. She needs a loan of 1000 soles that she will use to purchase bread and cosmetics. Her dreams are to be able to send her daughter to college and to have more customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bread and cosmetics

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene M. is from the village of Sta. Felomina, Iligan City. She is 33 years old. Arlene is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Arlene runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Arlene sells vegetables , spices  and other food products. Arlene has been engaged in her business for more than 11 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Arlene joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arlene is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Arlene from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Santa Felomena, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Narmandah

texts.en:
Narmandah C. is 45 years old and lives with her husband and their youngest son in Ovorhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Two of her daughters are college students in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.

Narmandah sells various secondhand accessories and parts for cars, trucks and motorcycles. She started the car accessories business with her husband when the first-ever black market for secondhand car accessories and parts opened in the town in the early 1990s. As many locals get rich enough to afford to buy cars, the market for car accessories and parts took off. While she sells the car products at the local market, her husband travels to Ulaanbaatar one to three times a month and brings back supplies for her business.

Narmandah’s business is the main source of income for the family. She says that she works hard with her husband to make sure that they are able to continue to support her children's education. She requests a loan to purchase more car spare parts and accessories for her business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts at wholesale prices

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Before having her own farm, Cecilia N. was worried about meeting her expenses. She is a rice grower (owns a half hectare farm) and a mother of one child. Currently she is busy preparing the soil for the next planting. She needs additional capital to purchase 30 liters of crude oil and to pay the laborers.

With help from CEVI, she has applied for a loan of PHP 6,000 as additional capital to grow her farm.

She actively participates in the CEVI cluster meetings in her village and enjoys availing CEVI’s services such as loans, trainings and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase 30 liters of crude oil and to pay laborers

loans.name: Jose Enoc

texts.es: El joven José Gutiérrez tiene 26 años de edad, habitante de Villa del Carmen, soltero, vive en la casa de sus abuelos, sus planes es mejorar su nivel de vida para beneficio de su familia. Trabaja en la Alcaldía del Villa del Carmen en el cargo de asistente del vice alcalde. Ha tenido dificultades para construir su vivienda la falta de financiamiento es unas de ellas. Ahora gracias al préstamo en Afodenic lograra comprar materiales de construcción lo que son: cemento, hierro, bloque, zinc y piso para un cuarto que es necesario. Brindando comodidad y seguridad a su familia.
texts.en:
Jose G. is young at 26 years old, and he lives in Villa del Carmen. He is single and lives in his grandparents' house. He plans to improve his standard of living to benefit his family. He works in the mayor's office in Villa del Carmen in the post of vice-mayor. He is had many difficulties when trying to build his own house and a lack of finances is one of those. Now, thanks to the loan from Afodenic, he will be able to buy building materials such as: cement, iron, blocks, zinc and flooring for a much needed room which will bring comfort and security to his family.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials for a room/Comprar materiales de construccion para hacer uncuarto

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza M. is a resident of Labakid, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 33 years old, married and has one school-aged daughter. To make a living, Liza owns a rice retailing business.  

In June 2007, Liza joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from PMPC. Liza is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used to purchase more sacks of rice for sale. She believes that with the help of Paglaum MPC, her business will prosper.

loans.use: Additional capital for her rice retailing business

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria I. is married with two children. She has a small grocery store. Maria has been in this business for 7 years. The store is located in her house, which makes it a true family business. The competition is low because there are only two grocery stores in the whole village. Maria's business goal is to open one more business location and increase her sales.

Maria would like to borrow 6,500 UAH to purchase more inventory. This will help her to serve more clients and receive additional income for her family.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy pagnes

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
La señora Cristina A.  tiene 38 años esta casada con el señor felix. La señora Cristina se dedica a la elaboracion de chicha (una bebida elaborada con trigo fermentado) y ala produccion de Leche con sus 3 vacas lecheras,es una mujer trabajadora y responsable, ella trabajo desde muy joven con su madre ya que se dedicaba a la misma actividad ubicada en mallco rancho.

La madre fallecio hace mas de 5 años.la señora Cristina tiene dos hijos pequeños a los que trata de darles una educacion buena siempre estando pendiente de ellos ya que uno de sus hijos tiene un problema de aprendisaje es por eso que ella siempre esta pendiente de ese niño.

El credito que ella solicita es para comprar un terreno para que en el pueda construir su casita para sus hijos ya que la casa donde viven es en realidad de la madre y sus hermanos estan pidiendo que ella desocupe ese domicilio para poder venderlo y cada uno tener su pequña herencia. Ella espera en un futuro poder sacar un segundo prestamo para poder comprar mas vacas y asi mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Cristina A. is 38 years old and married to her husband, Felix. She makes chicha (a beverage made from fermented wheat) and is a dairy farmer who produces milk from her three cows. She is a very hard-working and responsible woman, having started to work from a very early age with her mother who did the same kind of work in Mallco ranch. Her mother died over 5 years ago and now Cristina has two small children. She strives to provide them with a good education and is always watchful of them especially since one of them has a learning disability so she is particularly focused on this child. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy a plot of land on which she can build a home for her children since the house they currently occupy was actually her mother's and her siblings are asking her to vacate so they can sell it and divide the sales profits among them. She hopes in the future to be able to secure an additional loan to buy more cows so that she can earn increased profits and improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a lot on which to build a house.

loans.name: Ana Celia

texts.es:
La señora Ana Celia es viuda y trabaja  en la vecina ciudad Laredo Texas limpiando una casa. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para pagar la diferencia de una casa por medio de un crédito gubernamental, ya que actualmente dende vive es prestada y le están pidiendo que desocupe la propiedad. Pero ella no tiene a donde ir y las casas de restas  en este momento están muy  altos el costo de la renta.
Es por eso que decidió mejor tener su propio patrimonio y mas seguro para ella.
texts.en:
Señora Ana Celia is a widow, and works in the neighboring city of Laredo Texas cleaning a house. She is requesting a loan to help finance the purchase of a home (to pay the difference between the cost of a house and a government loan.) The home she lives in now is rented and the owners have asked her to move out of the property, but she has no place to go, and the houses that are currently available have very high rents. For this reason, she decided it would be better and more secure for her to own her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to use along with a government loan to buy a home

loans.name: Salimata

texts.fr:
Mariée,  mère  de 6 enfants, Madame Salimata  Konaté est âgée  de 34 ans et vit  dans une famille polygame avec son mari et ses enfants  dans le quartier Hamdallaye de la préfecture de Koutiala ( Région de Sikasso ).  
Elle n’a pas pu faire d’études dû à des raisons sociales, c’est pour cela qu’elle s’est  très vite intéressée aux activités commerciales de plusieurs sortes. Finalement Salimata opta pour la restauration, apprise auprès de sa maman. Elle exerce cette  depuis maintenant 7 ans. Elle est très bien sollicitée dans son secteur  surtout  les matins où elle est très fréquentée.  
Pour l’élargissement et l’amélioration de son activité, Madame Salimata Konaté n’a pas pris du temps à faire recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et cela depuis 4 ans.  
Après 4 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) tous payés correctement sans aucune difficulté, elle est à son 3ème  prêt  individuel et les deux précédents se sont bien dénoués.  
Avec ce nouveau financement, elle compte acheter, 5 sacs de haricot auprès des grossistes de céréales de Koutiala,  10 cartons de spaghettis et des condiments alimentaires. Elle vend du beignet à base de haricot et  bien d’autres plats alimentaires (haricot graines cuites, spaghettis etc)  devant sa porte  à une clientèle constituée de femmes et d’hommes , au comptant surtout.   
Elle compte sur un bénéfice mensuel de  100.000 FCFA qu’elle envisage utiliser pour le remboursement des  taux d’intérêts de Soro Yiriwaso et participer aux dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille.
texts.en:
Madame Salimata Konaté is 34 years old, married and has six children. She lives in a polygamous family with her husband and children in the Hamdallaye neighborhood in the Koutiala prefecture (Sikasso region of Mali). For socio-economic reasons she did not go to school, and so she became very involved with various commercial activities. Madame Konaté finally opted for the catering trade, which she picked up from her mother. She has done this for nearly seven years. She is highly sought after in her neighborhood, particularly during the morning when she is very busy. In order to develop and improve her business, Madame Konaté wasted no time in turning to micro-finance institution Solo Yiriwaso four years ago. After four group loans, all fully repaid without difficulty, she is now on to her third individual loan, the previous two having been successfully completed. With this new loan, she intends to buy five sacks of beans from the grain wholesalers in Koutiala, 10 cases of spaghetti and food condiments. She sells bean fritters and several other prepared foods (e.g., cooked bean seeds, spaghetti) in front of her house, to a clientèle of both men and women for cash. Madame Konaté hopes to generate a monthly income of 100,000 FCFA, which she will use to pay the interest to Soro Yiriwaso and to pay her daily household expenses.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her catering business

loans.name: Nabih

texts.en: Nabih is a 22-year-old single man who lives with his parents. In 2008, he decided to open his own curtain shop and thus began his new career. Today, Nabih is requesting to borrow $1,200 USD to buy a Rapid car to facilitate his business movements and be able to satisfy quickly his customers' demands.

loans.use: To buy a Rapid car

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is fifty-seven years old. She is divorced and has given birth to three children who are all in school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a fishing dominated community in the central region of Ghana. Elizabeth is a trader in printed fabrics. She hawks and treks to nearby communities to sell on their market days. Elizabeth has been in business for over twenty years and would like to give her business a facelift. She therefore wants the loan to procure many kinds of printed fabrics in bulk to achieve this dream.

loans.use: To buy printed fabrics.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Mr. B. Jackson is fifty-six years old and is married with six children.

Jackson owns a stationery shop which he has been operating for over eight years. He is using the loan to purchase stationery items such as pens and pencils, books, files, clip boards, colored pencils, papers, and so forth.

Jackson is a hardworking businessman whose dream is to expand his business and to become a successful businessman in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more stationery items for his shop

loans.name: Kung

texts.en:
Kung K. is 34 years of age and a resident of Kompong Tom province. In order to meet the needs of her family, Kung K. sells a few grocery items from her home. She has four years of experience in this business and is earning over $9 per day. 

Kung K. was married and divorced her husband when her child was very young. Recently she has sold out of nearly all the grocery items from her store. She wants to acquire more items to continue selling but she lacks money to increase her inventory. Thus, she looks for assistance from Kiva through HKL with a loan of US $1000. She will accumulate a quantity of merchandise for her store.

loans.use: To restock merchandise

loans.name: San

texts.en:
Mrs. San V. is 24-year-old, married and mother. She has a young child who is enrolled in primary school. Her husband is the main provider for family. He sells jewelry with his uncle around the province, in Cambodia. 

To earn a living, San V. sells breakfast foods to customers from nearby villages from her home. San V. is looking for a loan to decorate her shop and her house to better attract customers who come to eat her food.

loans.use: To decorate her shop and her house.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is a 31-year-old married man with three children. Two of his children attend school.  He has been running a grocery shop for seven years in the Kibera slums.  He employs one person.  He earns extra income from building contracts.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to save his money and he now plans to take his first loan through Faulu Kenya to buy crates of onions and tomatoes.  Therefore, he requested a loan of Kes. 60,000. He hopes to expand his business and acquire a vehicle for transporting fresh produce to the market.

loans.use: Buy crates of onions & tomatoes for sale

loans.name: Hold Tight Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the Hold Tight group from the small town of Waterloo, near Freetown, where 'Shine on Sierra Leone' has partnered with SMT to start a branch. They are seeking for a loan of SLL 4,200,000 from Kiva lenders. 

Hawa W. (pictured in the front) is the leader of this group. Hawa is 47 years of age. She was born in Waterloo, 20 miles from Freetown. She is married to a village headman and the two of them have three children together. All three of their children are still school-going. Hawa is a pig farmer; she will use this loan to buy 10 additional pigs. Hawa has been a pig farmer for 6 years now.

loans.use: Buy 10 additional pigs

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Mrs. M. is 40 years old and the mother of two children. One of them is married and lives independently and other one is single, living in the family home. M. currently works as an internal staff member for a private company, earning a suitable salary. M. has another financial contributor in her husband named Phoeun, age 48, who is a local cultivator. 

In the past, M.’s husband also hired a cow to help with plowing his farmland during the farming season. He wants to cut out this fee; he discussed this with his wife and they have decided to ask for a loan in order to purchase a pair of cows to facilitate the field-plowing.

loans.use: To purchase a pair of cows to facilitate the field-plowing

loans.name: Salem Group

texts.en:
Homa is the group leader of Salem Group. She is 45 years old and lives in 16th district, Kabul, Afghanistan. She is married with three children: two sons and one daughter, who are students in school..

Homa wants to take a loan for her tailoring business. She wants to buy necessary materials for her business and wants to increase the size of her new shop and buy a new machine as well. She hopes to expand and progress her business and to have more clients, too.

Homa thanks AFS and all Kiva lenders for this loan process in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To buy necessary materials for her business

loans.name: Uss' Group

texts.en:
Six people who live in Peam Sala village in the Kandal province make up this group loan. They will use the loan for different purposes to improve their business conditions in the future. 

Mrs. Uss C. is the group leader who has been selected by all the group members. She is a farmer who owns 0.36 hectares of land and cultivates rice to support her family. Since her farming is going well, she bought another small piece of land, but she did not have enough money. Thus, Mrs. Uss C. decided to ask for a loan to pay for the small piece of land that she bought. She is a widow who lives with another household member.

loans.use: To buy small a piece of land

loans.name: Candelaria Del C

texts.es:
Candelaria Jiménez D. C. con sus 53 años  tiene dos hijos D. 29 y 32 años D. edad y un negocio D. vender mercancías como perfumes, cosméticos, prendas D. fantasía, calzado, vestidos, mediante varias revistas especializadas; este negocio lo comenzó desD. hace 10 años cuando la separación D. su esposo y la obligación D. generar ingresos para el sostenimiento del hogar, superiores a los que le enviaba el padre D. sus hijos, la llevó a buscar esta alternativa. En el barrio nuevo bosque D. la ciudad D. Cartagena D. Indias, donD. ella vive nació su  idea D. negocio y una amiga la ayudó a pensar en la mejor forma D. hacerlo: fue así como su hermano le prestó un pequeño capital e  inició con un catalogo y hoy, para poder diversificar su oferta, maneja 10 D. ellos; gracias a este negocio pudo ayudar a que sus hijos salieran adelante y por eso actualmente está muy contenta D. saberlos profesionales. 

En la actualidad solicita su segundo crédito a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, el cual lo invertirá en  la compra D. una línea nueva D. bolsos en cuerina comercialmente muy apetecidos por su clientela. DesD. que llegó a esta organización, hace algo mas D. un año, ha podido tener efectivo disponible para comprar D. oportunidad muchas D. las ofertas, especialmente en líneas D. nuevos productos y poder ofrecerle un precio mejor a sus clientes y obviamente generar mayor utilidad para ella. Su gran sueño ahora es que su hija también se agregue a su negocio, para que saque adelante a sus hijos a quienes educa ella sola y este es justamente su mayor desafío: tener un gran almacén para generar un buen empleo a su hija.
texts.en:
Candelaria Jiménez D. C. is 53 years old; she has two children ages 29 and 32 and has a business selling merchandise such as perfume, cosmetics, exotic garments, shoes, dresses, and various specialty magazines. She began this business 10 years ago when she separated from her husband. She was obligated to generate income to support her family in addition to what she received from her children's father, which led her to look for this alternative. In the new forest neighborhood of the Cartagena D. Indias city, where she lives the idea of having a business was born. A friend helped her come up with ideas for the best way to run a business. So, her sister lent her a small amount of capital to get started and she began with a catalogue. Today, in order to diversify her selection, she manages 10 catalogue businesses. Thanks to this business she was able to see her children move forward, and now, she is so excited to know that they are both professionals. Now she is asking for a second loan from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, to invest in the purchase of a new line of highly desirable leather purses for her commercial clients. Since she arrived at this organization, almost a year ago, she has had available cash to buy many affordable offerings, especially in new product lines, and been able to offer them at a better price to her customers, and obviously, generate more income for herself. Her big dream is to bring her daughter into the business to improve the lives of her children, whom her daughter raises and educates on her own, and this is precisely her biggest challenge; to have a large store and to generate a good business with her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a new line of leather purses

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is the mother of five – her youngest is a boy of seven months. Her husband is employed by the Kenyan Navy and her four older girls are all in school.

Amina runs a small restaurant and has been in business for just a year. Before she started the restaurant, she was unemployed. She sells her food to those in her neighborhood and to passersby. She says some of the largest business challenges she faces are competition, and collecting money from debtors.

Amina’s aspirations for the future of her business are to be able to own her own plot of land in nearby Kilifi.

Amina’s largest personal expenses are school fees, food for her family, and medication. She currently rents her house, but does not have electricity or piped water.

loans.use: To buy a stock of beans, rice, Irish potatoes, sugar, baking flour and cooking oil

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma D. is a 57-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a general store. She lives in Water Lily Zone 10, Talisay City, Negros Occidental with her husband and their child, who is currently attending school.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 12,000.

Alma is now borrowing Php 15,000 so that she can use it as additional working capital for her general store. This will be her fourth cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php 10,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Alma aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria es soltera y tiene 5 hijos de los cuales solo 1 estudia, vive en casa alquilada, Gloria tiene un puesto en el mercado en donde vende abarrotes en general, actividad que realiza todos los días. Además Gloria vende comida por las tardes de manera ambulatoria en la Av. Arenales.
Gloria es socia del Banco Comunal Lirio y solicita un crédito de 1600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Gloria son comprar un terreno para la construcción de su casa.
texts.en:
Gloria is single and has five children, of whom only one is studying. She lives in a rented house. Gloria has a stall in the market where she sells general grocery items every day. Additionally, Gloria sells food in the afternoons as a mobile seller in the Avenue Arenales. Gloria is a member of the “Banco Comunal Lirio,” or the Iris Community Bank, and is requesting a loan of 1600 soles. The money will be invested in the purchase of rice and sugar. Gloria's dream is to buy a piece of land in order to build her house.

Translated from Spanish by Anna Ruby Waxham Blackwell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of rice and sugar.

loans.name: Sem

texts.en: Sem S., 47, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for quality palm products. S. sells traditional medicine for an income of USD 1.00 each per day. Her husband is employed at local garment factory worker, earning an income of USD 2.00 per day. S. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a motorbike for the family's use. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for the family's use.

loans.name: Bendiya 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe BENDIYA 1 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 41ans, 5  enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles polygames à MOSSIBOUGOU, un des villages de la commune de LOULOUNI dans la sous préfecture  de LOULOUNI, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution, le prêt passé a été bien remboursé.
Les spéculations cultivées sont : la patate, le niébé et le pois sucré avec KADIATOU S..
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants et les petits matériels pour entretenir : 1,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché du village de DALLEN et au marché de LOULOUNI après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 62.500FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
Elle souhaite entretenir  cette collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’ exploiter un espace cultural encore plus grand pour mieux en tirer plus de gains.
NB: Nawa C.  était partie accompagner Aminata C. pour son accouchement au centre de santé, raison de leur absence sur la photo de groupe.
texts.en:
The Bendiya 1 group consists of ,married women with an average age of 41 and with five children. Mostly, they live in polygamous families in Mossibougou, a village in the commune of Loulouni in the subprefecture of Loulouni (Mali's Third Administrative Region). They work with Soro Yiriwaso, a microfinance institution, to be able to have more control over their farming activtyy during the rains. This is their second loan. The first was repaid properly. Kadiatou S.'s crops are potatoes, black-eyed peas, and snow peas. With her loan she plans to buy fertilizer and hand tools for cultivating 1.5 hectares, and hopes to make a profit of 62,500 CFA for the season so she can pay back her loan and help her husband out with family expenses. She would like to continue working with Soro Yiriwaso and cultivate more land so she can increase her income. Note: Nawa Coilibaly was with Aminata C. while Aminata was giving birth, so neither of them is in the group photo.

Translated from French by Michael Briggs, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer and hand tools

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.en:
Tomasa B. is from the town of Calamagui, San Pablo. She is 47 years old, married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Tomasa makes and sells candy to members of her community. Tomasa has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2009, Tomasa joined ASKI to gain access to financial services with the hopes of improving her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tomasa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. Tomasa is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make her products. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Tomasa from ASKI. She plans to use any additional revenue generated from the business to support her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make candy

loans.name: Lissette Del Socorro

texts.es: La Sra. S. es comerciante del mercado la estación donde elabora la chicha por la tarde y en la mañana se traslada al mercado para su venta al por mayor y detalle, los  crédito que Ceprodel le ha otorgado los ha utilizado para comprar por mayor el producto para la elaboración de chicha y así ha  obtenido  mayor ganancia, y eso le ha permitido poner otro tipo de negocio a la par como es la venta de ropa interior y así ha mejorado su nivel de vida ya que es una madre soltera con dos hijas.
texts.en:
Mrs. S. is a merchant in the La Estación Market where she makes chicha (drink made with fermented corn) in the afternoons and in the morning she goes to the market to sell both at wholesale and retail. Ceprodel loans have been used to buy ingredients for chicha at wholesale thus obtaining higher profits. This has made it possible for her to start up an additional business: underwear sales that has helped her improve her standard of living since she’s a single mother of two daughters.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn, firewood, raspberries, slips, socks, undershirts, etc.

loans.name: Erlinda Edubina

texts.es:
Erlinda de 32 años, tiene una papelería en la parte delantera de su casa, vive en el Fortín de Guayaquil una zona caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y comerciantes informales. Su esposo es vendedor ellos tienen tres hijos. 

Ella empezó vendiendo cuadernos a sus vecinos y amigos, con algunos ahorros que tenia comenzó a comprar papelería para tener mas ingresos, poco a poco pudo comprar una vitrina y readecuar su casa para ubicar el negocio en la parte delantera de su casa. 

Para poder surtirlo con mas mercadería ella quiere comprar con el préstamo cuadernos, papelería, bebidas. En el futuro quiere agrandar su papelería y que sus hijos terminen sus estudios con éxito.
texts.en:
Erlinda is 32 years old and she has an office supply store in the front section of her house. She lives in Fortin de Guayaquil, a region known for its unpaved roads and for its vendors. Her husband is a vendor and they have three children together. She started out selling notebooks to her neighbours and her friends. With her modest earnings she was able to purchase other office supplies and increase her income. Eventually she managed to purchase a display case and she was able to remodel a section of her house from where to run her business. In order to restock her business with more merchandise she would requests a loan. With it she will purchase notebooks, office supplies, and soft drinks. In the future she hopes to expand her office supply store and she wishes to see her children successfully complete their schooling.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase notebooks and office supplies.

loans.name: Don’T Let Your Brother Fall Group

texts.en:
