Titus T., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Don’t Let Your Brother Fall.  He is 42 years old, single and has two children aged between 2 and 6. He was only able to attend school to 10th grade due to lack of financial support. 

For 3 years, he has been running a motorcycle transport business in Thinkers’ village outside of Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 6,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more spare parts and petroleum.

He describes himself as a friendly man whose goals are to improve his business and to continue to educate his children.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts and petroleum

loans.name: Blenda

texts.en:
Blenda A. is from the village of Sta. Rosa. She is 41 years old. Blenda is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Blenda owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Blenda has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Blenda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Blenda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. Blenda is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Blenda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy iron, doors, sand, cement and tiles and to pay for labor

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en: Thomas is a 64-year-old married man with six children staying in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is vested with the duty of providing basics to eight household members and his family aspiration is being able to set up an income-generating activity for his children. For eight years now, Thomas has been farming and boasts of paying school fees of four of his children from the income generated from farming. His business dream is to buy more land and farm extensively. Therefore, he needs the loan to purchase a piece of land to make a plantation of bananas to sell when they mature.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land for planting bananas to sell

loans.name: Safia's Group

texts.en:
Safia is a caring lady, preferring to stay at home and carry out her responsibilities as a housewife. She has 4 sons and 3 daughters. Four of them are studying at a nearby school while the others stay at home. Safia's husband is a private entrepreneur who operates a fruit selling business. He sells fruits from a shop located in the very busy market of Samundri, offering fresh seasonal fruits to his clients. By having a shop in the busiest market, he faces high competition every day with other fruit shops. To compete with them and become more successful than them, he has to keep his shop up-to-date with seasonal fruits to fulfill the timely needs of his customers and to make them his permanent customers.  

Safia has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner Asasah for the betterment of her husband’s business. He will use the loan money to purchase fresh seasonal fruits in bulk to sell to his customers. Safia is hopeful that an investment will help her husband increase his sales and income. She is a regular lender with Asasah and this is her 4th loan application. In previous loan years, she has established a good credit record by paying her installments on time.   

Note: In the photo, Safia is holding a book (the Asasah Passbook).

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruits to sell

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has operated a beauty salon for the past two years; neighbours and passersby are her potential customers. Amina faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to build another beauty salon in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase hair weaves and pay for her business license. She decided to join Yehu because of its good reputation in the community.

loans.use: To purchase hair weaves and pay for business license

loans.name: Indira Zaida

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “BUENA ESPERANZA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Irma Cristina; ella tiene 33 años de edad y es separada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de restaurant,ella atiende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,ella prepara diferentes platos típicos cusqueños como lechon,lomo saltado,caldo de gallina entre otros platos,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el servicio de restaurant.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar para el restaurant.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Irma Cristina is a member of the "BUENA ESPERANZA" (Good Hope) community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Irma Cristina is 33 years old, separated and has two children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her restaurant business.  She serves in her restaurant from 8.00am to 6.00pm.  She prepares different traditional Cusco dishes such as sucking pig, salted pork loin, chicken soup, etc.  She would like to expand and improve her restaurant service.

Irma Cristina is requesting this loan to buy products for cooking in her restaurant.  She is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy products for cooking in her restaurant

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is a 33-year-old married man with four children. He owns a house in Kasese, Uganda, with a dream of educating his children. 

He has been in a retail shop for five years and his hardships include; debtors who take too long to pay, price fluctuations and high trading license fees. 

Nonetheless, his vision is to have a wholesale shop .Edward needs the loan to buy rice, sugar and cassava flour for sale.

loans.use: Buying rice, sugar and cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn A. is 50 years old, married and has three school-aged children. She is from the village of Gata, a part of Jimenez municipality in Misamis Occidental province on the Mindanao islands. Jocelyn operates a fish business that involves buying and selling fish in the market. Jocelyn has been in business for over six years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Jocelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to its financial services. Jocelyn successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC that was used for capital to start her business. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan, her third from GDMPC, of 7,000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Erminda Ysabel

texts.es:
Erminda es soltera, tiene 34 años de edad y tiene un hijo de 10 años de edad. Viven en casa propia en el distrito de La Victoria, a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque. 

Se dedica a la crianza da patos en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Ella los alimenta de granos y pastos naturales, y cuando los patos ya han alcanzado un buen tamaño y peso ideal, ella los vende todas las semanas a distintos restaurantes que se ubica en su distrito. 

A Erminda le gustaría contruir nuevos corrales y asi ampliar el número de los corrales logrando un buen desarrollo. Actualmente, cuenta con ocho corrales y desea conseguir mucho más con su crédito. Para lograr su objetivo, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1,000 nuevos soles.

 Erminda es muy trabajadora y cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales.
texts.en:
Erminda is 34 years old, single, and has a ten year old son. They live in their own home in the District of La Victoria, which is twenty minutes away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

Erminda raises ducks in an area behind her home. She feeds them grains and natural grasses. When the ducks have reached the right size and ideal weight, she sells them on a weekly basis to different restaurants in her district.

Erminda enjoys building new pens so that she can increase her numbers and achieve a well-developed business. She currently has eight pens and wants to use her loan to continue building more. To accomplish this goal, she is requesting from Edpyme Alternativa a loan in the amount of 1000 PEN.

Erminda is an extremely hard worker and presents very good personal and business references.

loans.use: Build new pens for her ducks

loans.name: Clara

texts.en:
Clara P. is from the village of Brgy. Bagahabag, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 51 years old, married and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, Clara owns a general store where she sells daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste to the local community. Clara has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

In 2011, Clara joined ASKI to gain access to financial services with the hopes of improving her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Clara is requesting her first loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use any additional revenue generated from her business to improve the living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste for resale

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna S. is from the village of Calabayan in Ozamiz City. She is 53 years old and married. To make a living, Edna owns and operates a business of raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $75 a month for these activities.

In 2007, Edna joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. 

Edna is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase piglets and feeds. This will be her 4th loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and feed for them.

loans.name: Vergie

texts.en:
Vergie M. is from the village of Bantuanon, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 42 years old, separated from her spouse and has six adult-aged children. To make a living, Vergie owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising vermi worms to produce vermi products. She also buys and sells dried fish. Vergie has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Vergie joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase additional vermi worms. Vergie is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase feed for the vermi worms. This loan will be her second from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her vermi worms

loans.name: Kokouvi

texts.fr: Père de 05 enfants, monsieur Kokouvi est marié à une revendeuse et à 40ans. Il est soudeur .Vu que ce métier ne marche pas comme il le souhaite, il a préféré ajouter à cette profession la vente de céréales (haricots, maïs qu’il conserve dans les bidons de 25l). Il a démarré en 1996, s’approvisionne à Anié(environ 205km de Lomé) et revend à Adakpamé (un quartier  du Togo). Il n’a pas eu de problème pour rembourser le premier  prêt et il est à sa seconde demande  et désire ce montant pour acheter des céréales  pour vendre afin d’avoir plus de bénéfice et de mieux s’occuper  de sa famille.
texts.en:
Father of five, Mr.Kokouvi is married married to a retail marketeer. He is forty.

He is a welder. 

Considering this trade does not go as he wishes it, he preferred to add to this profession the sale of cereals (beans, corn which he preserves in 25 liter cans).

He started in 1996, is supplied in Anié (approximately 205km from Lome) and resells in Adakpamé (a district of Togo).

He did not have a problem repaying  the first loan and is making his second request.

He wants this amount to buy cereals to sell in order to have more benefit and to better deal with its family.

loans.use: To buy beans and maize

loans.name: Lennie

texts.en:
Lennie is married, with 2 children in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lennie is 30 years old.  She has a ready-to-wear business in the Philippines. Lennie requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more ready-to-wear clothing to sell.

Lennie has been in this business for 2 years.  In the future, Lennie would like to do some home improvements.

loans.use: to purchase more ready-to-wear clothing to sell

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa M. sells bags of charcoal in Amoanda near Elmina. She is a single parent taking care of four children. She is responsible for the well-being of her home. 

Her loan will be used to buy bags of charcoal to meet the demands of her customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to build a storehouse where she can keep the charcoal.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal to meet the demands of her customers.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel es un padre de familia de 30 años de edad, él vive junto a su esposa y su pequeño hijo de 4 años en casa de sus padres en el distrito de Guadalupe en Pacasmayo – La Libertad. 

Miguel se dedica a la compra y venta de gas para cocina. Él lo reparte a domicilio y este trabajo le ha ayudado a mantener a su familia. Sin embargo, Miguel tiene deseos de ampliar su negocio pues quiere mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y tener una casa propia.

Miguel solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que invertirá en su negocio, comprando más balones de gas para venderlos y poder ampliar su clientela, esto le traerá consigo mayores ganancias para mejorar su calidad de vida. Miguel aspira a ser el mayor proveedor de gas en toda su zona y sabe que poco a poco lo logrará.

Miguel pudo realizar su negocio gracias al financiamiento de nuestra entidad, es un cliente que cancela sus pagos puntualmente.
texts.en:
Miguel is a 30 year-old father who lives together with his wife and 4 year-old son in his parents' home, in Guadalupe district, in Pacasmayo - La Libertad.

Miguel buys and sells cooking gas.  He makes home deliveries and this work has helped him to support his family.  However, he would like to expand his business as he would like to improve his family's quality of life and own his own home.

Miguel is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa which he will invest in his business, buying more gas cylinders to sell so that he can expand his customer base.  This will bring with it more profits so that he can improve his quality of life.  Miguel aspires to become the biggest gas supplier in his area and he knows that he will gradually achieve this goal.

Miguel was able to set up his business thanks to a loan from our institution.  He is a client who repays his loans on time.

loans.use: to buy gas cylinders

loans.name: Catherin

texts.es: Catherin, de 31 año reside en la comunidad de Palomar (selva central peruana), ahí conformó su familia junto a Moisés, su esposo, desde hace 9 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Jonatan y Valeria a los que quiere y cuida con mucho amor y cariño. El trabajo de está laboriosa mujer se centra en varias actividades económicas paralelas, su lema es “el trabajo arduo”. Desde muy niña sus padres le enseñaron a ganarse la vida; desde entonces aprendió a trabajar la tierra y vivir de ella. Hace 5 años que comenzó a sembrar café, plátanos y palta en sus terrenos propios desde entonces cuidó de sus cultivos, fertilizando, podando y limpiando constantemente. Todo ello gracias al apoyo de su esposo, quien es su mano derecha. Paralelo a ello abrió hace poco una tienda de comestibles, donde vende productos de primera necesidad a los pobladores de su localidad. Además de dedicar un poco de su tiempo en la enseñanza a niños menores en el jardín del estado. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder comercializar su cosecha junto a su esposo, quien negocia bien el precio de venta en una cooperativa de café de la ciudad de La Merced. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Aroma de café” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Catherin de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de productos de primera necesidad para surtir su tienda de comestibles.
texts.en:
Catherin, 31, lives in Palomar (in the central Peruvian forests) with Moisés, her husband of nine years.  They have two children: Jonatan and Valeria, whom they love very much.  This enterprising woman does various forms of work at the same time; her motto is "hard work."  She was taught to earn her living at an early age:  she learned how to work the land and live off of it.  Five years ago, she began to cultivate coffee, bananas, and avocados on their  land, and since then, she has always taken care of the crops, fertilizing them, trimming them, and cleaning them constantly.  Her husband is her right hand man in all of this.  On top of her farming, she recently opened a grocery store, where she sells staples to the people in her area.  In addition, she dedicates a bit of her time to teaching young children at the state kindergarten.  What she likes best about her work is selling her harvest with her husband, who is good at negotiating the sale price to a coffee cooperative in the city of La Merced.  

Catherin is a member of the "Aroma de café" ("The Smell of Coffee") community bank.  This is her first loan with MFP.  She will invest the money in buying staples to stock her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy staples to stock her grocery store.

loans.name: Douglas

texts.en:
Douglas is 34 years old and married to Regina, and they are blessed with two children of nine years and four years.  He has been operating his shoe business for the past seven years. 

He has been loaned KES 40,000 by KADET Ltd. This is his second loan from KADET. He intends to use his loan to purchase stock of shoes and also tailoring material for his second line of business.

He plans to use the profit from his businesses to buy pay school fees for his children and also improve the living standards for his family.

In the future, he hopes to open up a big shop.

loans.use: To add more stock of shoes.

loans.name: Maria Gabriela

texts.es:
Gabriela nació en la ciudad del Cusco (Perú), tiene 51 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene un hijo. Actualmente, Gabriela vive en la misma ciudad donde nació junto con su hijo y su pareja. Gabriela es secretaria y trabaja en el área administración de una universidad. Ya son 33 años que se dedica a este trabajo y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su Labor. En esta oportunidad Gabriela requiere el préstamo para uso personal y desea para la educación de su hijo osea para pagar su matricula del colegio.   

La socia es una persona responsable y trabajadora que por esas cualidades sus compañeras le invitaron a participar del banco comunal la “Mosoq Allpa” de la Asociación Arariwa.
texts.en:
Gabriela was born in the city of Cusco, Peru.  She is 51 years old, married, and has one child.  Gabriela currently lives in the same city where she was born along with her son and her partner.  She works in administration as a secretary at a university.  Gabriela has been employed for 33 years and has done very well in her job.  

She is taking this opportunity to request a loan for personal use.  Gabriela wants to provide for her child’s education.  

She is a responsible and hardworking individual.  It is because of these qualities that her fellow group members invited her to participate in the “Mosoq Allpa” Communal Bank, which is part of Asociación Araiwa.

loans.use: to pay for her child's tuition

loans.name: Enes

texts.en:
Enes is married with 7 children all going to school, save for the last one. She has been in farming for the last 18 years doing mixed farming and selling maize, vegetables, tomatoes and milk to the local market.

Enes has made a loan request of 100,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a water pump and poultry birds. She says the loan will improve her children's well-being as well as improve her second hand retail business. She is focusing on owning five dairy cows. This is Enes second loan request with Juhudi.

She, too, laments on the poor prices for her products as a challenge in farming.

loans.use: to purchase a water pump and buy poultry birds

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en:
Maria Fe is 47 years old and married with five children. With one child in school, Maria Fe works very hard to provide for her family.

Maria Fe runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell to customers.

Maria Fe has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as detergent, soap and groceries. 

In the future Maria Fe would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell to customers.

loans.name: Cotilda

texts.en:
Cotilda lives in Uganda. She is single and has four children, all of whom are in school. She has a business of selling charcoal. She has been in this business for four years, and works seven days out of every week. 
Cotilda sells her products at the market. She has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. Her main business challenges include the ever-increasing price of clothes and the seasonality of her sales. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start importing second-hand clothes and also to be a wholeseller. 
Cotilda lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and running water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Alvard

texts.en:
Alvard resides in the village of Isahakyan in the Shirak region of Armenia.  She is married with three sons (twenty, twenty-four and twenty-six years old).  She has a college degree with training as an economist.  With limited employment opportunities in her field, she has been a self-employed farmer for the past twenty years.  

Alvard is looking for a loan to purchase seeds for the autumn planting.  She expects this investment to increase the family income by twenty percent.  It will also increase her investment in the farm by forty percent.  She is pleased with microfinance services and products as everything is well organized.  She enjoys her life in Isahakyan; the village is tranquil and the air if fresh. She hopes her children will have happy lives and is looking forward to grandchildren.

loans.use: to purchase seeds

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a married woman with two children who graduated from school. They live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are clothing and food for the family.

For the past 10 years, she has operated a tailoring business, selling clothes to her neighbors and passersby. She dreams of expanding her business to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KSHS 80,000, she wants to purchase cloth materials for her tailoring business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase cloth materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Ronita

texts.en:
Ronita is a 43-year-old married woman with 2 children. 

She farms for a living and grows rice and vegetables to sell in her community. 

Ronita does her best to help provide for her family's daily needs. 

She requests a loan to purchase seedlings and fertilizers.  

Ronita hopes to improve her family’s living situation from her income from her business.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina works hard to support her family. Rosalina is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Rosalina requested a PHP 21000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fishing net.

Rosalina has been in this business for 40 years now.

In the future, Rosalina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional fishing net

loans.name: Mabothraneh Group

texts.en:
Isatu is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Isatu was born in Portloko, a town in northern Sierra Leone. She is 46 years of old. Isatu is a widow and has one child who is no longer attending school. She sells medicines and has been running this business for many years now. 

With help from this loan, Isatu and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Isatu will use her share of the loan (1,000,000 SLL) to buy drugs like panadols, paracetamols, etc. to add to her drug store.

loans.use: to buy drugs like panadols, paracetamols, etc. to add to her drug store

loans.name: Batsaihan

texts.en: Batsaihan is 44 years old and lives with his wife in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic tent, in Hovd province, Mongolia. He has a transportation business, which he started in 1996. Now he transports people and also collects firewood, which his wife then sells. Now that winter is approaching, the demand for firewood is high, and he needs to meet the demand in order to run his business successfully. Batsaihan is a sharp and hardworking man who says, "I always look for an opportunity for business, and I will do everything I can in order to support my family." He is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) to buy firewood.

loans.use: To buy firewood for resale

loans.name: Pablita

texts.en:
Pablita is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Pablita has a shop that sells bananas & coconuts. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy coconuts & bananas.

Pablita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Pablita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts & bananas.

loans.name: Nilda Angelica

texts.es:
La Sra. Nilda pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Riojanitas”, del Distrito y Provincia de Rioja, Departamento de San Martín. Está Casada, tiene 63  años y 03 hijos (2 varones de 40 y 32 años) y una hija de 36 años, todos independientes. Desde muy pequeña se dedicaba a la elaboración de bocaditos como bizcochuelos, rosquitas de almidón y huawillos, pues su mamá se dedicaba a lo mismo, ella fue quien le enseño; además de eso también se dedica a la confección de sombreros de paja y esteras, por las noches  vende  humitas, juanes y tamales (comida típica de la zona). Su esposo también le apoya en éste negocio. Se inició con un capital de  S/. 20.00 nuevos soles.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 1,500.00,  comprará ingredientes como almidón, un saco de azúcar, kilos de choclos, leña, dos latas de manteca, sacos de arroz, aderezos, hoja de bijao, maíz.
Nilda  es una mujer trabajadora,  su sueño es que su negocio siga creciendo, está muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindar la oportunidad a mujeres como ella y así poder hacer realidad sus sueños.
texts.en:
Nilda belongs to the “Las Riojanitas” communal bank in Rioja District and Province, San Martín Department.  She’s married, 63 years old and has three children, two boys who are 40 and 32 and a 36-year-old daughter; all of them are independent.

Since childhood she’s been making snacks like bizcochuelos, rosquitas de almidón and huawillos [traditional baked snacks] because her mother was in the same occupation and she taught her.  Besides that, she also makes straw hats and mats and at night sells humitas, juanes and tamales (foods typical of the area).  Her husband helps her with this business.  She started out with an initial capital of 20 new soles.  With this 1500 new sol investment she will buy ingredients like flour, a sack of sugar, kilos of corn on the cob, firewood, two cans of shortening, sacks of rice, spices, bijao leaves and corn.

Nilda is an enterprising woman.  Her dream is that her business continues to grow.  She is very grateful with the Manuela Ramos Movement for providing women like her with the opportunity to make their dreams come true.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, corn on the cob, firewood, shortening, corn, etc.

loans.name: Mawa Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Mawa Group in Western Kenya! This group joined Kiva partner One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Lucy is the facilitator of the Mawa Group. She is a mother of three children. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Lucy had a good maize yield harvesting nine bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Lucy was only able to harvest four bags of maize on half an acre of land. 
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Lucy and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit, and insurance. 
With income from maize sales, Lucy will invest for future use and ensure food security. In 2012, the members of Mawa Group will each plant between half and one acre of maize.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is acquiring a loan to service a vehicle. He lives in Masindi, Uganda. He is aged 41 and married with four children. Patrick started with a motorcycle for his business and after acquiring a substantial amount, he got a loan as "top up," to complete the amount he had, and bought a car.

He dreams of buying another motor vehicle so as to generate more income from his transport business.

loans.use: to service his motor vehicle.

loans.name: Jenny Jaqueline

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Honduras 2000 se reúne cada 15 días en el cantón Jaramijo (Manta), este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que bañan las costas de este bello lugar,  aquí la mayoría de los habitantes son muy trabajadores y dedicados a las faenas del mar.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Jenny, tiene  42 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene cuatro hijos, dos mayores de edad y dos de 16 y 9 años, la menor estudia en escuela. Su esposo se dedicaba a la pesca pero ya no trabaja porque sus hijos son los que tripulan la lancha.
 
Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes. Trabaja cuatro  días de la semana y su hija le ayuda con las ventas, ella aprovecha para vender cuando llegan los pescadores de alta mar ya que vienen con buenos recursos económicos y es cuando más fácil le resulta realizar sus ventas, ella  deja sus productos  a crédito y cobra cada quince días o deja en dos partes una al inicio y otra cuando regresen de sus labores de pesca a los 15 días. Su mercadería compra en Manta cada vez que necesita, lleva tres años con su negocio y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar pantalones, camisas, camisetas, blusas y ropa interior. Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta porque gracias a uno de los créditos empezó su negocio.

Sus sueños son seguir con su negocio y salud para toda su familia.
texts.en:
El Banco Comunal Honduras 2000 meets every 2 weeks in the canton of Jaramijo (Manta). This place is known for its beautiful beaches that line the coasts of this beautiful place. Here most of the people work in maritime pursuits.

In this place we meet Jenny. She is 42 years old, married, and has 4 children, 2 are adults and the 2 younger ones are 16 and 9 years old. The youngest is a school student. Her husband is a fisherman but does not work because his children crew the boat.

She works selling all types of clothing. She sells door to door and also sells to her clients who come to her home. She works 4 days of the week and her daughter helps her with the sales. She takes advantage of the opportunity of selling when the fishermen return from the open sea as they have good financial resources and it is when it is the easiest to make sales. She leaves her products on credit and collects every fifteen days or in two parts, one initial payment and the other when the fishermen return from two weeks at sea.

She buys her merchandise in Manta each time it is necessary. She has been in the business for three years and is doing very well.

This loan is to buy pants, shirts, t-shirts, blouses and underwear. 

She is a founding member of the communal bank and she likes it because thanks to one of the loans she began her business.

Her dreams are to continue with her business and health for all her family.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, blouses, and underwear

loans.name: Math

texts.en:
Mrs. Math lives in Reussey Keo commune, Phnom Penh. This is a public gathering area where Muslims prefer to live and work. She is now 60 and a good mother of seven children. The main source of her income is from her husband, who is a fisherman, and four employed children who work in various jobs. 

Math intends to start a fish-selling business. In doing so, she’ll be able to earn and contribute income to better her standard of living. However, Math will need additional funding from lenders to buy stock of fish to sell. Therefore, she is requesting her third loan from Kiva to purchase the stock of fish from her suppliers. 

She will use the remaining funds to buy some fishing materials to support her husband’s business. She hopes that her family will advance over the previous years, as her business gets successful and she strives to work hard.

loans.use: to purchase stock of fish from her suppliers.

loans.name: Mathaa

texts.en:
Mathaa is 62 years old and married with four children. 

She sells vegetables, tomatoes, and potatoes to earn a living. She also earns extra income from her farming activities. She describes her business environment as favorable because there is less competition.

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Mathaa has been able to save her income. She hopes to expand her business to a wholesale in the future. She has applied for a loan of 10,000 Kenya Shillings (KES) to buy vegetables, tomatoes, and potatoes.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, tomatoes, and potatoes.

loans.name: Rosaline's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Rosaline est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Rosaline âgée de 56 ans a très fréquenté peu l’école. Rosaline est mariée à certain Toussaint. Le couple a cinq enfants, dont certains scolarisés et deux à leur charge. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Rosaline et son mari. Pour cette raison, Rosaline vend des pâtes alimentaires, des savons, de biscuits et des vivres dans sa région de trente ans ; ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Rosaline s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Rosaline sollicite ensemble avec les membres de son groupe, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des pâtes alimentaires, des savons, de biscuits et des vivres.

loans.name: Letty

texts.en:
Letty owns a carpentry and furniture making business. While she was living with her husband at his mother’s house, she learned the business from her brother in law. When her brother in law left to start his own business on the other side of the city, Letty bought all the equipment off of him in order to run the business herself. She hired two workers and brought her husband into the business to help her as well. She knows the trade well, although most of her job entails purchasing the materials and finding buyers for the finished product.

Letty needs this loan in order to buy a tool that will allow her to give her products a more professional finish. She hopes that with this investment she can improve the quality of her work and increase sales.

Letty and her husband have one child together. He now works at a shipyard in Guayaquil and helps out in the household and in the business. Her dream is to have her own home one day and run her shop out of theire.

loans.use: Letty needs this loan in order to buy a tool that will allow her to give her products a more professional finish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Frying Puff-Puffs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Naomi intends buy and grow more vegetables for resale

loans.name: Mayil

texts.en: Mayil A. lives in Beylagan. He makes his living repairing old and broken watches. Mayil has been engaged in this job since 1987 and currently has a small booth in the Beylagan city bazaar. He would like to increase the area of his booth, and has therefore asked the Normicro Beylagan Branch for a loan of US$1,000.

loans.use: Expansion of business

loans.name: Bertha Alicia

texts.es:
Bertha is separated and has 4 kids. The youngest two (24 and 19 years odl) live with her. Her husband abandoned them 15 years ago and, in order to raise their kids, she had to start working. She decided to start selling used clothes and her employer at the time (she was a domestic employee) gave her the financial backing to start her business. She originally got clothes from her employer, but then she became independent. She now has many clients and she has been able to bring up her kids. It is a lot of effort, but she wants to keep going so that her 2 youngest can finish their education.

Bertha would like a loan of $325 to buy merchandise so that her business can grow and go forward. She will repay it in 3 months. She thanks you for your support.

Translated by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Bertha es una mujer separada, tiene 4 hijos de los cuales solo 2 viven con ella y son los más pequeños de 24 y 19 años de edad, su esposo los abandono hace 15 años atrás y fue por eso que para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos se vio en la necesidad de trabajar y decidió poner su negocio de venta de ropa usada, ella empezó como empleada doméstica y su patrona fue la que la ayudo con algo de dinero para que ella pudiera comenzar con su negocio y así lo hizo, ya que inicialmente ella le conseguía la ropa a su patrona, pero luego se independizo, ahora ella a tiene varios clientes y ha podido sacar adelante a sus hijos con su esfuerzo, pero desea continuar con su negocio para terminar de educar a sus dos últimos hijos.

Bertha está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 325 para poder comprar más mercadería y así poder continuar con su negocio y salir adelante como lo ha ido haciendo, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 3 meses. Ella te agradece mucho el apoyo que le brindas.

loans.use: To buy merchandise/Compra de mercaderia

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena is a married 34 year old woman. She has been married to her husband for about 15 years and they have a son. Elena dedicates to the preparation and sale of meals at a taxi-trufis central base. Her husband has a car which he works in the same line of taxi-trufi. It is the most important one of Villa.Pagador

She has been selling food for many years and she and her husband are very well known in the area, especially by the people of the line of taxi-trufis. They have very good personal references. There is a low competition for Elena’s business because of it’s location. It is located in the taxi-trufis central, so it is easier for all the taxi-trufi drivers to consume her products. In addition that she has an excellent and extroverted character that helps to have lots of clients, even from other taxi lines.

She is asking for a loan of U$550 to buy supplies for her business such as rice, spaghettis, potatoes, etc. She has had two previous loans with an average of low delay, in general she demonstrated to have good behavior so a second loan was granted to her.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer.

Elena es una señora casada de 34 años de edad, su familia la compone su esposo y un hijo, ambos llevan casados aproximadamente 15 años. Elena se dedica a la preparación y venta de comidas en una parada de taxi-trufis y el esposo tiene un auto con el que trabaja como chofer en la misma línea de taxi-trufi que el la más importante de Villa Pagador. La venta de comida tiene muchos años funcionando, aparte que tanto Elena como su esposo son muy conocidos en la zona y sobre todo con las personas de la línea de taxi-trufis, ya que tienen muy buenas referencias personales de esta pareja. El nivel de competencia de Elena es relativamente bajo ya que su puesto se encuentra justo en la parada de taxi-trufis, entonces es suceptible a que todos los choferes consuman sus productos, además que el excelente caracter extrovertido de Elena hace que su puesto esté lleno de clientes, sean estos de la misma línea u otros. La presente solicitud es para la adquisición al por mayor de productos para su negocio, productos que son categorizados de primera necesidad, como ser arroz (quintales), fideo, carga de papa, etc. La cliente tiene dos créditos anteriores en la institución con un promedio de retraso bajo, en general demostró tener un buen comportamiento por lo que se le otorgó un crédito paralelo.

loans.use: TO BUY SUPPLIES

loans.name: Tita

texts.en: Tita is 18 years old and has a small shop where she sells snacks, household goods, cigarettes, rice and many other things. She can earn US$8 per day, due to the amount and variety of goods in stock. Tita requests a US$75 loan to fill her shop. Her husband, F., doesn't have a fixed income and only does odd jobs. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To fill her shop with more inventory

loans.name: Huu Thang

texts.vi:
His main income comes from his work as a woodworker. He also raises pigs at home. His wife sells recycled waste metal. He wishes to improve his family living condition. He's applying for a loan of 354000 VNĐ (25 USD) to buy mash for his pigs, make them grow big and meaty thus selling for a good price.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Công việc tạo thu nhập của anh thắng là chăn nuôi lợn và làm nghề mộc. Chị nhà thì đi chợ đồng nát. Với mong muốn nâng cao đời sống gia đình, gia đình anh vay 354000VNĐ để mua cám cho lợn, tăng năng suất, cho chất lượng thịt tốt, bán được nhiều và giá cao hơn.

loans.use: To buy mash

loans.name: Fatuma's Nyota Group

texts.en:
Fatuma S., age 39, is married with 4 children (17, 14, 11, and 3 years old). Fatuma owns a clothing business, which she started 12 years ago. Working from 7am-3pm daily, she earns about $43 a month from this business.

Fatuma hopes for a loan to buy more clothing to sell. Fatuma belongs to the loan group called Nyota and will be sharing this loan with subgroup members Ashura J. and Zubeda S.. These women have businesses dealing in snacks, and fruit and vegetable sales.

loans.use: To buy clothing stock (inventory)

loans.name: Kiyinki B1West B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Hamida L.. She is currently in the business of selling fish and is requesting a loan to add more capital. Hamida is 21 years old and is married with a husband who sells fuel for work. She has 1 son aged 4 who goes to school. Each week, Hamida makes approximately UGX 20000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children.

Hamida is joined in her small group by Mwajuma N., Amina S., Florence N., and Bayati N.. Mwajuma N. has a business in clothing sales and wants to purchase more clothes to sell. Amina S. is currently operating a business selling fuel and wants a loan to expand business. Florence N. operates a business in clothing sales and wants to increase stock. Bayati N. is currently in the business of selling rice and fuel and is requesting a loan to add more to her rice business.

loans.use: To add working capital to fish business and expand it

loans.name: Onyinye

texts.en: Mrs. Onyinye N. is a business oriented woman, having the strong desire to diversify her business. She is 36years of age and hails from ijaniki,Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells drinks and sachet pure water. "I would like to sell underwear in another shop with this Kiva loan", says Onyinye. She believes with strong conviction that she can grow her business which will enable her to increase her profit margin. Onyinye acquired the skill for 1 year and she has been in  business since 2001. She needs a loan of $875. With the loan she can buy more drinks and sachet water for sale and also diversify and sell underwear. She says thanks to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and Sachet water and sell underwear.

loans.name: Robi's Mafanikio Group

texts.en:
Robi, age 33, is married with three children (ages 7, 4, and 2). She has been running a fruit and vegetable stand since 2000 and a small charcoal business since 2004. From her sales, she makes a total monthly profit of about $190. She works from 6:30am to 8pm daily in order to support her home.

In the past, Robi has taken 3 loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to buy more charcoal, fruit, and vegetables, and to build a small house. Having paid them back successfully, she now hopes for a new loan for the same purpose. She will share this loan with her subgroup, whose members sell chickens, clothing, fruit, and general items. They belong to a loan group whose member guarantee one another in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Robi is standing on the right.

loans.use: To buy fruit and vegetables and to continue construction on her new home

loans.name: Thomasi

texts.en:
Thomasi is a 34-year-old resident of Chanika in Dar Es Salaam. He has been in business for the past five years operating a shop selling Lake Victoria smoked fish and other food items.
He is now in need of a loan to help expand his business.

loans.use: To expand the business.

loans.name: Víctor Andrés

texts.es:
Victor is a young man who eagerly works as a motorcycle driver. He leaves very early in the morning to take students to their schools and all kinds of other people to their places of business. With this job he can help his relatives with family expenses. At the moment he has no desire to get married, so he wants to have some stability for his parents and then later start building his own home.

Victor wishes to acquire a new motorcycle, which will allow his parents to work with him and help satisfy the household's necessities, namely those of his little brothers. To achieve this end he is requesting a loan that he will use as a down payment for a new motorcycle. He hopes that you will lend a helping hand so he can realize his dreams and bring some economic stability to his family.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Víctor es un joven que trabaja con mucho ahínco con su motocarro, sale muy de mañana para trasladar a los escolares a sus respectivos centros educativos y a las diversas personas a sus respectivos lugares de trabajo. Con esta actividad Víctor puede ayudar a sus familiares en los gastos de su hogar, por ello, que por el momento no desea casarse, hasta ver a sus padres estables, luego de eso, con tranquilidad podrá iniciar la construcción de su propio hogar. Víctor desea adquirir un nuevo motocarro, el cual puedan sus padres ayudarle a cuidar y trabajar, para así, satisfacer las necesidades dentro de su hogar, sobre todo con sus hermanos pequeños. Para este fin requiere de un préstamo para poder dar como inicial de un nuevo motocarro. Espera que usted le pueda tender una mano amiga para realizar su deseo de brindarle una estabilidad económica a sus padres.

loans.use: Purchase a new motorcycle so his parents can work with him and improve the quality of life for his younger brothers / Comprar un nuevo motocarro para que sus padres puedan trabajar junto a él y lograr una mejor calidad de vida para sus hermanos menores.

loans.name: Sayda Asucena

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Sayda Sánchez and I work selling products that are commonly consumed every day.  I am 32 years old.  My business is located in the San Miguel neighborhood of Tegucigalpa.  This business generates income to be able to sustain my home and my family because my husband is in another country and it’s up to me to cover all of the expenses.  

At this time I need monetary assistance in order to have a wider variety of products to sell.  I want to start selling meats and dairy products because in our neighborhoo there are no supermarkets nearby.  People tell me to sell meats so that they don’t have to go all the way to the supermarket.  With this type of sale of products, my business is going to grow a lot and, because it is the only source of income I have, things will go much better for my son and me.  Thank you for your help.Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.



hola mi nombre es Sayda S. me dedico a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tengo 32 años de edad, mi negocio esta ubicado en la colonia San Miguel en la capital, este negocio me genera ingresos para poder sustentar mi hogar y mi familia, ya que mi esposo esta en otro pais y a mi me toca cubrir con todos los gastos, 
en estos momentos necesito una ayuda monetaria para poder tener mas variedad en los productos que venda ya que quiero empezar a vender carnes y lacteos ya que en nuestra colonia no hay supermercados cerca y la gente me dice que venda carnes para que ellos no tengar que ir hasta el supermercado.
con este tipo de venta de producto mi negocio va a crecer mucho y como es la unica fuente de ingresos que tengo pues nos iria mejor a mi y a mi hijo.
gracias por su ayuda.

loans.use: Purchase soft drinks, churros, crackers, basic grains, toilet paper, dairy products, meats (pork, beef and chicken), light bulbs, pills, sanitary napkins, envelopes, paper, pens, candy, lard, cooking oil, bread, sweet breads, matches and batteries.

loans.name: Ashura

texts.en:
Ashura is 48 years old. She is married with 3 children aged 30,15, and 10 years old. She owns a beauty salon and she has been a clothes (vitenge--traditional Tanzanian clothing) seller since 2003. Every day, she works from 9am to 9pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about US$ 200 from her sales.

Ashura is now looking for a loan to buy more items to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more salon items and clothes (vitenge) to expand her business

loans.name: Ancelma

texts.es:
Ancelma Ramírez C. tiene casa propia en la zona de Las Lomas, vive con sus dos hijos pues su esposo trabaja en otra ciudad por lo que solo se encuentra con la familia una vez al mes.  Ancelma es empleada de limpieza en domicilios particulares.
La vivienda es bastante antigua y fue construida un metro delante de la línea vial municipal, por lo que los vecinos le están exigiendo la respectiva nivelación con el fin de recibir apoyo municipal para el mejoramiento vial de la zona.
El crédito será usado para demoler el muro frontal de la casa para ingresar a línea municipal.
texts.en:
Ancelma Ramírez C. has her own home in the Las Lomas neighborhood. She lives with her two children as her husband works in another city and he only visits his family once per month. Ancelma is employed as a cleaning woman in private homes. Her home is rather old and was constructed one meter over the municipal road boundary line, so her neighbors are demanding that her property come into compliance so that they will all be able to receive municipal support to improve the neighborhood’s road. The loan will be used to demolish the front facade wall of her home to bring her home into compliance on the boundary lines.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home refurbishment

loans.name: Ni Komang Dami

texts.id:
Untuk periode ke II Ni Komang Dami mempergunakan dana pinjaman dari Yayasan Dinari untuk menambah modal usaha warungnya.Usaha warungnya menjual bermacam-macam bahan makanan pokok, keperluan alat- alat sekolah  dan alat- alat keperluan rumah tangga. Ni Komang Dami membuka warungnya pada pukul 06.00 pagi dan ditutup pukul 09.00 malam. Selain menunggui warung Ni Komang Dami dapat mengerjakan pekerjaan dirumahnya sebab warung terletak didepan rumahnya.

Untuk melengakapi warungnya, Ni Komang Dami setiap tiga hari berbelanja di dipasar, selain itu juga ada beberapa barang yang selalu diantar oleh rekan kerjanya.  Saat ini komang Ni Komang Dami tinggal bersama suami dan kedua orang anaknya yang sudah bekerja dan sekolah pada tingkat atas. Keuntungan bersih dari usaha warungnya dapat mencapai Rp. 40.000,- s/d Rp.60.000,- per hari. Dengan keuntungan inilah Ni Komang Dami mencukupi keperluan sehari-harinya bersama dengan suaminya dan kedua anaknya.
texts.en:
For this 2nd loan period, Ni Komang Dami used the loan money from Dinari foundation to add working capital to expand her mini mart stall. Her mini mart business sells various goods such as cooking ingredients, rice, snacks, school stationaries, and daily household necessities. She opens her stall from 6 am to 9 pm. On top of that she also does her duty as a housewife by doing daily house chores.

She usually goes to the market once every 3 days to buy stock/ inventories for her stall. Some of the goods are also delivered by the agents. At the moment she lives with her husband and their 2 children. She can earn a net profit of IDR 40 thousand to 60 thousand / day (around USD 5-7/ day). With this she can help to ease the family's economic burdens.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To add working capital (Menambah modal usaha)

loans.name: Denise

texts.en:
Denise D. was born in 1973 in Adja and is married to a mechanic named Andre Noumon. She has three children, two of whom are in school and one who is a baby. She has sold food for the past 17 years and has lived in Cadjehoun just outside Cotonou for 20 years. After her first loan, her business grew, and she would like another loan to keep building her business.

Née vers 1973 à Adja, elle est mariée à Noumon André mécanicien auto. Mère de 03 enfants dont 02 scolarisés et un bébé, elle intervient dans la vente vivres depuis 17 ans et réside à Cadjehoun depuis 20 ans. Avec le premier crédit où elle a vu son activité accroître, elle sollicite un crédit de 180000 pour satisfaire à la demande de plus en plus croissante de sa clientèle.

loans.use: To purchase sacs of rice, beans, corn, and other staple foods.

loans.name: Sreng

texts.en: Mrs. Sreng C. lives in Sour Sean village in Kampong Cham Province. She is a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Ors Sophorn, is a farmer who owns a piece of land where he cultivates rice to earn their living. In this plantation, he faces a small problem because his field is infertile which has a bad effect on his crop. In order to solve this problem, Mrs. Sreng C. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to amend the field to make her crop more productive. She is 54 years old and does not have any children. Her husband is with her in the picture.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her field

loans.name: Flor

texts.es:
Hace siete años Flor vio la oportunidad de abrir un negocio en su casa, pues el paradero final de una línea de transporte público queda muy cerca de su vivienda. Es asi que que luego de conseguir un poco de dinero se animo a abrir una pequeña tienda que, actualemente, es una bodegamuy surtida y que goza de la visita de muchos clientes.

Parte de las ganancias ella lo vuelve a invertir en su negocio con el fin de seguir creciendo con él. Pues ella quiere implementar su tienda con más mercadería y estantes.
texts.en:
Seven years ago Flor saw the opportunity to open a business in her house, since the final stop of a public transport route is very close to her home. After obtaining a bit of money she opened a small store that is currently a well-stocked shop visited by many customers. She reinvests part of her earnings into her business so it will keep growing, and she wants to set up her store with shelves and more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for her store

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mrs. Mao C., 40, and her husband, Mr. Chea Pen, 40, live along National Road Number One, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1985 and have six sons. One of their sons is a security guard; two sons are fishermen, and the other three are in school.

Mao and her husband have been fishing for ten years. They catch fish in the lake at the back of their house and sell them at the Koki market. Mao is requesting her first loan of $700. She will use part of the loan to purchase fishing materials and part of it she will add to her own money to buy a plot of land to build their house.

loans.use: To purchase fishing materials and to buy a plot of land

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is 35 years old and married with no children. He lives in Agbor, Delta State, Nigeria. David is a LAPO client. He needs the loan amount of N 150,000 to purchase more drinks and foodstuffs to cook and sell. He says thanks to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and foodstuffs to cook and to sell

loans.name: Urpicha Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal denominado “URPICHA”; está ubicado a 3 horas de la ciudad del Cusco, en la provincia de Quispicanchis en el distrito de Ocongate; considerado como uno de los distritos más altos de la provincia  de Cusco; dentro de su extensión se encuentra altitudes que oxidan entre los 3,300 y más de 6,000 m.s.n.m. Sus características corresponden a las del grado de “extrema pobreza”, de clima desfavorable para las actividades agrícolas.

Los socios de este banco, tienen entre sus actividades del hogar y sus otros trabajos eventuales, la crianza de ganados vacunos y la elaboración de quesos y quesillos, yogurt natural y la crianza de animales menores como (cuyes y aves de corral), los pocos socios que se dedican a la agricultura, sólo puede ser la siembra de cebada para consumo de sus animales.

Estoy socios están sumamente agradecidos con el préstamo que será otorgado y expresan su compromiso de devolución del préstamo en el tiempo programado, ya que ellos están muy concientes de que la banca financiera para estas comunidades no es accesible.
texts.en:
The village bank “URPICHA”; is located three hours form the city of Cusco in the province of Quispicanchis in the district of Ocongate; considered one the highest districts in the province of Cusco; where there are heights of between 3,300 and more than 6,000 meters. The area is characterized by extreme poverty; with a climate ill-suited to agricultural activities Bank members, in addition to taking care of their homes and any other work they can get, raise cattle and produce cheese and natural yogurt. They also raise smaller animas. The few members who farm can only grow barely for animal consumption. The members are very grateful for the loan that will be granted and give their promise to repay the loan in the time required. They are very aware that they have no access to commercial banks in their region.

Translated from Spanish by Tim Hassett, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and raise cattle and buy animal fodder

loans.name: Agasemed

texts.en:
Agasemed S. is av 33-year-old trader who sells phone accessories in the small village of Imishli. He started his business 10 years ago when he got married. When he first started this business, he was renting the store, but now he owns his store, which he purchased two years ago.

Agasemed is married and has two children. He is trying to improve his business so that he can provide the best possible education and life conditions for his children.

Agasemed is applying for a $3000 USD loan to purchase phones and start selling them in his store. This business has become is very profitable in the last two years and phones are in high demand among local people. We wish him all the best!

loans.use: To purchase phones for sale

loans.name: Rotifa

texts.ru: Ротифа и ее сестры предприниматели. На центральном рынке они имеют торговый прилавок, где они продают кондитерские изделия: пряники, кексы, печенье и тп. Ротифе 45 лет, замужем и имеет 2 детей. Муж нигде не работает и также помогает жене в ее торговле. Кондитерские изделия приобретаю здесь же на рынке у оптовиков. А за несколькими наименованиями изделий ездят на оптовые рынки в соседние рынки. Ротифа планирует увеличить товарооборот и поэтому хочет получить займ на КИВА.
texts.en:
Rotifa and her sisters are entrepreneurs. They have a shop at the central market where they sell sweets: gingerbread, muffins, cookies, etc. Rotifa is 45 years old, is married and has 2 children. Her husband does not have a job and also helps his wife with her business. They purchase the sweets at the same market from wholesalers. For several branded goods they travel to wholesale markets in neighboring markets. Rotifa plans to increase her turnover and because of this would like to get a loan on KIVA.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase turnover

loans.name: Zubeda

texts.en:
Zubeda  owns a small beauty salon in the Jang’ombe neighborhood of Zanzibar. She belongs to Kari group loan. She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $175. Daily she works at her business for twelve hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more salon items to expand her business. She is hoping that, through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business .

Zubeda is married, and has given birth into five children, now aged 20, 18, 11, 3 and 2.

loans.use: To buy more salon items, to expand her business

loans.name: Cecilia Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Cecilia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen del Rosario”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad de Queñuani, distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia de Chuchito, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 45 años edad, estado civil casada y tiene 04 hijos (todos a su cargo), y tiene estudios de primaria completa y vive en el Barrio Central de Queñuani.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos desde la fundación del Banco Comunal,  con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles.  Cecilia tiene su negocio de compra y venta de productos artesanales.  

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, para poder invertir en su actual negocio la compra y venta artesanías para luego venderlos en las ferias del la zona.

Su deseo es poder seguir trabajando para poder ayudar  a sus hijos en sus estudios.

A ella le gustan las reuniones ya que en ella se divierte mucho
texts.en:
Cecilia belongs to the "Virgen del Rosario" Community Bank, in Queñuani Community, Yunguyo district, Chuchito province, Puno department. She is 45 years old, married and the mother of 4 children (all depending on her). She has an elementary school education and lives in the central neighborhood of Queñuani. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement since the Community Bank was started. With an initial loan of 300 PEN Cecilia was able to start her business buying and selling handcrafts. She now needs to borrow 3000 PEN to invest in her current business, buying handcrafts and then selling them in area markets. She wants to be able to keep working in order to help her children with their education. She likes the meetings because she has a lot of fun there.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Kamsvaag, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of handcrafts

loans.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Rolando, 44 years old, is a local farmer in the simple place of Barangay San Vicente of Angadanan, Isabela. He manages 3.5 hectares (9 acres) of rice and corn fields. He is requesting PHP 23,000 in order to fulfill all his farming needs such as enough supply of seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and insecticides, and also his needs for manpower to make his farming easier and more productive.

Aside from farming, Rolando also helps his wife to manage her buy-and-sell business of banana products. The couple try their best to overcome different problems that come along in their life and they are thankful to God because of the blessings they receive every time.

Rolando and Helen are blessed with two children namely: Rhealyn - 14 years old, in senior high school at the moment, and Jamaica - 11 years old, who is still in the third grade of the primary level because she was in the late-development stage.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs and pay for labor

loans.name: Minyura

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Минюра , женщина которая занимается откормом и продажей скота. Ей 43 года, у неё четвера детей, муж работает разнорабочим по строительныи делам.Минюра вместе с мужем ухаживает, откармливает скот.Минюра хочет получив кредит купить ещё пару голов коров, а также корм для них.Минюра работает техничкой в областной больнице.В день мониторинга она была на работе, поэтому на снимке её дочь.
texts.en:
Minyura feeds and sells cattle. She's 43 years old, has four children, and her husband takes on odd jobs as a builder. Minyura, together with her husband, take care of and feed cattle. Minyura hopes, upon receiving credit, to purchase a couple more cows as well as some feed for them. Minyura works as a cleaner in the regional hospital. On the day of the monitoring, she was at work, and therefore, her daughter is in the photograph.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: feed and sale of cattle

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en: Letecia R. wants to improve the normal size of her harvest. She is 28 years old and has three children. To supplement their income, she also grows vegetables in their village. Currently they only have a 1.5-hectare (3.75-acre) farm. She wants to buy another farm in the future and that is why she is trying so hard to grow her business more. Letecia would like to apply for a loan of Php 5,000. She will use the loan to purchase pesticides and and insecticides for her farm. She believes that protecting the crops from pests and insects that may inflict damage and affect yield is a better way to improve her harvest. CEVI helps small businesses grow. It provides not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase pesticides and insecticides

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
Felicitas es socia del Banco Comunal Ccatarisun que significa Levantémonos en quechua.
Felicitas es casada, tiene 49 años y 4 hijos, Felicitas tiene un puesto en el mercado Mariscal Cáceres en donD. venD. desayuno todos los días.
Felicitas necesita un préstamo D. 2500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. quinua, azúcar y maca.
Los sueños D. Felicitas son mejorar su negocio y tener una tienda propia.
texts.en:
Felicitas is a member of the “Ccatarisun” (which means “Let’s raise ourselves up” in Quechua) Communal Bank. Felicitas is married, 49 years old, and has 4 children. Felicitas has a stall in the Mariscal Cáceres market when she sells breakfast every day. Felicitas needs a loan for 2500 soles to invest in buying quinoa, sugar, and maca. Felicitas dreams of improving her business and having her own store.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy quinoa, sugar, and maca.

loans.name: Morice Oruko

texts.en:
Morice Oruko is a forty three year old businessman. He is married to Pamela and they have two children aged 12 and 10 years. He runs a small cybercafe with one employee, and has been in this business for three years.

Morice learnt of KADET Ltd through a friend who is an existing client. This is his third loan from KADET Ltd and he intends to use the money to purchase one more computer and pay for more bandwidth and connectivity to ensure the internet speed is faster than it has been. Since his cafe is located where the demand for internet exceeds the availability, this will be a great step towards enjoying loyalty from his clients.

He aspires to open a computer training college.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to  relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: To purchase a computer and increase internet connectivity.
